story:
Hello world!
We are Grand Line Creations - an Atlanta independent film company! We are starting to film our first sitcom! To do so we need money.  This is why we are asking for your help.  All of the members of our company are experienced professional actors and unionized film industry people. Due to the grassroots popularity of short films we have made, we are now ready to make a pilot episode to shop to various networks.  A creative endeavor of epic proportions!

Our story is about a group of 6 college students coming of age and trying to gain perspective on their lives in the big world.  Daemon Wilburn, our main character, despite his model good looks and outgoing personality, finds himself lackluster and luck-less with women. Frustrated, he confides in his friends for support - Ethan Dawson and Emerson Blake, that he is swearing-off relationships for GOOD and becoming a chaste man!  However, after a long talk with his roommate Sebastian Clark about this new perspective on life, Fate throws him a monkey wrench when he meets who he thinks is the girl of his dreams - Melody June. Now Daemon is in love once again with what he refers to as his "manic pixie dream girl."  




20 year-old romantic idealist music student who learns to be a practical humanist.  He is Sebastian Clark's roommate. He is Ethan Dawson's best friend, and friends with Emerson Blake as well. He is melodramatic at the start; his growth over the season needs to attempt to ground him slightly. He's very childish in ways.
Daemon lives in a dream world where everything is idealistic. He is very much driven by love and believes in terms like  "Soul Mate" and "Love at first sight."
 Daemon writes a new love song everyday which he eventually ends up throwing away ever in search of the elusive "perfect love song."  Unfortunately, he also suffers from the lack of an ability to sing. Daemon's singing voice is REALLY bad and is known throughout his group of friends as "The Worst Sound To Ever Come Out Of A Human." Sadly, Daemon has no idea he can't sing, and none of his friends have the heart to tell him.

22 year-old Melody June is a fighter. She can be very rude and  abrasive. She is a big believer in human rights. She spends most of her time working and is a part-time student. She honestly believes she will change the world for the better with art.
At the age of 14, Melody suffered a brain aneurysm rupture which left her half blind in each of her eyes. The aneurysm rupture also caused damage to her ability to make short-term memories.
Melody is also a martial artist. She has been studying 5 Animal Shaolin Kung Fu from the time she was 5. Despite her handicaps, you would never be able to tell by her Kung fu moves.
Melody works at the Sensitive Barista, the group's favorite hang-out spot, and part- time as a massage therapist. Being only a part-time student leaves more time for working and hanging out with friends. 
Melody June will also become Daemon Wilburn's "manic pixie dream girl."

21 year-old college student and the best friend of Daemon Wilburn. He is dating Emerson "Emmy" Blake.  He has a child-like sense of humor about the world, and is somewhat irresponsible due to it. He hates change and dislikes conflict, often using comic books, science fiction, and comedy as a defense. His relationship with Emmy is initially good, though unexplored.
Ethan is very much a "Yes" man. He goes with the flow. His idea of a good time is just hanging out with friends. Ethan could sit in a room reading a comic book while a friend is in the same room playing video games with not a word exchanged and Ethan would be happy for hours.
Ethan is what you would call a serial monogamist. Being so sweet and afraid of change makes him really good at maintaining relationships that last for a long time.

19 year-old goal-oriented and success-hungry student who learns life is more of a balancing act (that necessitates sacrifices).
Emmy would be considered the most realistic member of this group until she loses her temper. She is by far the most understanding. She can take any situation, analyze it and come up with a perfect solution -- unless it's her own life. She is super involved with school, and at times overwhelmed with too many projects.
Despite getting stressed too easily, she always finds time to be with Ethan. Emmy loves Ethan to the nth degree. She spends most of her time with him and in turn she doesn't really know any of the other members that well. If not for Ethan, she would probably stay in her dorm room and study all day. You could say Ethan is her access to the rest of the world.

19 year-old small-town girl from South Dakota. She has come to the big city for school but is suffering culture shock. Norah is very naive about the complexity and sophistication of city life and finds it very hard to adjust to the coldness and alienation sometimes apparent in an urban atmosphere.
Despite the fact that Norah is a little lost most of the time, she is an amazing dancer.  However, none of her friends in the group really know this fact about her as she lacks the competitive drive and self-conscious bravado, at first, to make her talents known.  After only a week in the big city, although still not urbanized, she nonetheless seeks to overcompensate for this fact by running for president of every club at school she finds.  In the future, she will do an about-face in her life, and through experiences that put her through the fire, she will end up a CEO of company.  However, she does not know this yet and still lives in her small-town mind.

20 year-old aloof intellectual who must learn to open himself up and become one of the guys.
Sebastian is a proud gay man. He truly believes himself to be the smartest man on the planet. He is easily annoyed by the crude provinciality of most people.  For him, a typical day at home finds him dressing in something "fancy," sitting around the house in front of the fireplace, reading a cerebral book, and drinking the finest green tea in the world.
He has shared a dorm room with Daemon at college for 2 years now. At first, Sebastian hated Daemon more than Hitler. In his mind at least Hitler could paint a beautiful picture! As the years went by, Sebastian become very fond of Daemon and found some small love for him hidden deep down inside himself.
Sebastian has many lovers he brings around. None of them ever last because they just can't measure up to his intellect in his own mind.

To better understand the characters, we have filmed a short promo to show their personalities - a slice in the life of these 6 friends.


With lots of visual effects and over-the-top comedy, we are looking toward making a creative sitcom drawing influences from the feature film Scott Pilgrim vs The World, Friends, Coupling and Community!

Before Waiting Line,  we made a short film about Ethan Dawson before he met Emerson Blake. This short gives you an indication of what we can create in 8 days on a budget of only $6000.


Making a sitcom costs money. This is where we really need your help. We are asking for $100,000.00 in funding to produce a pilot to shop to networks. (Believe it or not, that's not a lot as film budgets go; every penny is necessary.) 

This money goes toward several things, including but not limited to:
Actor compensation - "the Talent," as we call them on set. They're the ones with the ability to make the entire project believable and successful.They are, of course, absolutely necessary and they don't always come cheap. 
On set food - whether it's craft services or catering, food on set is extremely important to both the actors and the crew. If the food is bad, the crew will be unmotivated and sluggish, and the actors will be on edge. Good food creates good atmosphere, which exponentially increases the quality on set. We try to have craft services on set, as well as attempting to adhere to union standards of a hot meal every six hours.
Locations - Location, location, location! Every film, every business, needs a good location. For us, it's a place that can fit precisely the look we need to build the Waiting Line universe. These places exist, and are usually available, but they do cost money.
Crew pay - Technicians on film crews are freelance, and their jobs are hard and unforgiving. They don't come cheap, and they're the ones who make the motor run. Without them, nothing in the filmworld happens. Topnotch professionals assure top quality work.
Equipment - Easily accounting for 40% of our budget. Top of the line equipment means top of the line quality, and we are trying to be the best. This means acquiring the professional industry standards in cameras, lighting, sound, and production equipment. These don't come cheap by any means, but the quality return is more than worth it. 
Props, Wardrobe, and Set Dressing- The better your show looks, the more this will draw your audience in. This means making the Waiting Line universe complete with unique costuming and wardrobe for each character, props for the characters, and set dressing which sets the scene for the action. Once a location is chosen, it has to be altered with props and set dressing to make the actual story line come to life. All of this costs money, folks, and it doesn't come cheap.  Help!


All of this adds up to what most would call a rather steep bill. That's part of the business, though! Our goal is to present our completed pilot to as many television networks as possible in the hopes that we will be picked up for syndication. Once that occurs, we make art and money!  And so do you, if you're an executive producer on the show (see below).  After all, that's what investing is all about, right? 

The concept behind Waiting Line - of live action situational comedy with an undercurrent of witty animation - is one that has never been explored. It will be groundbreaking in its very existence.  Think Friends with the modern next generation adding comic book ad-libs, animations and pop art.

Additionally, the concept of character growth in the "manic pixie dream girl" archetype has not been adequately shown in television thus far, with most men in current sitcoms depicted as  looking toward women objectively. We wish to change that by showing that it is indeed possible to grow into an understanding of people as, yes, people and women, as, yes, women.

We also wish to widen the diversity of general romantic comedy in the television medium through the portrayal of an African-American lead, an interracial love interest, and an openly gay African-American supporting character. While these three things aren't specifically important in the film industry, this genre of television has mainly stuck to white-washed casting with stereotypical minority characters. Changing that will be a good step towards social progress.

There are quite a few risks involved with helping support an independent film company. That's the nature of film: it is a high risk investment. From breaking equipment to injured actors, from editing errors to simply not getting picked up, there are a myriad of things that can happen to a television show.

That being said, we pride ourselves on our drive and absolutely guarantee top quality in our work. This is our first pilot, yes, but this isn't our first project. We've produced top quality shorts and skits, some of which can be viewed on our Youtube page.  With all of us running the show, so to speak, we are experienced film technicians who have worked as freelancers on everything from small projects to big budget films. We know what we're doing.

Additionally, to secure ourselves a spot on a network, we have an agent for the company. Someone who knows the business of distribution and can help us get the pilot to the desks of all the major networks.

So yes, it's a high risk investment. We know what we're doing, though, and we are driven to succeed.

If you can't support, or can't put forward as much as you'd like, there are other ways you can get involved and/or help! Just be sure to share this campaign with everyone you can think of! Know a business guy with a sweet tooth for entertainment? Send us his way! Ask your friends, ask your parents, ask the weird neighbors down the street! Every little bit of publicity, every small donation, helps us reach our ultimate goal:

A hilarious sit-com of epic proportions!

Even this site, Indiegogo, has a sharing tool. So please share! Help us succeed in our dreams, and you'll see us soon: right on the TV screens in your own living room.  Yep, we dream big!

realistic member of this group until she loses her temper. She is by far
 the most understanding. She can take any situation, analyze it and come 
up with a perfect solution -- unless it's her own life. She is super 
involved with school, and at times overwhelmed with too many 
projects. Despite getting stressed too easily, she always finds time 
to be with Ethan. Emmy loves Ethan to the nth degree. She spends most of
 her time with him and in turn she doesn't really know any of the other 
members that well. If not for Ethan, she would probably stay in her dorm room and study
 all day. You could say Ethan is her access to the rest of the world.
19 year-old small-town girl from South Dakota. She has come to the big city for school but is suffering culture shock. Norah is very naive about the complexity and sophistication of city life and finds it very hard to adjust to the coldness and alienation sometimes apparent in an urban atmosphere.Despite the fact that Norah is a little lost most of the time, she is an amazing dancer.  However, none of her friends in the group really know this fact about her as she lacks the competitive drive and self-conscious bravado, at first, to make her talents known.  After only a week in the big city, although still not urbanized, she nonetheless seeks to overcompensate for this fact by running for president of every club at school she finds.  In the future, she will do an about-face in her life, and through experiences that put her through the fire, she will end up a CEO of company.  However, she does not know this yet and still lives in her small-town mind.
20 year-old aloof intellectual who must learn to open himself up and become one of the guys.Sebastian is a proud gay man. He truly believes himself to be the smartest man on the planet. He is easily annoyed by the crude provinciality of most people.  For him, a typical day at home finds him dressing in something "fancy," sitting around the house in front of the fireplace, reading a cerebral book, and drinking the finest green tea in the world. He has shared a dorm room with Daemon at college for 2 years now. At first, Sebastian hated Daemon more than Hitler. In his mind at least Hitler could paint a beautiful picture! As the years went by, Sebastian become very fond of Daemon and found some small love for him hidden deep down inside himself. Sebastian has many lovers he brings around. None of them ever last because they just can't measure up to his intellect in his own mind.To better understand the characters, we have filmed a short promo to show their personalities - a slice in the life of these 6 friends.With lots of visual effects and over-the-top comedy, we are looking toward making a creative sitcom drawing influences from the feature film Scott Pilgrim vs The World, Friends, Coupling and Community! Before Waiting Line,  we made a short film about Ethan Dawson before he met Emerson Blake. This short gives you an indication of what we can create in 8 days on a budget of only $6000.
  
Making a sitcom costs money. This is where we really need your help. We are asking for $100,000.00 in funding to produce a pilot to shop to networks. (Believe it or not, that's not a lot as film budgets go; every penny is necessary.) 

This money goes toward several things, including but not limited to:
Actor compensation - "the Talent," as we call them on set. They're the ones with the ability to make the entire project believable and successful.They are, of course, absolutely necessary and they don't always come cheap. On set food - whether it's craft services or catering, food on set is extremely important to both the actors and the crew. If the food is bad, the crew will be unmotivated and sluggish, and the actors will be on edge. Good food creates good atmosphere, which exponentially increases the quality on set. We try to have craft services on set, as well as attempting to adhere to union standards of a hot meal every six hours.Locations - Location, location, location! Every film, every business, needs a good location. For us, it's a place that can fit precisely the look we need to build the Waiting Line universe. These places exist, and are usually available, but they do cost money.Crew pay - Technicians on film crews are freelance, and their jobs are hard and unforgiving. They don't come cheap, and they're the ones who make the motor run. Without them, nothing in the filmworld happens. Topnotch professionals assure top quality work.Equipment - Easily accounting for 40% of our budget. Top of the line equipment means top of the line quality, and we are trying to be the best. This means acquiring the professional industry standards in cameras, lighting, sound, and production equipment. These don't come cheap by any means, but the quality return is more than worth it. Props, Wardrobe, and Set Dressing- The better your show looks, the more this will draw your audience in. This means making the Waiting Line universe complete with unique costuming and wardrobe for each character, props for the characters, and set dressing which sets the scene for the action. Once a location is chosen, it has to be altered with props and set dressing to make the actual story line come to life. All of this costs money, folks, and it doesn't come cheap.  Help!

All of this adds up to what most would call a rather steep bill. That's part of the business, though! Our goal is to present our completed pilot to as many television networks as possible in the hopes that we will be picked up for syndication. Once that occurs, we make art and money!  And so do you, if you're an executive producer on the show (see below).  After all, that's what investing is all about, right?   
 The concept behind Waiting Line - of live action situational comedy with an undercurrent of witty animation - is one that has never been explored. It will be groundbreaking in its very existence.  Think Friends with the modern next generation adding comic book ad-libs, animations and pop art.
Additionally, the concept of character growth in the "manic pixie dream girl" archetype has not been adequately shown in television thus far, with most men in current sitcoms depicted as  looking toward women objectively. We wish to change that by showing that it is indeed possible to grow into an understanding of people as, yes, people and women, as, yes, women.
We also wish to widen the diversity of general romantic comedy in the television medium through the portrayal of an African-American lead, an interracial love interest, and an openly gay African-American supporting character. While these three things aren't specifically important in the film industry, this genre of television has mainly stuck to white-washed casting with stereotypical minority characters. Changing that will be a good step towards social progress.   
There are quite a few risks involved with helping support an independent film company. That's the nature of film: it is a high risk investment. From breaking equipment to injured actors, from editing errors to simply not getting picked up, there are a myriad of things that can happen to a television show.

That being said, we pride ourselves on our drive and absolutely guarantee top quality in our work. This is our first pilot, yes, but this isn't our first project. We've produced top quality shorts and skits, some of which can be viewed on our Youtube page.  With all of us running the show, so to speak, we are experienced film technicians who have worked as freelancers on everything from small projects to big budget films. We know what we're doing.
Additionally, to secure ourselves a spot on a network, we have an agent for the company. Someone who knows the business of distribution and can help us get the pilot to the desks of all the major networks.
So yes, it's a high risk investment. We know what we're doing, though, and we are driven to succeed.   
If you can't support, or can't put forward as much as you'd like, there are other ways you can get involved and/or help! Just be sure to share this campaign with everyone you can think of! Know a business guy with a sweet tooth for entertainment? Send us his way! Ask your friends, ask your parents, ask the weird neighbors down the street! Every little bit of publicity, every small donation, helps us reach our ultimate goal:

A hilarious sit-com of epic proportions!
Even this site, Indiegogo, has a sharing tool. So please share! Help us succeed in our dreams, and you'll see us soon: right on the TV screens in your own living room.  Yep, we dream big!

story:
Short Summary

Inspired by true life events (see video), this film focuses on the challenges faced when who you are and who you love conflict with your family's views on what's right and wrong--what will be tolerated and what will not be tolerated. We are very passionate about this project and believe that, although there's more acceptance for members of the LGBT community today than ever before, there are still people in heavily conservative areas of the nation (and the world) where the lack of acceptance is thick and heavy. We want to continue to serve as their voice. Join us!

What We Need & What You Get

To get this low budget short made, we need $2,000. This will go to the film permits, and cost for crew.

The Impact

As fore mentioned, there are members of the LGBT community around the world who struggle with who they are and who they love because it directly conflicts with their/their family's religious and conservative values. Because of this we feel it's important to continue telling their story, which is exactly what this film does. Join us in keeping the dialogue out there about the struggles members of the LGBT community born into ultra conservative families face when it comes to reconciling their family values with self-identify.

Risks & Challenges

The largest challenge we have is funding but with your help, we can overcome that.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute but you can still help by spreading the word and sharing our campaign with your friends and family. Utilize the Indiegogo share tools!

story: Help this Nomadic Author raise his social standing and realize his dreams by donating whatever you can today. Too often is the path of an successful author misunderstood. His mission is simple. He wants to broadcast an author's steps on rising to fame. He will also show the difference between the path of an author and many of the other celebrity paths. None are easy paths to take. Each is unique in it's own merit. However, the main issue at hand is the path of an Nomadic Author. Please... contribute today.

story:
About the Film

Cracked is a short film that endeavors to tell a side of the story that usually goes untold. Revolving around a dysfunctional family bordering on collapse we see the story from the eyes of a son who has lived with the consequences of the actions of those closest to him.

Who We Are

The main crew are a creative bunch who have come out of the woodwork of the film program at Swinburne University.  We've spent the last two years learning and refining our abilities as creative story tellers.

This project will be the most rigorous undertaking we've attempted as a group but we have faith in our abilities and our teamwork. We all believe in constant learning and betterment of ourselves as creators.   

Your contributions will be invaluable in seeing us to our goals. 

What We Need

The costs that we need to cover are for the following:

  • Catering for our cast and crew on set
  • Camera and lighting equipment hire
  • Make up and wardrobe expenses
  • Production design expenses

What You Get

On the right you can see the perks that we can offer you for contributing to our campaign. The contribution you make to our project makes a world of difference to us so every donation of$1 or more will get a social media shoutout and $5 or more will receive a personalised thank you from our cast and crew in the form of a postcard.

The Impact

This project is another stepping stone in the creative journey of our crew. Between the main crew there are at the very least 15 completed projects including short films, music videos and documentaries. We are dedicated to our craft and plan to see this through.

Your contribution will help us to bring another narrative to life so that we can continue to convey interesting stories to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody can contribute financially but if you do like our campaign there are still the following ways to help:

  • Check out our Facebook and Tumblr pages and follow the hashtag #CrackedFilm2015 on Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr and Twitter to keep updated.
  • Spread the word about us with #CrackedFilm2015 on all your social media.

story:
Bref résumé

Nous sommes un groupe de dix étudiantes et de deux enseignants, faisant partie du programme de Techniques de travail social au cégep du Vieux Montréal. Dans le cadre de notre formation, nous devons effectuer un stage lors de notre première année d'étude. Nous avons la chance de pouvoir vivre cette expérience à Jinotepe, dans la région de Carazo, au Nicaragua. Ce stage interculturel vise à nous développer, en tant qu'intervenantes sociales en apprentissage, à établir une relation d'aide ainsi qu'à comprendre le milieu dans lequel nous allons travailler. Nous devrons faire preuve d'adaptation, d'ouverture et d'intégration face à une nouvelle culture. L'expérience acquise, lors de ce séjour, fera de nous des personnes mieux outillées, tant au plan personnel que professionnel. 

Ce stage se fait en collaboration avec  Mer et Monde, organisation réputée pour son expertise dans la réalisation de stages d'initiation à la coopération internationale. Cet organisme nous assure un soutien logistique tout au long du projet.


 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Pour la réalisation complète de ce projet, nous avons besoin d'un total de 28 000$ (billets d'avion, hébergement/repas, transports, assurances, activités...). Si cet objectif est dépassé, les gains seront utilisés dans le but de contribuer à un projet collectif de la communauté. Par l'entremise d'Indiegogo, nous visons un objectif de 2000$, qui viendrait s'ajouter à nos diverses campagnes de financement. 

De petits gestes peuvent faire une grande différence! Le simple fait de partager cette page peut grandement contribuer à la réalisation de notre projet. Un petit don, un partage, une parole, tout ce qui peut nous donner de la visibilité sera reçu avec le plus grand des sourires et une immense reconnaissance!!!

Nous nous engageons à vous partager nos expériences  vécues sur le terrain, via cette page indiegogo!

Merci de nous appuyer dans cette aventure!

Kim Pronovost, Camille Benny Perron, Rachel Blais-Desnoyers, Sandrine Gauthier-Barrette, Andrée-Anne Rondeau. Andreea Mihaela Tîrnovanu, Noélia Chapdelaine, Mélodie Gaudreault, Élodie Côté et Alice Bilodeau, étudiantes.

François Paquette et Rafaelle Sinave, enseignants

story:
Short Summary

The 3 ladies you see in the pictures are the most happy and respectful children I ever laid eyes upon, regardless of the fact that their mother left them when the youngest one was 6 weeks old (!). 

When I was first taken to their home by somebody who took an interest in the case, I was extremely surprised. I, a 24 year-old, together with my 40 years-old friend were shaking because of the temperature inside the house and the 6, 9 and 10 year-old children were playing cheerfully (they were not even thickly-dressed!). We were so cold because they have no heating source except a small heater in the kitchen. Also, they have no bathroom (the girls wash each other in a small plastic tub), electricity (nor light), gas or running water (they carry it from a neighbor). 

They do not have the possibility to legally contract any of these services (or build a toilet at least) because they are occupying the house without papers (as a favor done to their father by some kind people from the Romanian Railways, where he worked before quitting to take care of his girls.)

What was most surprising, though, is the father’s attitude – I broke into tears and he was the one consoling me! He is currently selling newspapers for a small profit but can barely afford to pay for the food, clothes and notebooks of his girls.

*The campaign is an act on my own behalf and not sanctioned by Oracle

What We Need & What You Get

What we want to do is buy them a house or at least raise some money to legally rent this one and contract water and electricity.

The Impact

I have organised a fundraising event before, to help a blind girl with motor problems whose father had just died from cancer receive the required help from a physiotherapist, but I am now trying to get to a larger audience. The sum required for acquiring the house, however little - given it's a social case, is too big to be raised by selling cookies alone :).

That is why your help is appreciated, once the house is bought we will have the stepping stone to furnishing it with all the necessary things for 3 schoolgirls.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you empathize with my cause but do not have the means to make any donation, please remember that a like will not help them but sharing their story might, if it is seen by the right person - please make some noise and let's bring some light!

story:
Currently we are in a focused raise of $2500 to send myself Suzanne Eberhardt ( associate producer) and Dante D'Anthony the franchise creator, visionary and writer to the American Film Market. Check out the new perks !!!! We have established connections that a face to face meeting would go a long way ,Please contribute now- even 10 dollars x 200 persons or 20 people x 100 or 40 x 50.00 etc....would be a help to getting there!

Chronos Productions is a small Indie group that has been working on the pre-development of the Pandoran Age Chronicles multi-platform projects-Feature film, illustrated novels, animatics, video game concepts and more for a number of years now. Like all indies sweat equity has gotten us this far but now we need your help! Our aim is to create family friendly adventurous movies, games, and  but also to create jobs for people where they can use their talents and imaginations to inspire, and even educate. Dantes books are filled with historical references and mythology We have 8 books currently, and a volume of film production animation script breakdowns, concept art, and original digital models, and would like to produce another short film with more characters and upgrade the project proposal. We currently have a letter of Intent from a major film producer, and are looking to create an expansion of a short promo film.

 Our first short film,The Derelict, was created with zero budget by a small group of dedicated  creatives. We would like to expand more of Millin's story in another short film...OBSCURO FRIO, which would include more of the back story. 

Please help us keep the project moving with additional animation software, a focused trip to the american film market for face to face meetings with already established connections to get to the next step  and resources needed to bring this important vision-and the underlying message so important to individuals today, to the screen. A message in a world that seems increasingly traumatic, and abandoning its social cohesion, duty, and bonds: that the demons must be faced and defeated with the imperfections all Humans share. It is that choice, since we live in a world we did not make, and endure injustice all around, that becomes magnificent, and heroic!

.   

The Magnificent Raiders Feature Film and Merchandising project universe is conceived as a multi-platform, multi-genre Universe which one can enter from multiple media formats.  The IP incorporates all the classic traditional entertainment themes that have carried over from the great comic and pulp era, and which are fueling the most powerful entertainment franchises today; Pirates, Spies, Gangsters, Soldiers, and Adventurers in far flung exotic locales

Set in the far future, in a Dark Age after a cataclysmic war, the dark “Age of Pandora”:  a mysterious threat to Humanity, in the form of horrific demon beings from another dimension, are swarming to invade the Galaxy-but the various governments in the Galaxy are unprepared to marshal a defense. It is up to rogue elements (who form the Magnificent Raiders) to organize a defense.  

The Kith Blade is the first story in "Renegades of Ophelia's World" and introduces the World, Obscuro Frio, its culture of refugees, and Millin Quinoa. Millin, who appears in THE DERELICT short film, is one of the most important and ongoing characters in THE PANDORAN AGE CHRONICLES and THE MAGNIFICENT RAIDERS OF DIMENSION WAR ONE. Like all the Magnificent Raiders, the character's essential conflict is not actually fighting Demon Horde-it is the internal conflict of their souls. Each of the character's backstories involve violent emotional and personal trauma-betrayal, abandonment, dispossession. Often these include the horrific and violent death of loved ones and comrades. Consequently, important aspects of the characters' hearts and minds are damaged, diminished, or even twisted to evil. On their 'Hero's Journey" each of the Raiders will eventually be called to bring the harsh skill sets acquired in their traumas to the cause of good.

Our current Indiegogo Drive is to continue the short films featuring Millin as our touch stone, with the introduction of his origin story.







Impact

Additional resources for the Short film can make a significant improvement in the opportunity for the franchise to move to the feature film level.

The Kith Blade is the first story in "Renegades of Ophelia's World" and introduces the World, Obscuro Frio, its culture of refugees, and Millin Quinoa. Millin, who appears in THE DERELICT short film, is one of the most important and ongoing characters in THE PANDORAN AGE CHRONICLES and THE MAGNIFICENT RAIDERS OF DIMENSION WAR ONE. Like all the Magnificent Raiders, the character's essential conflict is not actually fighting Demon Horde-it is the internal conflict of their souls. Each of the character's backstories involve violent emotional and personal trauma-betrayal, abandonment, dispossession. Often these include the horrific and violent death of loved ones and comrades. Consequently, important aspects of the characters' hearts and minds are damaged, diminished, or even twisted to evil. On their 'Hero's Journey" each of the Raiders will eventually be called to bring the harsh skill sets acquired in their traumas to the cause of good. 
Our current Indiegogo Drive is to continue the short films featuring Millin as our touch stone, with the introduction of his origin story.







   






Impact
 Additional resources for the Short film can make a significant improvement in the opportunity for the franchise to move to the feature film level.

story:
WHO WE ARE?

Basically, this is it, we are two young girls who live in West Hollywood, California and share the same dream to work in the movie industry. We attend West Hollywood Elementary and our entire cast and crew are also in the same class as us. 

For the past six months we have spent every recess writing a 75 page script which we have finally finished. We spent countless hours revising and brainstorming with other cast members to make this the best possible script. We even had Hollywood writer John Quaintance edit our script and he totally approved it! 

Yay...Now that we are done with the script, the next step is to make this into a Feature Film. That's where you come in.

With hundreds of other successful Indiegogo campaigns, we figured why not give it a shot. And that's what brought us here to Indiegogo. We are super excited and have worked extremely hard to make this happen. 

Please help us in making our vision come to life! Any donation will help us get closer to achieving our goal. $1 dollar, $50 dollars, anything helps! Thank you in advance and we appreciate your donation. 

We started AHHA Productions a year ago and have been producing online shows, including cooking and comedy skits. You can visit our site here: http://www.ahha-productions.com/

We are lucky enough to have some really great people who support us, including family and friends. Our parents work in the entertainment industry and will help us get this movie to the right people..aka connections. With your help we can make this film a reality and continue to tell stories that make people scared and laugh, all at the same time.  

Why do we need your help with funding? 

While some of this movie is being made with the help of students and volunteers willing to work for free, there are people that we have to pay. In order for us to submit our final product to film festivals and major studios, the quality of production has to be top tier. That's why we are raising $50,000.00. The funds we receive from the Indiegogo campaign will go towards a variety of important production needs. 

This includes cast fees, crew fees, location fees, camera packages, production design, costumes, and post-production costs for editing, VFX artists, sound, legal, marketing and accounting. In other words, every dollar we receive will be either seen on the screen, or put towards required costs for the making of the film. Every cent is important to us.

As for distribution, there are several possibilities. One is that we license the series to an established entertainment service like Netflix, Hulu or Amazon… another is that we license the show to a cable channel like SyFy… and yet another might be a more experimental route, using an online pay-to-view service like Vimeo or Vodo… and there are many more possibilities beyond. But first, we need to shoot the script. 

SOME OF OUR PAST WORK:

Our 2014 White House Student Film Festival video was accepted as a finalists in the competition.

An intro to our informational iBook on the Oscars.

HOW INDIEGOGO WORKS

It’s easy: you could either sign up for a free account, or just enter your email, then you give any amount you can, and claim your reward. Your donation amount will not be publicly displayed, and we receive your funds only if we meet our full $50,000 goal. If you’d like to increase your donation at any point during the campaign, just sign in, come back to this page, and click the blue “Manage Your Donation” button to enter a new amount or choose a new incentive.

THE PLAN:

Once this movie is made, the plan is to submit it to the top horror and genre film festivals around the world. This is ultimately our "calling card" to Hollywood, our chance to prove to the world that we are capable of making something truly great and scary.

Production Schedule: 

  • February - March 2015: Casting, crewing up, planning the look of the film. 
  • March 16th - April 17th, 2015: Four week shoot on location
  • April 20th - May 8th, 2015: Post Production editing takes place. 
  • June 1st, 2015 - Release of final film 

The Creators: 

What's up, I’m Airis Garcia and I’m 10 years old. I was born in Missouri and moved to L.A when I was two. On my 5th birthday my mom decided to put me in acting. I got an agent and started doing commercials. I enjoy writing, playing soccer, watching American football and futbol. Hanging out with my friends never gets old and a family movie night is always lots of fun.


Hey I’m Harper Quaintance and I’m 11 years old. I was born here in L.A. I enjoy writing, acting, and filming with my best friend Airis. Comedy is by far my favorite genre to write. I love goofing off with my friends, having all night movie marathons, and doing funny skits.


THE CAST:


Airis Garcia as Avery  - 

Fun, outgoing, spunky, and always looks on the bright side of things. Avery can’t live without her friends, she’s silly and is looking for fun all the time. 

Harper Quaintance as Abby -

Almost exactly like Avery, same personality, but both have their little differences. Abby always lends a helping hand and knows what to say. Kind and silly, she is a great friend.

Camille Dove as Amy -

Bossy, stylish, and a diva. Amy dreams of becoming Miss America and tries to run the show. Always wearing the hottest fashions, but even though she is very sassy, she is a loyal friend.

Frances Allen as Molly -

A get to the point type of girl, smart, kind, and hates lollygagging. Makes sure everything is in schedule. She is silly, but serious, likes flowers and loves to have some fun. 

Sean Pitaro as Ace -

Loves music, beat boxing, and rapping. He is funny, crazy, confident, and kind. Always stays true to himself and is not afraid to start dancing in the middle of the street.

Owen Bunn as Luke -

Chill, calm, and silly. Luke likes to have fun, but always enjoys some quiet time to himself. He loves the beach, the pool, and hates being in noisy places. Luke is a great friend to have.

Evan French as Evan -

Funny, really smart, and always caries a calculator with him. Evan brags a lot, but his friends just think its funny. Often uses the word fool, goofy when not trying to be, Evan has it all.

Dean Bowman as Charlie -

Athletic, nice, and funny. Charlie is the captain of the football team, he always tries to act all strong, and is very adventurous. At times he likes to chill with his buddies, but usually he’s planning a big adventure.

Ben Bushman as Jake -

Single, silly, and crazy. Jake is a free spirit, daredevil kind of person. He enjoys going on hikes, bike riding, and playing video games. He rather be without a girlfriend telling him what do, he says.

Owen Roberts as Noah -

Single, silly, and crazy, like Jake. Noah hates when people call him short. (He’s short) but, loves going to the movies. Often cracks jokes out of nowhere and thinks he knows everything about the hottest fashion.

story:
About the Project



This is a Trilogy starting

The Singularity 

The Rarity and 

Plurality.

The setting is on a planet called Pamveer it is large, powerful, and seemingly one of a kind. Even planets get depressed, especially those which are alive, have awareness of self, and have feelings. Pamveer feels, terribly, alone. Sensing sentient life in another parallel universe, Pamveer makes the connection. Using the energy in her own blood, 


Pamveer creates trans-dimensional portals through which she abducts thousands of new companions, from throughout Earth's history.



Almost all of her champions immediately die of thirst. For the only liquid on Pamveer is the life blood of Pamveer herself.


A precious few manage to survive on the life found therein. From these, within a few generations, Pamveer has existing with her, a Stone-age civilization that only she could love. She loves them enough to allow them access back to Earth. Where they can hunt, gather human slaves for themselves back on Pamveer, and feast on other life. It is that found in the blood of those on Earth. We know visitors from Pamveer as VAMPIRES. 


Michael a nearly helpless Commando they abduct, knows them only as his masters, is about to make his displeasure felt. For he is only nearly helpless. Inserting himself into the middle of a civil war between Kage and the King, He must soon flee for his life. He is a military man, used to fighting with what comes to hand. In this case, war must be conducted with grass, wood and stone brought from the Earth. Because Pamveer will allow no metal in her world. But even so handicapped,

 Michael elevates the art of bloodshed to a level never seen before on Pamveer. He will not allow his new found love, to perish with her father. With her chosen companions dying at an alarming rate, Pamveer must make her own decisions. And those decisions will forever affect Michael and Eleanor. As well as our Earth.


Synopsis for THE RARITY

Some give their god, the worship and love due them. Others just use their god for whatever they can get. Kage belongs to the second category. The new ruler on Pamveer cares only for his own power and has no gratitude for life given daily by Pamveer. With the planet denying him access to the Earth, Kage creates his own paths. Boiling Pamveer’s blood creates the necessary trans-dimensional portals. Kage and his men ravage the Earth for blood and for slaves. There is one major problem with Kage’s gateways. 

Pamveer is slowly dying from the loss of her blood. And when she dies, so will everyone on her surface. Pamveer enlists the aid of anyone who still cares. She asks the remaining peasants to revolt.


But they are weak and lack leadership. She knows Eleanor still cares. But the princess is being hunted on the Earth by Kage’s men. The Earth, where Pamveer herself banished her. 


On Earth, Michael is exhausted. His seventeen-year-old daughter desperately needs some stability in her life. Child of both Pamveer and the Earth, Jillian just wants a normal life. Unlike her mother, Jillian is more than able to control her vampire heritage. But unable to digest human food, Eleanor needs a continual supply of blood to remain alive. Every time she feeds her way, resulting headlines bring Kage’s hunters to the family’s new location. And Michael is exhausted.

Michael is done running. On the Earth, there is metal.


 Bullets can be made of hardwood, 

When you can load your own ammunition. Michael was born to battle and he now he’s ready to return to war. He will get his a chance to bring the battle back to Kage. As a last resort, Pamveer has turned to the one man she believes most adept at killing. He is desperately needed to lead the peasants in war. This time, in a rebellion against Kage. At stake is the life of Pamveer itself. So Michael, with his wife, his daughter, and two weaklings, returns to Pamveer.


Hoping to save a god.

Synopsis for THE PLURALITY

It seemed like a good idea, until he got there. It was an opportunity to visit another dimension. It offered a chance to prove his self in a new environment. It even gave the boy time alone with the beautiful and mysterious Jillian from next door. What Levi never counted on was being crushed to the ground by the staggering gravitational pull of Pamveer. 

Or his resulting new nickname of ‘Worm.” Nonetheless, the Worm will prove an invaluable asset in Michael’s war for the life of Pamveer. While his body is basically worthless there, Levi’s mind still works fine. And that mind has been trained by too many games of ‘Risk.’ Move and countermove ensues as limited numbers of the peasant army are repeatedly depleted by too costly victories over Kage’s men. On the sidelines, one very young and unheralded stowaway wages her own fight against tyranny. Moreover, Michael’s escalating sophistication in weaponry is costing the dying planet the very companions she’s giving her life to save. Events move swiftly to a climax. With hope nearly gone, 

Michael’s family and remaining forces are trapped at the Well of Souls. There, with her strength completely gone, Pamveer can no longer help. Broken in spirit and in body, Michael’s family watches the last of the peasant army desert them. Face to face with an overwhelming enemy force, weaponless, and moments from death, the impossible occurs. The Worm makes one more decision. He makes one more sacrifice for a man he admires, a girl he loves, and a God for whom he has come to care deeply. Perhaps he is seeking one basic answer for all of humanity.


What is the real value of one life?

Possible Locations




Brian Vaughan. With Kaylea Caulfield and Christie-Lee Britten from The Rarity.

Brian has been involved in the film industry for over 20 years as an actor, producer, writer and director. In 1997, he established Spirit Rider Productions, a Queensland-based independent movie and television production house. Since then the company has been involved in Ten shorts and four TV pilots. Brian has been involved in the Television Industry working for Optus Television whilst  they were in Brisbane as a director's Assistant for nine television shows. Brian has brought Spirit Rider Productions through a series of stages. Starting with short films, he has evolved the undertaking to where he is making himself known in international circles and working with numerous companies to expand both himself and Spirit Rider Productions. He directed Infamous Cocktail Show forJeremy Rigby which screened at Briz 31 Digital in Brisbane. https://www.facebook.com/infamouscocktailshow?fref=ts

 He has recently been directing the Web Series Blinkers for Karen Buckton from Brisbane in Qld.  Brian Is now working with Atomic Pictures in Hollwood.

Brian has written over 40 shorts and 15 features with more to come.. http://www.spiritriderproductions.com/


Rose Warner is an Award Winning Producer and she is one of the most innovative and flexible producers in the industry, always ready to evaluate and adapt new ideas, technologies and systems which reflects on her amazing projects!

Producer of "The Lion of Judah", "Tugger: The Jeep 4x4 Who Wanted to Fly" and a multitude of other projects, Rose Warner exudes confidence, intelligence and an unbridled sense of optimism; attributes that serve to reflect her outlook on life and underscore her value to the any industry.

 Ms. Warner is innovative and flexible in her thinking, always ready to evaluate and adapt new ideas, technologies and systems that can benefit any project.  Ms. Warner considers herself to be a team player with strong organizational and communication skills and someone who welcomes a challenge – especially one centered on business development.

During the course of her career she has worked with an impressive array of prestigious motion picture studios including Warner Bros, Sony, Columbia, Buena Vista, Paramount, Universal, Fox, and MGM along with many Fortune 500 Companies.

Rose holds a Degree in Communications/Multimedia Studies and was certified in Film & Video as a Producer and Director. In addition, she has studied Business, Marketing and Accounting, which lends to her amazing Business Plans and PPOs to aid in making any project welcomed among Investors!!! 


Julie Paupe is a screenwriter and executive producer of Wonder Works Films in Los Angeles - partners of Ridley Scott's RSA Films in the United Kingdom. She is also a screenwriter, screenplay editor and executive producer to Spirit Rider Productions in Australia. As an international screenplay consultant born in the United Kingdom, Julie is always happy to work on upcoming projects from other production companies and co-write with other screenwriters.

Mr Irwin began his career as an actor on General Hospital and The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson as well as feature films Modern Problems withChevy Chase. He recently appeared in Men From Reno, a film nominated for the John Cassavettes Award at the 2015 Independent Spirit Awards. He turned to production matters as a location assistant on The Streets Of San Fransisco. And then as First Assistant Director, Unit Production Manager,  and Associate Producer on such films as  Warcat, Forever, Warpath and The Confessional. Mr Irwin formed The Padula Production Group to develop projects for independent writers and producers which has recently expanded to producing scripts under Atomic Hollywood.Mr Irwin currectly has four film projects and two tv series in development.


Heather Beck is an award-winning Author and Screenwriter who began writing professionally at the age of sixteen. Her first book was published when she was only nineteen years old. Since then she has written eleven well-reviewed books. Heather recently received an Honors Bachelor of Arts from university where she specialized in English and studied an array of disciplines. Currently, she is working on two young adult novels and has six anthologies slated for publication. As a screenwriter, Heather has multiple television shows and movies in development. Her short films include Young Eyes, The Rarity, Too Sensible For Love, Circular and Witch’s Brew.

http://heatherbeck.tripod.com/

Scott Kimber: Director of Photography

Scott is a graduate of the Queensland College of Arts where he studied film production. In 2006, Scott was B cam and 2nd Unit DOP of the acclaimed feature film The Horseman. He was also the DOP of two more feature films, I Don’t Recommend Art or Love and Still Water as well as three television series and eight short films. Additionally, he has worked on three music videos and thirteen television commercials. Scott is the recipient of two awards from the Australian Cinematographer’s Society. He was the DOP for the feature film, Daddy’s Little Girl, which won a number of awards and the DOP for The Award winning Charlies Farm. Scott’s goal is to push the boundaries of each production, embracing new and old technology, while giving his films a unique look that compliments each production.
Scott was also the director for The Rarity short in 2011 which also won two award

http://scottkimber.com.au/

Natalie Stanfield: Hair and Make Up

Australia based Cinemagraphic artist Natalie Stanfield owns & operates Natstar.com.au offering freelance Make-up artistry & training, with over 10yrs experience in make-up, beauty & film.

Natalie’s knowledge and work is varied and has been featured in films, video clips, television, magazines, newspapers, journals, educational & training books/dvds, websites, advertising & media print campaigns. 

An accomplished & innovative artist with experience on projects as a Cinemagraphic make-up artist, special effects, character, design, hair, wig and body painting artist specializing in the film and entertainment industries. 

Natalie has always been creative and has a diverse flair for the arts & entertainment, working with celebrities, international and local talented artists. 

- See more at: http://www.natstar.com.au/#sthash.97YtRBmE.dpuf....

Semra Michaels Theme Song for The Rarity Short and Feature.  

                         http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-1BfZUvSvN4

Ms. Semra Michaels is an extraordinarily gifted and creative artist. A powerful and captivating Singer/Songwriter/Music Producer/Composer, she can now add Author and Scriptwriter to her long list of talents! From the young age of six, Semra’s powerful vocals and charismatic performances have captured audiences all over Sydney in clubs, on TV and at events. Songwriting and learning instruments since the age of 12, this exuberance led her to write and co-produce “The Truth” with an accompanying novel of her inspirational life journey. She recently produced and independently released “Make your Move” which has Pop/Urban/Electro influences. She is the owner of Real Fine Productions – a Music Production House for Pop Artists, Film & TV. Semra also has a love for movies. Her current screenplay “Project Warrior Princess” is inspired by her book. Semra Michaels’ dynamic presence won’t be forgotten!

  CAST

                                                Kaylea Caulfield as Jade

                                                                                                                    

 

Kaylea though only nine years old she has been very prolific in her three years of filming as well as tv and a web series and features. . 

 FEATURE FILMS

Dark Origins (2014), Inverse (2014) and Rise (2014).

INTERVIEW
Interview about sustainability ,for brief by Unilever for Cannes Lions Festival of Creativity in France. With Josh Hammond

STUNTS
Weapons/Fight Training Weekly-Split Decision-Wade Boyes

 http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5658596/

Robert Rabiah as Kage

NOMINATED ACTOR: ROBERT RABIAH – AFI AWARDS 2012 & IF AWARDS 2011

2011 REVIEWS

  • “Robert Rabiah ranks among the best actors of all time” – MOVIE REVIEWS OZ
  • “Rabiah is sensational as Hakim, a hard-talking realist whose beef with his boss starts the sparks flying” – THE AGE
  • “Robert Rabiah is in screen-grabbing form” - SCREENWIZE
  • “The best performances are not from those you would expect. It is Robert Rabiah who steals the show” – MIFF REVIEW
  • “You expect solid performances from Vince Colosimo and Sigrid Thornton, but really impressive were Robert Rabiah, Mathew Newtown and Luke Ford” – AT THE MOVIES
  • “Robert Rabiah gives a totally convincing performance: ‘the man’s man’ character, the ultimate tattooed Australian construction worker” – SYDNEY ARTS GUIDE
  • “This is one of the stronger Australian films of recent years. Rabiah turns out to be one of the more sympathetic characters” – EUREKA
  • “Robert Rabiah brings the character to life with resounding believability” – CINEPHILIA
  • “Robert Rabiah is powerful as Hakim, an underestimated worker” – SCREEN INTERNATIONAL
  • “The performances throughout are strong, especially from Robert Rabiah, Sigrid Thornton and Laura Gordon” – THE AGE
  • “Robert Rabiah is alternately funny and moving as Hakim” – FILMINK
 Christie-Lee Britten as Jillian Ford

Christie-Lee has been involved in the entertainment industry for the last nine years. She has become the media’s darling by appearing in countless magazines and newspapers. Her experience lies in stage performing, musicals, TV Series, TVC, singing and modeling. She also won the title of Miss Gold Coast. Christie-Lee is a very passionate, determined, confident, hardworking individual with extensive knowledge of the industry gained from training with Griffith University and TAFTA. To date, she was the leading actress in three musicals: Back to the 80’s, Disco Inferno and A Midsummer Night’s Dream. She has worked on eight commercials, most notably the Queensland Government’s binge drinking campaign which was on-air for 3 years. Christie-Lee has appeared in the following TV series: Terra Nova, Slide, The Elephant Princess, H2O: Just Add Water and Monarch Cove. Christie-Lee has also done presenting for Schoolies and the 2011 Gold Coast Film Festival. 

 Vincent Gorce as Mr. Ford

Vincent has starred in sixteen short films and the feature film, Redemption 101  and Rise Of The Underdog. He has also worked on the following TV series: Shifters, Sea Patrol, (S)truth and Sekai Gyoten News, as well as the TV documentaries, Cannibalism: Extreme Survival and Tug of Love. Vincent has been featured in ten TV commercials and several print advertisements. Additionally, he worked for three years as a reporter for the National TV and Radio Network in France where he covered several topics including political interviews and live sport events. He has extensive screen acting training with Tom McSweeney, Casting Director at the Australian Warner Studios, and renowned dialect coach, Claire Crowther. Vincent is an extremely versatile actor who can portray a wide range of characters, from comical to intense dramatic roles and action hero to memorable villain.

Her credits include: Terra Nova, An ordinary affair, Redeemed, The strip, Monterey Cove, Maternal instinct, Bianca and more.. She has also been involved in Hosting Live children’s shows, Presenting Modeling and Writing and Also Directing. Having had initial formal acting training at Tony Bartuccios in Melbourne alongside Collette Mann and then at Swinburne College Melbourne, and also work- shopped with Ben Parkinson and also Samuel Johnson, Andréa continues to excel in her craft and leaves her audience craving more.

 Beau Eastman,  Appeared as Jay in the 2011 Short film The Rarity. 24 years of age, Ioves acting, making films and currently work as bird of prey trainer assistant and presenter at Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary. After finishing Grade 12, I attended The Sunshine Coast Institute of TAFE graduating with a Certificate IV in Screen in 2008 During this time I was able to pick up three awards for his films including a Best Film award for “Prejudice” (a short documentary about stopping racism), Best Director and Best Film for “Our Guru of Surfing”. He is  a very energetic person. My specialty is surfing, snowboarding, horse riding, diving/filming and studying wildlife (hoping one day he will be able to act and/or be part of making a film about any of the four). Kiki Townley as Lyndsey

Kiki has been acting since she was 15 and continued all throughout high school - auditioning, being selected and being requested for diverse theater productions as well as film. She was 1 of 6, selected to be a part of the ensemble in the production, "YAIR - Dreaming", which entailed the 6 actors collaborating, developing and performing with a team of circus professionals. She played the Leading role in the Greek play Antigone as well as Stacy in the Margery Forde play, X-Stacy. She aimed and got the lead in school plays and, was always in some way, involved in the artistic or motivational aspects of school. She was selected to be a part of an ensemble of 30, produced by ARTOLOGY REMIX. The ensemble wrote and created an abstract and alternative view of Mary Shelley's 'Frankenstein'. Kiki was then selected at 15, to play a 21 year old role by the name of 'Lyndsey' in the Feature film, Rarity, cast as a supporting role by Brian Vaughan from 'A Spirit Rider Production'. Whilst the movie is in production and she was entering and studying hard in school she sacrificed her holidays and weekends to better her skills. Constantly seeking work in the industry. In year 11 and 12 of school she featured as an extra in a few projects, such as; 'Beyond redemption II' - a sci-fi feature, 'Why all Properties group?' - a TV commercial, 'Camp' - the USA television series - episodes 1 to 3 directed by Bud Hopes, 'Infamous Cocktail Show' - Cast as Lady with speaking role, as well as the voice overs in season 1 - 6. After this, she was chosen to be one of the 5 leading ladies (ELLE) in the 'TINDA Diaries' by SKNPRODUCTIONS. The pilot has been released and the first season is in progress of script writing.  She has just graduated school, November 2014, with 6 awards, being; top of her class in drama and maths and receiving the spirit of Brisbane award and the principals award. Since she's graduated, she still feels acting is her calling. her first job out of school was playing an extra in a short film named 'Auma' Featuring James Rolleston, an award winning actor from the 2010 film, 'Boy'. Kiki eagerly awaits what's next.

story_txt:
About the ProjectThis is a Trilogy startingThe Singularity The Rarity and Plurality.
The setting is on a planet called Pamveer it is large, powerful, and seemingly one of a kind. Even planets get depressed, especially those which are alive, have awareness of self, and have feelings. Pamveer feels, terribly, alone. Sensing sentient life in another parallel universe, Pamveer makes the connection. Using the energy in her own blood, 
Pamveer creates trans-dimensional portals through which she abducts thousands of new companions, from throughout Earth's history.
Almost all of her champions immediately die of thirst. For the only liquid on Pamveer is the life blood of Pamveer herself.
A precious few manage to survive on the life found therein. From these, within a few generations, Pamveer has existing with her, a Stone-age civilization that only she could love. She loves them enough to allow them access back to Earth. Where they can hunt, gather human slaves for themselves back on Pamveer, and feast on other life. It is that found in the blood of those on Earth. We know visitors from Pamveer as VAMPIRES. 
Michael a nearly helpless Commando they abduct, knows them only as his masters, is about to make his displeasure felt. For he is only nearly helpless. Inserting himself into the middle of a civil war between Kage and the King, He must soon flee for his life. He is a military man, used to fighting with what comes to hand. In this case, war must be conducted with grass, wood and stone brought from the Earth. Because Pamveer will allow no metal in her world. But even so handicapped, Michael elevates the art of bloodshed to a level never seen before on Pamveer. He will not allow his new found love, to perish with her father. With her chosen companions dying at an alarming rate, Pamveer must make her own decisions. And those decisions will forever affect Michael and Eleanor. As well as our Earth.
Synopsis for THE RARITYSome give their god, the worship and love due them. Others just use their god for whatever they can get. Kage belongs to the second category. The new ruler on Pamveer cares only for his own power and has no gratitude for life given daily by Pamveer. With the planet denying him access to the Earth, Kage creates his own paths. Boiling Pamveer’s blood creates the necessary trans-dimensional portals. Kage and his men ravage the Earth for blood and for slaves. There is one major problem with Kage’s gateways. Pamveer is slowly dying from the loss of her blood. And when she dies, so will everyone on her surface. Pamveer enlists the aid of anyone who still cares. She asks the remaining peasants to revolt.
But they are weak and lack leadership. She knows Eleanor still cares. But the princess is being hunted on the Earth by Kage’s men. The Earth, where Pamveer herself banished her. On Earth, Michael is exhausted. His seventeen-year-old daughter desperately needs some stability in her life. Child of both Pamveer and the Earth, Jillian just wants a normal life. Unlike her mother, Jillian is more than able to control her vampire heritage. But unable to digest human food, Eleanor needs a continual supply of blood to remain alive. Every time she feeds her way, resulting headlines bring Kage’s hunters to the family’s new location. And Michael is exhausted.Michael is done running. On the Earth, there is metal.
 Bullets can be made of hardwood, When you can load your own ammunition. Michael was born to battle and he now he’s ready to return to war. He will get his a chance to bring the battle back to Kage. As a last resort, Pamveer has turned to the one man she believes most adept at killing. He is desperately needed to lead the peasants in war. This time, in a rebellion against Kage. At stake is the life of Pamveer itself. So Michael, with his wife, his daughter, and two weaklings, returns to Pamveer.
Hoping to save a god.Synopsis for THE PLURALITYIt seemed like a good idea, until he got there. It was an opportunity to visit another dimension. It offered a chance to prove his self in a new environment. It even gave the boy time alone with the beautiful and mysterious Jillian from next door. What Levi never counted on was being crushed to the ground by the staggering gravitational pull of Pamveer. Or his resulting new nickname of ‘Worm.” Nonetheless, the Worm will prove an invaluable asset in Michael’s war for the life of Pamveer. While his body is basically worthless there, Levi’s mind still works fine. And that mind has been trained by too many games of ‘Risk.’ Move and countermove ensues as limited numbers of the peasant army are repeatedly depleted by too costly victories over Kage’s men. On the sidelines, one very young and unheralded stowaway wages her own fight against tyranny. Moreover, Michael’s escalating sophistication in weaponry is costing the dying planet the very companions she’s giving her life to save. Events move swiftly to a climax. With hope nearly gone, 
Michael’s family and remaining forces are trapped at the Well of Souls. There, with her strength completely gone, Pamveer can no longer help. Broken in spirit and in body, Michael’s family watches the last of the peasant army desert them. Face to face with an overwhelming enemy force, weaponless, and moments from death, the impossible occurs. The Worm makes one more decision. He makes one more sacrifice for a man he admires, a girl he loves, and a God for whom he has come to care deeply. Perhaps he is seeking one basic answer for all of humanity.
What is the real value of one life?Possible LocationsBrian Vaughan. With Kaylea Caulfield and Christie-Lee Britten from The Rarity.Brian has been involved in the film industry for over 20 years as an actor, producer, writer and director. In 1997, he established Spirit Rider Productions, a Queensland-based independent movie and television production house. Since then the company has been involved in Ten shorts and four TV pilots. Brian has been involved in the Television Industry working for Optus Television whilst  they were in Brisbane as a director's Assistant for nine television shows. Brian has brought Spirit Rider Productions through a series of stages. Starting with short films, he has evolved the undertaking to where he is making himself known in international circles and working with numerous companies to expand both himself and Spirit Rider Productions. He directed Infamous Cocktail Show forJeremy Rigby which screened at Briz 31 Digital in Brisbane. https://www.facebook.com/infamouscocktailshow?fref=ts He has recently been directing the Web Series Blinkers for Karen Buckton from Brisbane in Qld.  Brian Is now working with Atomic Pictures in Hollwood.Brian has written over 40 shorts and 15 features with more to come.. http://www.spiritriderproductions.com/Rose Warner is an Award Winning Producer and she is one of the most innovative and flexible producers in the industry, always ready to evaluate and adapt new ideas, technologies and systems which reflects on her amazing projects!Producer of "The Lion of Judah", "Tugger: The Jeep 4x4 Who Wanted to Fly" and a multitude of other projects, Rose Warner exudes confidence, intelligence and an unbridled sense of optimism; attributes that serve to reflect her outlook on life and underscore her value to the any industry. Ms. Warner is innovative and flexible in her thinking, always ready to evaluate and adapt new ideas, technologies and systems that can benefit any project.  Ms. Warner considers herself to be a team player with strong organizational and communication skills and someone who welcomes a challenge – especially one centered on business development.During the course of her career she has worked with an impressive array of prestigious motion picture studios including Warner Bros, Sony, Columbia, Buena Vista, Paramount, Universal, Fox, and MGM along with many Fortune 500 Companies.Rose holds a Degree in Communications/Multimedia Studies and was certified in Film & Video as a Producer and Director. In addition, she has studied Business, Marketing and Accounting, which lends to her amazing Business Plans and PPOs to aid in making any project welcomed among Investors!!! Julie Paupe is a screenwriter and executive producer of Wonder Works Films in Los Angeles - partners of Ridley Scott's RSA Films in the United Kingdom. She is also a screenwriter, screenplay editor and executive producer to Spirit Rider Productions in Australia. As an international screenplay consultant born in the United Kingdom, Julie is always happy to work on upcoming projects from other production companies and co-write with other screenwriters.




Mr Irwin began his career as an actor on General Hospital and The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson as well as feature films Modern Problems withChevy Chase. He recently appeared in Men From Reno, a film nominated for the John Cassavettes Award at the 2015 Independent Spirit Awards. He turned to production matters as a location assistant on The Streets Of San Fransisco. And then as First Assistant Director, Unit Production Manager,  and Associate Producer on such films as  Warcat, Forever, Warpath and The Confessional. Mr Irwin formed The Padula Production Group to develop projects for independent writers and producers which has recently expanded to producing scripts under Atomic Hollywood.Mr Irwin currectly has four film projects and two tv series in development.

Heather Beck is an award-winning Author and Screenwriter who began writing professionally at the age of sixteen. Her first book was published when she was only nineteen years old. Since then she has written eleven well-reviewed books. Heather recently received an Honors Bachelor of Arts from university where she specialized in English and studied an array of disciplines. Currently, she is working on two young adult novels and has six anthologies slated for publication. As a screenwriter, Heather has multiple television shows and movies in development. Her short films include Young Eyes, The Rarity, Too Sensible For Love, Circular and Witch’s Brew.
http://heatherbeck.tripod.com/


Scott Kimber: Director of Photography

Scott is a graduate of the Queensland College of Arts where he studied film production. In 2006, Scott was B cam and 2nd Unit DOP of the acclaimed feature film The Horseman. He was also the DOP of two more feature films, I Don’t Recommend Art or Love and Still Water as well as three television series and eight short films. Additionally, he has worked on three music videos and thirteen television commercials. Scott is the recipient of two awards from the Australian Cinematographer’s Society. He was the DOP for the feature film, Daddy’s Little Girl, which won a number of awards and the DOP for The Award winning Charlies Farm. Scott’s goal is to push the boundaries of each production, embracing new and old technology, while giving his films a unique look that compliments each production.
Scott was also the director for The Rarity short in 2011 which also won two award
http://scottkimber.com.au/
Natalie Stanfield: Hair and Make Up

Australia based Cinemagraphic artist Natalie Stanfield owns & operates Natstar.com.au offering freelance Make-up artistry & training, with over 10yrs experience in make-up, beauty & film.
Natalie’s knowledge and work is varied and has been featured in films, video clips, television, magazines, newspapers, journals, educational & training books/dvds, websites, advertising & media print campaigns. 
An accomplished & innovative artist with experience on projects as a Cinemagraphic make-up artist, special effects, character, design, hair, wig and body painting artist specializing in the film and entertainment industries. 
Natalie has always been creative and has a diverse flair for the arts & entertainment, working with celebrities, international and local talented artists. - See more at: http://www.natstar.com.au/#sthash.97YtRBmE.dpuf....

Ms. Semra Michaels is an extraordinarily gifted and creative artist. A powerful and captivating Singer/Songwriter/Music Producer/Composer, she can now add Author and Scriptwriter to her long list of talents! From the young age of six, Semra’s powerful vocals and charismatic performances have captured audiences all over Sydney in clubs, on TV and at events. Songwriting and learning instruments since the age of 12, this exuberance led her to write and co-produce “The Truth” with an accompanying novel of her inspirational life journey. She recently produced and independently released “Make your Move” which has Pop/Urban/Electro influences. She is the owner of Real Fine Productions – a Music Production House for Pop Artists, Film & TV. Semra also has a love for movies. Her current screenplay “Project Warrior Princess” is inspired by her book. Semra Michaels’ dynamic presence won’t be forgotten!

 Craig is a British actor that has taken the market by storm acquiring over 50,000 fans in the last 12 months working on films globally with multiple releases through 2015 - 2016, the British media tips Craig to be the next big thing to come out of the UK

He is the figure head of the TCEP _ TCEP - The Craig Edwards Project  
Non-profit charity set up to aid a multitude of causes from Help for Heroes, water and food shortages to cancer research and international disaster relief.
TCEP aims to support existing aid organisations as well as bringing awareness and supporting global issues and development.

After finishing Grade 12, I attended The Sunshine Coast Institute of TAFE graduating with a Certificate IV in Screen in 2008 During this time I was able to pick up three awards for his films including a Best Film award for “Prejudice” (a short documentary about stopping racism), Best Director and Best Film for “Our Guru of Surfing”. He is  a very energetic person. My specialty is surfing, snowboarding, horse riding, diving/filming and studying wildlife (hoping one day he will be able to act and/or be part of making a film about any of the four). He also do a lot of yoga and soccer. He is interested to be part of either a documentary about wildlife or any fictional short/feature film. Kiki Townley as Lyndsey



Kiki has been acting since she was 15 and continued all throughout high school - auditioning, being selected and being requested for diverse theater productions as well as film. She was 1 of 6, selected to be a part of the ensemble in the production, "YAIR - Dreaming", which entailed the 6 actors collaborating, developing and performing with a team of circus professionals. She played the Leading role in the Greek play Antigone as well as Stacy in the Margery Forde play, X-Stacy. She aimed and got the lead in school plays and, was always in some way, involved in the artistic or motivational aspects of school. She was selected to be a part of an ensemble of 30, produced by ARTOLOGY REMIX. The ensemble wrote and created an abstract and alternative view of Mary Shelley's 'Frankenstein'. 
Kiki was then selected at 15, to play a 21 year old role by the name of 'Lyndsey' in the Feature film, Rarity, cast as a supporting role by Brian Vaughan from 'A Spirit Rider Production'. Whilst the movie is in production and she was entering and studying hard in school she sacrificed her holidays and weekends to better her skills. Constantly seeking work in the industry. In year 11 and 12 of school she featured as an extra in a few projects, such as; 'Beyond redemption II' - a sci-fi feature,  'Why all Properties group?' - a TV commercial, 'Camp' - the USA television series - episodes 1 to 3 
directed by Bud Hopes, 'Infamous Cocktail Show' - Cast  as  Lady  with  speaking  role, as well as the voice overs in  season  1  -  6. After this, she was chosen to be one of the 5 leading ladies (ELLE) in the 'TINDA Diaries' by SKNPRODUCTIONS. The pilot has been released and the first season is in progress of script writing.  She has just graduated school, November 2014, with 6 awards, being; top of her class in drama and maths and receiving the spirit of Brisbane award and the principals award. Since she's graduated, she still feels acting is her calling. her first job out of school was playing an extra in a short film named 'Auma' Featuring James Rolleston, an award winning actor from the 2010 film, 'Boy'. Kiki eagerly awaits what's next.
