story:
Very excited to announce that multiple award winning actress Janie Dee will be leading the cast of As One! Her mantle includes Two Olivier Awards, an Evening Standard and a Critics Circle Award. Janie has worked closely with living playwrights, particularly Alan Ayckbourn, Michael Frayn and the late Harold Pinter in numerous productions and has become a renowned interpreter of their work which makes Janie the perfect choice for the lead role in As One. Her deep understanding of character motivations will bring a strong nuanced performance to the role of Maggie. For those who may not be familiar with her film work, check out her demo reel below and check out her website: 

AND NOW, THE PITCH:



ACROSS THE HALL   http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1029350/



SUNDAY PUNCH PREVIEW   http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3003744/


"Borders on some kind of mad genius." - The Film Corner
"A work of genius." - Short Film Fan
"He must come from a family of geniuses!" - Alan's parents
Check out the full reviews:
SUNDAY PUNCH FILM REVIEW
CBC SHORT FILM FACE OFF

Check out full film here: SUNDAY PUNCH


PHONE BOX TRAILER   http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3701388

WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE THIS FILM
In order to complete the full production we need to raise an additional £6180.00. Wherever possible I managed to negotiate incredible discounts on services (which I am incredibly grateful for). That combined with the same passionate production team that helped Phone Box be a success makes the amount we need to raise just enough to produce a beautiful looking film with excellent production value! This is how it breaks down;

Film Studio Rental w/Lighting Package ( £1037 - 0ne day rental)
We'll be shooting the cab interiors inside a cab, yes, but the cab will be inside a studio against a green screen. Shooting in studio gives us more control over lighting, sound and camera angles. 

Camera Package w/equipment & Anamorphic lenses - £810 (2 day rental)
ARRI Alexa XT is the camera that will give this film the look and feel that I want. The majority of the film takes place in an iconic Black Cab that London is known for so the anamorphic lenses will solve our visual challenge of squeezing two people into the frame and still having a sense of space. We'll also be capturing a few of London's most iconic locations on a camera and lense that will do it justice.
The 'equipment' is a jib arm - this piece of equipment will add dramatic impact and increase production value as it swoons down from 6' above it's subject for a cinematic feel. 

Black Cab Rental - £1000 (through an independent driver)
This is crucial to the shoot. The entire story takes place in the back of a cab as our wedding party make their way to the private ceremony. The cost covers two 12hr days.  

Professional, seasoned actors - £800 Honorarium (£200 x 4 actors)
Actors are the single most important piece of any character driven film. I owe a huge part of my success as a director to the actors whom I've cast. Their talent and skill to translate our shared vision of the character they're portraying into a screen performance that is authentic is the reason my stories work on screen. That's worth something! This token amount is just that - a token of my appreciation. Their time and talent is worth far more than what I can raise here and I wish I could afford to give them more. However, giving them something and supporting their storytelling skills with a token amount goes a long way in saying 'I value your talent and contribution'. 

Miscellaneous production costs - £910
Hard drive's for digital back ups of what we've shot (hate to lose that!), audio equipment rentals, Craft service (FOOD!) to keep our cast and crew happy while we're shooting, Rental of a production vehicle & petrol during the exterior shooting, location permit fees.

Post Production costs - £1100 (honorariums)
(picture edit, sound edit/mix, visual effects, colour grading & deliverables)
All these services will be pretty much donating their time a small honorarium for each. We're incredibly lucky to get deals like this and we're incredibly grateful too!

**Note on Visual Effects** 
Because we're shooting in a green screen studio we'll need to add in the background for the taxi. We'll also be able to create reflections off the passenger windows from the outside looking in. Very cool stuff but you'll only see the end result and think it's natural :)

INDIEGOGO costs - 4% is their cut once we meet our goal. It could be as high as 9% if we don't reach our goal but lets focus on the 4% ! 

CREDIT CARD/PAYPAL FEES - this can be between 3-5% 

Flat wire transfer fee of US$25 - Once the campaign has ended and we have reached our goal, this fee will be taken once the funds are transferred into our account. 

OUR TEAM (so far)

Alan Powell (Writer/Director) Originally from Toronto, Canada, Alan now lives in London, England. His broadcast credits include directing the international TV series Urban Legends for History Television, Biography Channel, and FX; and Fraud Squad TV for Investigation Discovery Canada.  Alan is a multiple award winning director whose short films have screened at film festivals worldwide. His production company Facilitator Films specializes in dramatizations for educational purposes. Visit www.alanpowelldirector.com and www.facilitatorfilms.com 

Edward MacLiam was most recently seen in Channel 4's 'Cucumber' & BBC's 'Ordinary Lies' & was a Holby City regular (Greg Douglas) from 2011-2012. He also starred alongside Maxine Peake & Will Forte in the film Run & Jump in 2013 for which he was nominated for Best Supporting Actor in the 2014 Irish Film and Television Awards. Ed also played the lead role of 'Dr. Gavin Kelly' in ABC Pilot 'Big Thunder'. 

Oliver Ford (Director of Photography) started his career as a stills photographer and soon found himself camera operating on a feature film under BAFTA-winning cinematographer John Mathieson BSC (Gladiator). Oliver shot award-winning director Alan Powell’s latest short Phone Box which competed at Vancouver International Film Festival and won Triforce Short Film Festival 2014; he also shot Neneh Cherry's latest music video and has worked for the BBC, Qantas, Tescos, Netflix, Kronenbourg, Ogilvy & Mather and Adam&EveDDB. Visit www.oliverfilms.com

Simeon Willis (First Assistant Director) is an actor first but his dedication to the craft of filmmaking goes beyond his acting talents. Simeon also 1st on the award-winning Phone Box directed by Alan Powell. His acting credits include; The Ipanema File, Narcopolis, Headlock Security,Castles Made of Sand, and 50 Kisses. Visit Simeon on  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1967726/

Riikka Lievonen (Make up Artist/Hair Stylist) talented and creative are the two words that sum up Riikka. Her talent was enlisted for Alan's last film, Phone Box. Other credits include the TV movie Start Up.

Nina Humphreys (Film Score) is an award-winning composer for the screen. Nina scored the award-winning short film Phone Box for director Alan Powell. Known for lyrical, dark and quirky scores, her eclectic credIts range from emotive character-led stories for contemporary and period settings to comedy, sci-fi and thrillers. Most recent projects include working with Julia Davis on her period-set black comedy Hunderby (Sky Atlantic); and the contemporary feature film Greyhawk. Visit www.ninahumphreys.co.uk

Dan Smith (Sound Design) is a graduate of Ravensbourne college, and currently works for Suite TV where he edits, tracklays, mixes and sound designs for many projects including the award-winning short film Phone Box. 


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

(Not really but you may be asking yourself...)

Q: Why a short film?
  • This is the first short film I've developed that speaks to a feature film I'm developing. Having a short piece with the same theme and tone helps when pitching the feature concept to funders.  As One is also a very solid stand alone piece that I'm certain will do quite well on the film festival circuit. The more festivals it plays the more recognition, the better my opportunities to get my feature film rolling. 
Q: Why not apply to funding agencies?
  • We applied to Creative England, a very competitive lottery fund, and the only scheme that was the best fit for the project. But alas, we were unsuccessful.
Q: I can't contribute. What else can I do to help? 
  • It's totally okay if you can't contribute cash. You can show your support by sharing our campaign link on your FB/Twitter account. It would mean a great deal if you could spread the word. The more people who know about our campaign the better our chances of reaching our funding goal. 
If you have a question or want to send a personal note please get in touch either through this campaign site or at alanpowelldirector@gmail.com

story:
This Isn't the Mississippi You Think You Know!

Deep in the heart of the Bible Belt comes a story about family...just NOT the kind of family you're expecting.  

It’s Just Us is a scripted drama centered on a little gay bar nestled in the heart of a coastal Mississippi city.  For decades the bar has been the sanctuary for those who needed it most, whether they be gay, straight, black, or white.  A beacon of tolerance in a place where history has proven there is little.  

Now the bar transitions into a new age and a new Civil Rights battle!  

THE STORY

Since the 60s, Just Us Lounge has been the ONE safe haven for its patrons.  A refuge... a second chance, whatever the community needs, Just Us has provided.  The bar has changed hands several times, but the values have stayed the same.  Until now!  The last owner of the bar died and bequeathed his sacred bar and home to his homophobic son...who he's been estranged with for nearly 20 years!  This can't end well for one of the South's landmark Gay bars.

Jordan Albritton has been the ideal son.  Honest, loyal, obedient...he's done everything his parents always taught him a 'good' son does.  So when he admits his sexuality to his father, the most powerful minister in the state, he's SHOCKED when his entire world comes crashing down around him.  Since no one in his hometown is willing to offend the good Reverend Albritton, Jordan has no choice but to make a pilgrimage to the only place he's ever heard of that would help guys like him. 

Now that Bryce Jeter's service in the United States Air Force has ended, he has no IDEA what to do next.  He has no living family to return to.  As a second generation military man, he has no roots to speak of.  All he has are wants and desires...he's just not sure what to do with either!  In the meantime, he thinks he can stick around and help this homophobic yankee steer the bar in the right direction.  At least he can have an impact...or so he thinks!

                THE CHARACTERS

Tony Ramirez:  A successful entrepreneur from New York City, Ramirez inherits the bar from his estranged, gay father whom he hasn't spoken to in since childhood. His parents divorced when he was a child after his father came out of the closet.  

Tony never forgave his father and was shocked to learn of the inheritance.   Yet the businessman in him never passes up an opportunity to  profit.  And despite his homophobia, he looks to whip the struggling bar into shape and sell high!

Bryce Jeter:  Recently discharged from the Air Force, Bryce doesn't really know what to do next.  He wants to fall in love and start a family, but that's easier said than done for a gay man in the deep south.  With no family to return to, Bryce decides to stick around for a while.  

A boarder in the house that Tony inherits, the two men quickly become the best of friends.  And it's Bryce that begins to soften Tony's hard line anti-gay sentiment. 

Jordan Albritton: A superb student near the top of his class at Ole Miss, Jordan's entire life comes crashing down around him when he comes out to his parents.  The only child of one of the most powerful preachers in the deep south, Jordan is exiled by his family.  Not knowing what else to do, he heads to the one place he's heard of that can help. . . Just Us.  For the first time in his life he's completely on his own...and free to break any commandments he chooses!

Together, the three men grow into a tight-knit family unit.  They bond as brothers, with the same fiery passion and, at times, explosive fury as any group of siblings.


     THE SERIES                 

The initial focus lies around JORDAN, who has only recently come out of the closet and as a result lost everything he has ever known.  Eventually the focus will shift the inner-conflict of TONY’S sexuality and perhaps a burgeoning romance among the housemates.

Also, several issues of LGBT rights will be explored from bullying to hate crimes; from marriage equality to discrimination and harassment.  Furthermore, the Deep South backdrop provides an opportunity to show the differences between the coastal community and more traditional, rural Mississippi communities.  Jordan proves to be the perfect conduit to contrast the differing communities and explore the varying levels of advancement in acceptance.  

Far more than just a prime-time drama, It's Just Us  will serve as a social commentary on a rapidly growing sub-culture as well as a running examination of the shifting of societal taboos and tolerances.  Dissecting the ebb and flow of  a community reputable (and at times notorious) for its dogged adherence to all things ‘traditional’ as well as the growing influence of a LGBT culture as it increases in size (for no other reason than more people willing to come out and live their lives open and honestly without fear of ridicule or ruin).  

At its foundation It’s Just Us is a family oriented drama depicting an alternate family existing in a staunchly traditional bastion.  While the primary focus will lie with the three leads, plenty of latitude will be given to examine in depth the tangential, relevant issues.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce this pilot and shop the project to networks, we need your help.  Every dollar contributed will go directly into funding the filming and promotion of the series.  Here's what your helping us do:
  1. Production Insurance - required by state law in order to film on public spaces (i.e. beaches, roads, etc.)
  2. Equipment rentals and purchase in order to meet networks' specs and provide you with the highest quality sound and picture. While we have top notch cameras and boom mics, we still need lavalier mics, upgraded lighting equipment, and more.  To package and present it to networks, we have to shoot it in the highest quality.
  3. Set operations, art, music, wardrobe and make up, locations fees, etc., are all mandatory expenses to make any production a successful one.  
  4. Cast and crew salaries.  
Our $7,000 goal covers the costs of production and post-production expenses.  
If we hit $10,000 then we will be able to market and promote our pilot on a national level.  In order to get the greatest attention from network executives, we need to have a strong social media presence...the more 'likes' and 'retweets' the stronger our position will be when it comes to finding a network home...AND being in as many of your homes as possible!
The Impact

There a few things we'd like you to keep in mind.

  • This show is a show about unity, family, and togetherness.  In an age where gay teenagers are increasingly harassed and bullied, where suicide rats rise instead of fall, it's all the more important to present characters and situations that not only entertain, but also enlighten, and are able to be indentified with by those who fear they have to face these challenging times alone.  
  • This will be the FIRST episodic scripted drama set and shot entirely on the Mississippi Gulf Coast, which is vital for the burgeoning film industry developing within the state.  Steady work for camera men, actors, sound engineers, lighting experts, wardrobers... It's a big step and will heavily impact the rapidly growing industry in the state.  

To package and pitch a television series to networks takes an incredible effort.  While there is a strong interest in It's Just Us, it will get much stronger.  A great pilot followed up by an aggressive marketing campaign designed to peek intrigue and gather 'followers', 'likes', and 'retweets' will prove to the Hollywood big shots that Mississippi is capable and ready to accept this challenge.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word...share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or any media or social media forum.
story_txt:
This Isn't the Mississippi You Think You Know!

Deep in the heart of the Bible Belt comes a story about family...just NOT the kind of family you're expecting.  

It’s Just Us is a scripted drama centered on a little gay bar nestled in the heart of a coastal Mississippi city.  For decades the bar has been the sanctuary for those who needed it most, whether they be gay, straight, black, or white.  A beacon of tolerance in a place where history has proven there is little.  
Now the bar transitions into a new age and a new Civil Rights battle!  
THE STORY
Since the 60s, Just Us Lounge has been the ONE safe haven for its patrons.  A refuge... a second chance, whatever the community needs, Just Us has provided.  The bar has changed hands several times, but the values have stayed the same.  Until now!  The last owner of the bar died and bequeathed his sacred bar and home to his homophobic son...who he's been estranged with for nearly 20 years!  This can't end well for one of the South's landmark Gay bars.
Jordan Albritton has been the ideal son.  Honest, loyal, obedient...he's done everything his parents always taught him a 'good' son does.  So when he admits his sexuality to his father, the most powerful minister in the state, he's SHOCKED when his entire world comes crashing down around him.  Since no one in his hometown is willing to offend the good Reverend Albritton, Jordan has no choice but to make a pilgrimage to the only place he's ever heard of that would help guys like him. 
Now that Bryce Jeter's service in the United States Air Force has ended, he has no IDEA what to do next.  He has no living family to return to.  As a second generation military man, he has no roots to speak of.  All he has are wants and desires...he's just not sure what to do with either!  In the meantime, he thinks he can stick around and help this homophobic yankee steer the bar in the right direction.  At least he can have an impact...or so he thinks!


                THE CHARACTERS

Tony Ramirez:  A successful entrepreneur from New York City, Ramirez inherits the bar from his estranged, gay father whom he hasn't spoken to in since childhood. His parents divorced when he was a child after his father came out of the closet.  
Tony never forgave his father and was shocked to learn of the inheritance.   Yet the businessman in him never passes up an opportunity to  profit.  And despite his homophobia, he looks to whip the struggling bar into shape and sell high!
Bryce Jeter:  Recently discharged from the Air Force, Bryce doesn't really know what to do next.  He wants to fall in love and start a family, but that's easier said than done for a gay man in the deep south.  With no family to return to, Bryce decides to stick around for a while.  
A boarder in the house that Tony inherits, the two men quickly become the best of friends.  And it's Bryce that begins to soften Tony's hard line anti-gay sentiment. 
Jordan Albritton: A superb student near the top of his class at Ole Miss, Jordan's entire life comes crashing down around him when he comes out to his parents.  The only child of one of the most powerful preachers in the deep south, Jordan is exiled by his family.  Not knowing what else to do, he heads to the one place he's heard of that can help. . . Just Us.  For the first time in his life he's completely on his own...and free to break any commandments he chooses!
Together, the three men grow into a tight-knit family unit.  They bond as brothers, with the same fiery passion and, at times, explosive fury as any group of siblings.

The initial focus lies around JORDAN, who has only recently come out of the closet and as a result lost everything he has ever known.  Eventually the focus will shift the inner-conflict of TONY’S sexuality and perhaps a burgeoning romance among the housemates.
Also, several issues of LGBT rights will be explored from bullying to hate crimes; from marriage equality to discrimination and harassment.  Furthermore, the Deep South backdrop provides an opportunity to show the differences between the coastal community and more traditional, rural Mississippi communities.  Jordan proves to be the perfect conduit to contrast the differing communities and explore the varying levels of advancement in acceptance.

At its foundation It’s Just Us is a family oriented drama depicting an alternate family existing in a staunchly traditional bastion.  While the primary focus will lie with the three leads, plenty of latitude will be given to examine in depth the tangential, relevant issues.

story:
We Need Your Help

THE LONG WAY is our feature film and we are extremely passionate about making it. We need your help to stretch our meager budget enough to fit our not-so-meager dreams for this film. Taking the plunge and chasing your dreams is a difficult thing to do. For the cast and crew of The Long Way, this project is a big step in our creative and professional journeys. Through this IndieGoGo, we're inviting you to become a part of this journey and help us make something great.

Basics

TLW could be described as a “coming of age classic meets road trip indie”. Inspired by actual events, The Long Way touches on many topics we can all relate to: following a stable career vs. following your passion, religion, family pressure, long distance relationships, moving away from home, and taking risks along the way.

Adulthood is scary and taking the plunge to follow your dreams is even scarier. Much like the theme of the film, our goal is to pursue our dreams and create an amazing movie. We will be shooting the film in Late May 2015 for approximately four weeks. We will shoot half of the film in Los Angeles and then venture to Oregon for the other half. Our film will be shot under SAG contract.

The screenplay was inspired by a real trip that Josh (the writer) took when he moved to Los Angeles a year and a half ago. While it isn’t quite based on a true story, many elements of the characters and plot were lifted from real life. From broad character descriptions to details as small as imaginary camp girlfriends, the real elements of Josh's life that are weaved into the plot will make the story more honest and cause Josh's parents to squirm.

The Story

What happens when the generation that got soccer trophies just for participation stumbles into the real world where everyone doesn’t always win? This story is for everyone who has questioned whether they’re truly as special as their parents and teachers told them they are.

THE LONG WAY is a coming of age road movie about a young writer who travels to Los Angeles to follow his dream. The title refers both to the actual route of Sam’s trip (he goes south to Florida before heading west to Los Angeles) and his stunted journey to adulthood. Even though the world sees him as an adult, Sam still thinks of himself as a 25 year old kid. He has delayed maturation because he’s scared of it and because the people around him have let him. By traveling around the country en route to his new home, he learns what it means to be an adult from his family and friends along the way.

The night before Sam is to leave with Emma on the road trip, she gives him an ultimatum: If he doesn't say he loves her, she won't go. From there, Sam’s trip weaves between the realities of the trip with his girlfriend Emma and his best friend Howie. 

Emma is cautious and thinks through every decision she makes. She’s had her life planned out from the get-go and she can’t understand how loose Sam is with his big decisions. With this road trip, Emma tries to get Sam to realize how foolish it is to enter an uncertain future and attempts to convince him to join her in reality.

Howie lives his life on the fly, going wherever and doing whatever he thinks is the most fun. He refuses to be bogged down by responsibilities or conform to expectations, so much so that he is a contrarian for no real reason. On the road trip, Howie wants Sam to let loose and shirk responsibilities, if only to legitimize his own way of life.

These two trips butt heads as Sam strives to achieve the balance between the two sides of his personality. In order to really grow up and become the adult he wants to be, Sam tries to balance his opposing desires to take risks and play it safe.

For Howie, being an adult is exercising the freedom to do whatever the hell one wants to do. For Emma, adulthood is when you resist your urges and make responsible choices. Through the road trip, Sam needs to figure out what being an adult means to him.

Meet the Cast


Chadwick Hopson – SAM

Chad plays Sam Horowitz, our protagonist, who embarks on a road trip of self-discovery and angst to pursue his dream of being a screenwriter in Los Angeles. Chad grew up in Flagstaff, AZ. Before coming to LA, he attended Daemen College in New York on a soccer scholarship. He’s also right at home on the tennis court and despite his love of competitive sports, most people don’t know that Chad is actually a pretty good dancer. He believes in always staying busy as an actor, and has worked on several shorts and web projects this year. Chad will also star in the feature film How We Met, which is set to release in 2015.

http://www.chadwickhopson.com/

@chadwickhopson


Katie Kusiciel – EMMA

Katie Kusiciel will play the role of Emma, Sam’s girlfriend who joins him on his cross-country road trip. Katie is a small town girl and a comedic actress at heart, sort of like a kickboxing pistol-shooting cross between Katherine Heigl and Kristin Wiig. The native Arkansan is a graduate of USC, and trains with the Groundlings in LA. Katie can be seen most recently playing Anne in the web series, Adopted.

http://www.katiekusiciel.com/

@katiekusiciel


Scotty Dickert - HOWIE

Scotty Dickert joins TLW as Sam’s insouciant smooth-talking best friend Howie. Scotty grew up in Brookfield, Wisconsin and attended the University of Wisconsin in Green Bay. Often cast as the frat guy or the stoner, he loves making people laugh. Scotty has made appearances on shows such as Victorious, Community and a major upcoming network drama. You can also see Scotty in the feature film Odd Brodsky, or playing Jamie in the upcoming Amazon TV pilot, Salem Rogers.

http://www.scottydickert.com/

@ScottyDickert


Lynn Downey – AUNT SHELLY

Lynn brings her special flair for sketch comedy and improv to the role of Aunt Shelly. An Indiana native with strong roots to the theatre, she has illuminated the stage in numerous productions including Cold Tangerines: The Play and Long Day’s Journey Into Night. Lynn received critical acclaim for her film short “Blue”, which was adapted from a story that she created. The busy actress also hosts the quirky cooking show, “The Can Do Kitchen”.

http://www.lynndowney.net/

@lynner54321

Vince DonVito – UNCLE MOE

Vince, often cast as the tough guy or the mobster (just ask him to do the accent), is like that cool uncle that we all have—if your uncle is a 5th degree black belt from Bronx who can also toss a mean pizza. Vince has worked on TV shows such as Seinfeld, CSI:NY and Wizards of Waverly Place. Most recently, he can be seen playing Marco in the family comedy feature How To Beat A Bully.

http://www.vincedonvito.com/

@VinceDonVito

Sarah Stunt – JESSICA

Sarah Stunt joins TLW cast as our token Canadian, bringing her unique dramatic edge to the role of Jessica. Her character teaches Sam and Emma how to line dance in the film, and Sarah couldn’t be more excited because she’s a master line dancer herself. Okay not really—but she is excited to learn! She has appeared on such hit shows as TNT’s Falling Skies and the CBS television series Flash Point. You can also see Sarah on the new SyFy show Killjoys, premiering in 2015.

http://www.sarahstunt.com/ 

@sarahstunt

Sara Castro – ANGIE

Sara Castro will portray Angie, the been-around-the block beauty who Sam meets at a trucker bar. When Sara isn’t in front of the camera doing what she loves, the outdoorsy actress can be found mountain biking or hiking, among other nature hobbies that she enjoys. Sara was born and raised in Chicago, where she also attended college and cultivated her expertise in singing and Latin dance. Indie film audiences will recognize Sara as Carmen from The Shift, where she starred opposite Danny Glover. 

http://www.saracastro.net/

@saracastroactor


Dan Braswell – MITCH, The News Anchor

@DanBraswell


Brian Flaccus - MATT

Brian Flaccus's character, Matt, is an old friend and fraternity brother of our protagonist. In real life though, Brian considers himself less frat-bro and more Viking warrior; he is an avid outdoorsman and has been known to conquer island nations. Brian is a very talented actor and has appeared on numerous television shows and feature films including, but not limited to "Harry's Law", "All My Children", "Movie 43", "Breakin' Till Dawn", "Wizards of Waverley Place" and "Kelsey".

http://brianhanceflaccus.com/

@bflacc

Renée Willett - HILARY
Renee Willett will bring to life the character of HILARY, an opinionated hipster girl who adamantly rejects being labeled as a hipster. Like her character, Renee also prefers to reject labels unless they come as reviews of her acting talent, which has been described as: "amazing", "riveting" and "wow!". This talented actress has a resume that includes several USC (her alma mater) graduate films as well as Broadcast/Hosting projects and numerous theatre productions.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5624753/

There will be more cast and crew announcements to come in the next month, so be sure to keep up with our exciting updates!


What does your contribution do?

How else can I get involved?

Even if you can't help fund THE LONG WAY and score some of our awesome contributor perks, you can still be a part of the project by sharing our story and following our journey via TLW official website and social media accounts. We are determined to make a beautiful and inspiring film not only for TLW funders, but also for all lovers of independent film. 
YOU have the power to help make The Long Way happen. Thanks for reading.

story:
~ Be PART of Movie History ~



The momentum keeps building. Visit our new campaign website at: http://igg.me/at/MysticTravelerTrilogy for all the latest!

     

     Every once in a while... a movie comes along
                that seems to change everything.


Our Mystic Traveler Trilogy changes so much in enjoying films, we’ll wonder at it. Mystic Traveler  elevates us in new pleasure, as we have new sound-waves for our ears and minds - in  new "auditory-storytelling". Our trilogy has sweeping grandeur  that you will love.  It's a science fiction hero-adventure with metaphysical themes.

Those elements are in the most popular movies of all time, like the 'Star Wars' saga. This trilogy weaves mystery intrigue, time-travel, extraterrestrial struggle, all in the magic of the paranormal--including the "death and resurrection" of heroes, and the archetypal inner battle which mankind has, in our own Self. 

Mystic Traveler will have the galactic grandeur of films such as Avatar, & Star Trek, with the spectacle of Lord of the Rings, and the gritty reality of Gladiator. Just as the 'Force' in Star Wars captivated audiences worldwide, our films will also take us to a place we've rarely ever seen- to the inside of consciousness - to the "Presence."

Mystic Traveler makes movie history by providing several "firsts" in film-making.

Look at all these “FIRSTS”
* Imagine a film trilogy with 3 directors completing all 3 films simultaneously.

* Imagine releasing all 3 films in one year - 3 months apart, to see them all ‘now.’
* Imagine a new sound-wave recording technology that immerses and enhances the
   film, and You. What 3-D did to Visuals we'll do to Audio: like "sunrise for your ears"
* Imagine seeing and hearing "first ever DVD Movie Music Albums" - 12 videos/disc.
* Imagine 3 music CD's "out at once" for auto, home, and portable-music listening.
* Imagine 3 novels from the film trilogy, all released at the same time, for readers.
* Imagine 3 coffee table top books "The Making of" each film (screenplay included).
* Imagine all 3 of our films competing with each other at the Academy Awards.

                 DVD MOVIE MUSIC ALBUMS ...first ones ever... All for You

We invented the Movie DVD Music Album just for you: You'll watch movie scenes  with the 'corresponding music'. Lyrics are perfectly matched to the film's scenes. FACT:  Mystic Traveler has more music, music-media, and delivery methods than any film ever.  Our music has an emotional resonance that runs truly deep. All will be viewable on iPods, MP3s, iPads, or at home on television. Love music? Then our Mystic Traveler Trilogy is for you.

YOU ARE HERE

Now, imagine this film beginning with YOU on Indiegogo. Imagine You in the film credits. Imagine your being a real part of all this Mystic Traveler fun... and fame. Now look to the right to see your many potential gifts - just for participating here.  And by your being with us, right here and now, you help make it happen "sooner"
in this moment of the 21st century. You can choose now - Be A Part - look right.

However if you want to be fascinated further scroll down the page to learn great details of the Mystic story, and meet our professional film team. See all the exciting ways we have to Thank You for being part of the Mystic Traveler adventure.

        

                 


Like all great epics, these films are rich in expansive stories - high adventure, love, romance, journeys and heroic transformation

         "A hero is someone who has given his or her life, to something bigger
            than oneself."  - Joseph Campbell           

          
            


Can the unknown missing years of "Yeshua" be the greatest Hero Story? 

Yes. Mystic Traveler reveals the lost years of the life of Yeshua ben Yosev more commonly known as JESUS.  His, is the cosmic hero-story that we waited over
2000 years to truly know and feel. But this is not your grandfather's Jesus film.
It’s not from a bygone era; it’s not syrupy, slow-moving or even a religious film.

It’s a hero-story from ancient of days literature - the inspiring presentation and vision, of the person, who most influenced the course of our world history.

We believe this Mystic Trilogy is the most authentic presentation of Jesus' life-
time in entertainment history. The audience will get the rich texture of a full life based on decades of research.  We'll see and feel him pass through high adventure in these stunning films - which are bathed in astounding special effects, exploring mysteries of consciousness...and from time immemorial.


               

THE LOST YEARS

We know almost nothing about Jesus' life between his birth and age 30 when he began teaching, healing, and performing miracles which transcended time and space, second to none in history.   Why is Superman so MUCH like Jesus?

Why, When, and How did this remarkable power develop? 

  • What events composed his youth?
  • Which people and issues challenged him?
  • Who were his teachers?
  • Did he travel outside his nation? 
  • What was his family home like - was he a good older brother? 
  • What did he have to teach us of the essence of our consciousness?
  • What was it like having Roman soldiers lining his roadways?                  

                                                  

                         
                          GLOBAL IMPACT FOR ALL PEOPLE EVERYWHERE

           

We have three built-in audiences for Mystic Traveler:
  • Sci-Fi Fantasy Adventure Fans 
  • Historical Epic Costume-Flick Audiences
  • Worldwide Metaphysical and Spiritual Communities

Just one of these three audiences can create a blockbuster hit.

 

         

From Us to You - Our Partnership

We here at Enthios Entertainment desire you to have the greatest gifts, benefits, perks and the largest experience in film-going/film-partnering pleasure of any
other crowd-funding experience.

You'll assist getting stellar Hollywood directors. We will be attaching some of the most prestigious names in the entertainment industry to our three films, as well as magnificent well-known, popular actors.

We’re creating movie masterpieces.  Want to be a part of Mystic Traveler?  We are ready to create movie-making history. And we want you to be part of it!


           

What You Get ... What We Need - We Need You! 

Contributions here to a $400,000 budget engages a multi-million dollar accredited private placement plan (PPM) with a NYC finance firm that regularly raises millions for hit Broadway plays, film, and entertainment over just  months. Then we will do that hiring of actors and directors in the development and pre-production period of Mystic Traveler. The funds required for the finance plan, including our own invested monies, are for legal, travel, art, accountancy, printing, and ancillary professional fees. This funding brings Mystic Traveler to you and the world.  So, thank you.

Your One-of-a-Kind Rewards

Look right over there to see rewards for being a part of Mystic Traveler with us. We've designed new products which have never been offered by any film before.

Our gifts are to thank you in tangible ways for your support and to welcome you to the Mystic Traveler team. Many gifts won't be available to purchase anywhere else later, but are offered in this initial Indiegogo campaign, so don't miss them now.

And even if you can't donate, you can share a message of our presence with every one you know, especially with family, friends, colleagues and other movie lovers.
You can spread the word in conversation and in your favorite social media.
Just tell them: Indiegogo.com - and - Mystic Traveler. 


Use the convenient Indiegogo "share tools" here. Tell others about the incredible Mystic Traveler project on Indiegogo, making an impact on global entertainment.

Just clicking through this site can help bring this project to the eyes of others, in
the science of computers.  One other thing. 

Check out BIG rewards for spreading the word in our "Red Carpet Referral Contest":

              

                                                       THE BACKSTORY

Enthios Entertainment

At Enthios Entertainment we've prepared for years. Our team has over 140 years of Hollywood expertise as directors, producers, line producers, production managers,  3-D, film artists, cinematographers and animators; we know the "nuts and bolts" of film making. We also know that film-making reinvents itself over time, a great deal.
You want to reinvent with us?  You can right here. Mystic Traveler will go down in history as a film "lifting-up movie making".  Imagine one movie with all this.


   

They are written by a biblical historian with passions for metaphysics, quantum physics and entertainment, so there are many universal concepts explored here.  He has written, produced, and directed five very unique productions for the stage and video. Mystic Traveler’s scripts and his five worldwide books are based in decades of research on ancient scrolls, and from modern archaeological finds. He saw the full story possibility of epic adventure films calling out from the scrolls.

Why Support this Project?    Here’s Important Reasons Why:

*You deserve to know the whole story. Much has been hidden over the centuries
  for reasons of politics, culture and linguistics.
*What we'll discover will have a profound impact on what we know about our
   selves, our world and the essence of our personal consciousness.

     
      "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind."                                                                                                                            - Albert Einstein 

                                                 JOIN THE ADVENTURE

                                             

Ever dream there could be more to the story?
Could the complete story, told fully, share a new experience?
        Consider all the gifts here, the benefits, levels, and the film's exciting ideas.
                              You will know what's proper.  Most of all, have fun.
    Thank you for your energy, good will, your partnership, and your Enthios-iasm.

                                             


   


Click here to learn more on our website: MysticTravelerTheMovie.com

story:
Short Summary

I am Panos Alexandrou, a small bussiness enterpreneur from Athens, Greece. The current financial crisis has forced me to seek alternative sources of income to make ends meet. I own a small, traditional house on the beautiful island of Spetses, which has been my family vacation house since 1925. I want to renovate this house, making it more attractive and suitable for rent to foreign visitors by the week.
In order to do this I will need to repaint it from floor to ceiling, revamp the facade, improve the furniture, improve the small garden, buy new cutlery, crockery, mattresses and linen and, last but not least, get a Greek Tourism Organisation Licence, which is never simple or cheap.

This cannot obviously be a one-man-job. Besides the working teams, I am relying on Polyxenie the architect, whose good taste and long experience in renovating old houses will make sure that everything will run smoothly and we will be on time for our first visitors in May-June.


What We Need & What You Get

I have made a budget for this:

Painting:      3000 Euros
Facade:        1000 Euros
Furniture:     1500 Euros
Garden:          500 Euros
Stuff:            1000 Euros

License:       1500 Euros

Total:            8500 Euros

I will need around 2 months to have the house ready, so that I can catch the 2015 summer season.

Helping me out with this will be highly appreciated and, besides the hearty "Thank you", I have thought of a few perks for those involved. So, please, check out the right hand side of this page and pick up the ones that suit you best!


The Impact

This house was built in 1907 and bought by my granfather in 1925 as a vacation house. Spetses has always been a high class resort, frequented by the wealthy , who would come to the island in their yachts, but also a very popular family spot, as it is close to Athens. The house is in the center of the village, 3 minutes walk from the port and 2 minutes from the beach. It is 90m2, fully equipped to sleep 4-6 people and it's small internal garden is a good place to spend a lazy afternoon. All this has given me the idea of renovating it into a friendly, family vacation house for people who want to visit a really beautiful Greek island, but not mix with the crouds. The house may be old, but it is well maintained. A good renovation will highlight it's traditional features and upgrade it into a really pleasant summer family accomodation.



Risks & Challenges

I don't think there are any risks in this. We know the job, we have a good working team on the island and a competent engineer who knows all about Greek licences. When we start working we will be finished on time to welcome our first guests in May-June. In order to do this smoothly and with no "hickups", we will need your involvement and financial assistance. Please, feel free to ask any questions and even the smallest donation is welcome.

story:
This February, the pilot of our show Neither Here Nor There will be finished.  We're doing the show because we're passionate about comedy, we love the medium of podcasting, and we have a great story to tell.  No one else is doing a show quite like the one we are making, and we have over a dozen extremely talented people lending their voices and creative abilities to the project.  We need your help to fund our show production, to buy equipment for our live show, to procure studio time, and to create merchandise moving forward.

The show is a creatively written satirical radiositcom.  It's a combination of post-modern anti-comedy and old-time radio shows like The Jack Benny Show or The George Burns show.  

It follows Dante Davis, a ne'er-do-well twenty-something who finds himself stuck between two worlds after getting in a motorcycle accident and landing in a coma.

The setting of the show is limbo.  Upon hearing of Dante's arrival, The Devil and God try to sell him on joining them in heaven and hell. Dante holds out to get back to Earth to reunite with his girlfriend Laura.  Dante's only friend in limbo is a frog-demon by the name of George Finkelblat, who is responsible for accommodating all of the lost souls in limbo.

The show thrives on skewering mainstream media, current events, and popular media texts.  It follows a semi-linear storyline, with an unrelenting series of surreal pit-stops along the way.

The show is written by The Engelbart Brothers, features original music and sound production by Anthony Mackechnie, original artwork by Daniel Fleming, and a talented cast of professional theater and voice actors:

 Derek James Knabenbauer as Dante Davis and Various Others
 Nik Meurett as Johnny/Mom/Richard Nixon/A variety of others Jordan Hunt as George Finkelblat and the Big RaguAnthony Mackechnie as The Devil/ Sylvester Stallone/ Various Others
 Colin Tanner as God/Mickey the Manager/ Various Others

story:
Short Summary

I'm Dr. Sage Breslin, CFO of The Grazlin Group. As a Psychologist filmmaker, I have the unique opportunity to observe and identify special issues that arise- for individuals, families, organizations and even communities.

One of the issues that has become tremendously apparent is that the Twentysomethings have grown up tech native but are socially and culturally deprived.  Hooked into their electronics, they've missed the organic education and training found in social situations. Without any idea how to conduct themselves, they are at a disadvantage when they appear for job interviews, board meetings and other important functions. Their lack of skills may even impair their motivation for leaving their parents' home in search of independence.

This generation doesn't even recognize the value of the training their parents and grandparents have had in social circumstances and are not responsive to the normal education and training. It's time to hit them where they live- through competitive reality programming.

Pulled from the LA club scene, sixteen twentysomethings will learn all they need to know about food and beverage selection, meal preparation and service, as well as appropriate dinner conversation and social decorum- in just under 16 weeks. They will compete for $50,000 and the chance to host an A-lister for dinner! But, given that contestants will be voted off each week, and an empty seat at the table just isn't right, seats will be filled by surprise celebrity party guests, leaving contestants saying, "Guess who's Coming to Dinner?"

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget for the sizzle reel is $3500.00. This incorporates the following costs:

*Payroll for SAG/AFTRA actors: $2144.00

*Payroll for non-SAG/AFTRA actors: $700.00

*Payroll for crew: $500.00

*Props: $100.00

*Miscellaneous: $56.00

For those that donate $500-999: We will be happy to use your last name for one of our characters and provide you with a copy of the Sizzle Reel when it's finished!

For those that donate $1000 or more, we'll be happy to refer to you by name on screen as absent party guests! we'll also send you a copy of the sizzle reel as soon as it's available and a thank you card signed by our cast!!!

The Impact

We at The Grazlin Group and our entire cast are dedicated to putting into production programming that is lively and fun but that also makes a real world impact! The Twentysomething generation needs to learn the skills necessary to function independently and successfully in both personal and professional relationships and this show has the capacity to bring that education and opportunity to them.

Your contributions will enable the sizzle reel to be filmed so that we can provide a comprehensive and engaging pitch package to network execs and get this project sold and into production!

Risks & Challenges

Our celebrated and committed cast will make this reel SIZZLE without a doubt! While there is no guarantee that the show will be picked up immediately, a great reel makes all the difference when pitching a project!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not willing or able to contribute to our financial goal, you can help us succeed by holding space, keeping us and the project in your prayers, and introducing us to the network exec or director next door ;)
story_txt:
Short Summary I'm Dr. Sage Breslin, CFO of The Grazlin Group. As a Psychologist filmmaker, I have the unique opportunity to observe and identify special issues that arise- for individuals, families, organizations and even communities.
One of the issues that has become tremendously apparent is that the Twentysomethings have grown up tech native but are socially and culturally deprived.  Hooked into their electronics, they've missed the organic education and training found in social situations. Without any idea how to conduct themselves, they are at a disadvantage when they appear for job interviews, board meetings and other important functions. Their lack of skills may even impair their motivation for leaving their parents' home in search of independence.
This generation doesn't even recognize the value of the training their parents and grandparents have had in social circumstances and are not responsive to the normal education and training. It's time to hit them where they live- through competitive reality programming.
Pulled from the LA club scene, sixteen twentysomethings will learn all they need to know about food and beverage selection, meal preparation and service, as well as appropriate dinner conversation and social decorum- in just under 16 weeks. They will compete for $50,000 and the chance to host an A-lister for dinner! But, given that contestants will be voted off each week, and an empty seat at the table just isn't right, seats will be filled by surprise celebrity party guests, leaving contestants saying, "Guess who's Coming to Dinner?"   What We Need & What You Get Our budget for the sizzle reel is $3500.00. This incorporates the following costs:
*Payroll for SAG/AFTRA actors: $2144.00
*Payroll for non-SAG/AFTRA actors: $700.00
*Payroll for crew: $500.00
*Props: $100.00
*Miscellaneous: $56.00
For those that donate $500-999: We will be happy to use your last name for one of our characters and provide you with a copy of the Sizzle Reel when it's finished!
For those that donate $1000 or more, we'll be happy to refer to you by name on screen as absent party guests! we'll also send you a copy of the sizzle reel as soon as it's available and a thank you card signed by our cast!!!   The Impact We at The Grazlin Group and our entire cast are dedicated to putting into production programming that is lively and fun but that also makes a real world impact! The Twentysomething generation needs to learn the skills necessary to function independently and successfully in both personal and professional relationships and this show has the capacity to bring that education and opportunity to them.
Your contributions will enable the sizzle reel to be filmed so that we can provide a comprehensive and engaging pitch package to network execs and get this project sold and into production!   Risks & Challenges Our celebrated and committed cast will make this reel SIZZLE without a doubt! While there is no guarantee that the show will be picked up immediately, a great reel makes all the difference when pitching a project! story:
Bounty Momma


It is our last day of the fundraiser!! Please consider a donation of any size to help us meet our goal!


From award winning director, producer, and actress Wendy Keeling, comes Bounty Momma, a comedic redneck romp wrapped up as a web series. If you could find a way to combine Reno 911, The Beverly Hillbillies, and Dog the Bounty Hunter you may just come up with Bounty Momma!

 
With our pilot shot and submitted to film festivals we are now ready to continue shooting the web series / TV show. We will be screening the pilot at the prestigious Nashville Film Festival in April and at the Cape Fear Independent Film Festival in June. We have already shot 3 episodes and plans are already underway to shoot the last 3 episodes for season #1. We are working under a SAG New Media Contract. It is our plan to pitch the series to networks and online distribution but we plan to go live with the web series online in March no matter what!


Synopsis:
The bounty hunting world will never be the same under the watch of hot redneck momma Twyla Sue Dollarhide and her dim witted family. Twyla Sue Dollarhide, aka "Bounty Mama", is a no-nonsense southern firecracker with a reality show who, despite the incompetence of her gun toting lamebrain family and film crew, proudly boasts that she "always gets her man"! This reality parody brings the viewer inside the day to day of a dysfunctional family business that turns otherwise mundane bounty escapades into mayhem and madness.





What We Need & What You Get

Creating film content is pretty darned expensive as you may guess. Our cast and crew believes in this project and has been kind enough to donate their time and equipment in exchange for a little food and credit for the first season. All funds up to this point have basically come out of the personal funds from director Wendy Keeling and her poor husband Kevin who is a real sport about it. In order to continue to produce the next episodes we are asking for your assistance. We have big plans for the next episodes!!

Some things you can look forward to :   faces you may recognize, exciting criminal take downs, tons of humor, and you may even see a couple burly men that resort to tight wearing! No matter what you are sure to get a laugh from this comedic reality parody.


Where your money will go

- Your money will go towards feeding the cast and crew. A well fed cast and crew is a happy cast and crew!!!

- Production design like props and clothing

- Rental for Lighting and camera equipment 

- Website design and upkeep

- Marketing expenses (like upgrading the website and materials for press)

-Post Production Costs like editing, color correction, DCP formatting, etc.

- Any unforeseen expenses that may come up (and they will.... they always do)

Any amount will help!!! No amount is too small!


About the Team

Producer / Director Wendy Keeling has a great track record with creating a buzz around a project. She has been very successful on the film festival circuit winning multiple awards for her 2 short films. "Just Grate" went to 12 festivals winning several awards and "Self Offense" has been accepted to 20 film festivals so far winning 5 awards and 2 nominations. With the acceptance of the Bounty Momma pilot in the Nashville Film Festival, one of the top 10 festivals in the US, we see a very strong start for this project as well.

Director of Photography / Mark Ramey has been in the biz for some time. He is an experienced cinematographer with many credits in film and television to his name like "Nashville", "Stacey David's Gearz", "Deadline" and many more.

Writer / Associate Producer Marti King Young has the golden gift of funny!!! She is the creative force behind the story with a ton of producing and behind the scenes experience.


The Cast

We have an amazing cast for the web series already cast!! Gearing up for the finale we are excited about adding even more talent to the lineup. Check out the IMDB page for the pilot episode:  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4419524/

Perks

We are offering some fun perks to tempt you a bit! You want to play a redneck for a day? Feel the urge to participate in the utter madness on set? Well then we have options for you! Come play with us!!!

If you are more on the shy side we offer you thank you mentions in the credits and on our website. Plus, T Shirts, Movie Posters, Autographed Photos from set and other cool stuff are up for grabs for your donation!

Bumper Sticker:

Kick Ass T-Shirts:



Other Ways You Can Help


Please help us to spread the word about this project. We want to make the whole world laugh if we can!!!! Come see us at the Nashville film festival this year. You can help us spread the word by sharing the link to this fundraiser: 

Be sure to LIKE us on Facebook and follow us on twitter.

https://www.facebook.com/bountymomma

https://twitter.com/bountymommashow

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT:

The producers at WHITE RONIN PRODUCTIONS are seeking funds to complete their first feature film OTHER WORLD. Although the film was shot over the course of a few months, there is still a lot of work to do during post-production in order to complete the film such as rendering, audio, visuals, visual effects and colour grading and that's where we need your help.

FILM SYNOPSIS:

Two brothers are members of The Fifth Wall, a small resistance group, who are fighting a losing battle to defend their small town from an invading alien species known as the Greys and their assorted alien-tech killing machines. During one mission on the outskirts of town, to save their commanding officer’s daughter, the brothers uncover a shocking truth that will change their world.

This alien invasion was created by the Government. The whole town has been locked away from “the real world” as part of a combat data collection project established after government operatives discovered Grey genetic code decades ago. The Grey are clones, as are the town’s inhabitants. All part of a military test case established to prepare the Earth for an upcoming attack by the Greys. What is real and who will survive?

WHITE RONIN PRODUCTIONS are credited with post production visual effects on the multi-award winning sci-fi 54 DAYS.
To date the film has received rave reviews and won awards internationally such as:
Best Cinematographer
Best Foreign Film
Best Director
Grand Jury prize for best festival film
Special grand jury prize
plus many more....

    The cast:

    Matt Oxley-

    Lauren Gemmell-

    Matthew Grego-

    Csilla Love-

    Damian Nixey-


    Wayne DeZwarts-

    Brit Dell-

    Stephanie May-

    Jack Kelly-

    Craig Walker-


    CREW:
    Stuart White - Director

    Damian Nixey - Producer



    RISKS AND CHALLENGES-

    The filming is complete now all we need to do is obtain funds so we can complete editing and post production costs such as marketing and advertising.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • You can share this page through social media such as facebook, twitter
    • Don't have social media? That's fine, word of mouth and sharing through emails will be just fine too!!!

story:
Based on the true story of a young Afro-Caribbean girl growing up in Britain during the 1980's. Last Leg explores the life of 15 year old Reyna, living with an abusive father as she struggles to pursue her passion in swimming. She is training to win first place but with a father who controls the world around her, the goal to win is tested.  

Not only is there a lack of representation of black women such as ‘Reyna’ but also a stigma has been attached by the media to those who have been physically abused. 

Last Leg raises social awareness on violence against women. This is an individuals story that explains just because you are surrounded by violence at home does not mean you lack education, intelligence or ambition. Reyna didn’t receive encouragement from any of her family members, which is inspiring, and not just to me.


Upon hearing this story I was drawn to her wisdom and ability to channel positive energy out of a horrific situation. I imagined swimming being her escapism and peace.

At this period in time she personally faced brutal racism and sexism. Not just in the society she lived in but also in her domestic environment where she was mentally and physically abused. So, the fact that she could be ambitious despite being faced with constant discouragement, inspired me to make this into a short film.

I found that it would be poetic to visually contrast the solemn, hostile and vicious environment to the peaceful and serene nature of her swimming. In this story, the statement I am making is no matter how much someone is pushed down, it will never take away the integrity of the human strength and their talent.


Last Leg already has a dedicated crew who are exhuberently working towards taking this story from the pages to the screen.

With your help we will utilise your donation to raise the values of this production. Your support will contribute towards securing locations, sourcing costumes, props, designing sets, equipment hire and distributing the final film. 

Your donation enables Last Leg to be entered into film festivals for potential exclusive screenings, which in turn will expose the final film to the general public.

The production will be able to excel due to your generosity, so the team would like to thank you in advance for any contribution you make!


TARGET BUDGET: £2500

Costs

Casting and Actors : £300

Catering and Transport: £300

Locations: £850

Equipment (ARRI ALEXA): £2,000 Gifted by Ravensbourne College

Equipment Rental: £700

Costume: £100

Set dressing and props: £250


DIRECTOR Ella Bennett

Ella Bennett is a self-employed creative director from London. She aims to mentally challenge and thought provoke an audience to reflect beyond the courageous and solemn themes she particularly focuses on.

She founded her own freelance film company named " Untouched Productions " at aged 16. Since then she has had 4 years experience working on a number of projects with clients, creative cast and crew members internal and external to her independent film production company.

Ella Bennett's Showreel: https://vimeo.com/113727484

PRODUCER Siona Davis 

Siona Davis grew up as an expatriate child in Tajikistan. Following her primary education, she took an interest in telling stories through creative arts. After doing the BFI Academy with Cinemagic she was one of four Northern Irish film makers accepted onto the BFI Craft Residential hosted by the National Film and Television school. Her new contacts and skills paved her way to Ravensbourne to study Digital Film Production.

Siona currently resides in London, using the industry and her course to gain experience for her budding career in the Digital Arts.

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY Aaron Rogers

Aaron Rogers is a Director of Photography based in London who has been recognised for his work in fictional feature film and short film. His style is emotive and isn't afraid of being personal.

Aaron Rogers Showreel: https://vimeo.com/115711277

PRODUCTION DESIGNER Laura Manners

Laura Manners is currently a self-employed production designer. She is consistently pushing her skills in Fine Art, 3D design, Fashion design, Special Effects Make-up and of course, film production.

Laura became particularly drawn to production designing for short films after working with large clients such as Sony, Slenky and Kudos. Laura is currently production designing freelance and jumped at the opportunity to move onto independent projects such as Last Leg.

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR Sarah Pearn 

Sarah is a freelance producer, director and Screenwriter. Since travelling the world in 2009 from the Xhosa tribal villages in South Africa to the tropical paradise islands of Fiji, Sarah has developed a new found appreciation for the hidden beauty there is in the world.

She is extremely passionate about the underwater wildlife environment and aspires to be an underwater cinematographer and videographer in her career journey. Sarah finds it exhilarating to capture the images that not many people in the world will get to see and share her experiences with the world to let them know what is out there. 

For further information on Last Leg please go onto our website:
www.lastlegshortfilm.com 

Other ways you can support last leg and keep up to date, you can also follow us on twitter and Facebook:

https://twitter.com/lastlegfilm

https://www.facebook.com/lastlegshortfilm

Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign  Your donations are greatly appreciated to portray a real story of how anyone can win!

story:
Disco Girl and Funky Fresh is bringing back many great things from the 1970's--the music, the clothes, the cars, the lingo, the swagger and the love for Peace!

Disco Girl and Funky Fresh will tackle evil villains, evil henchmen, evil super gangs and some of the most important topics of today's society in each episode. Projected start date for filming is the first week of May 2015 (weather permitting). 

Season 1 is expected to produce eight episodes. Season 2 is already nearing conceptual completion. Each episode is expected to be 24 minutes running time. 

Every episode will have a very meaningful topic in today's society, such as: 

  • The importance of Recycling
  • Electric Cars/Vehicles
  • The importance of Solar Power
  • Organic Food (Our heroes will stop The GMO Gang!)
  • Conservation
  • Saving the Parks
  • Oil Spills
  • Poisoned Water
  • Peer Pressure
  • Sexual Pressure
  • Gay Bashing
  • Stalking
  • Craft Beer
  • Attacking The Honey Bees
  • Cutting (self mutilation)
  • Even more important topics to our society and well being will be covered in each episode!

Contributors of this special project will help share the greatness of the 1970's with all ages and walks of life today. We're ready to do this series for 10 years for people to really enjoy and take trips down memory lane. 

Come along for the ride with crime fighting ladies who pay lots of homage to the 1970's!

What We Need & What You Get

We only need $6,200.00 to complete season 1, episode 1 of Disco Girl and Funky Fresh. We have an extremely talented team on board 100% to get this crucial episode completed--many by taking deferred or no pay because they feel so strongly about this project. That is how we have this down to a mere $6,200.00 for a full production team behind the cameras and a dozen actors and actresses, numerous locations in and around Atlanta, fuel costs, clothing and every single item needed for filming over the most part of a month--plus all of the perks to send to our contributors! 

To pull all of this off in a cinematic quality at this low amount is almost unheard of when you count all of the people, props and locations--along with fuel costs. That's how much we all believe in Disco Girl and Funky Fresh!

  • For a $50.00 donation you can get an autographed picture of the cast!

  • For $100.00 you can get an autographed picture of the cast and the crew!

  • For $250.00 you can get an autographed picture of the cast and the crew and an official Disco Girl and Funky Fresh license plate!

  • For $500.00 you get all of the above plus an additional autographed picture of Disco Girl and Funky Fresh!

  • For $750.00 you can get an autographed picture of the cast and the crew and an official Disco Girl and Funky Fresh T-Shirt and license plate, along with an additional autographed picture of Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set!

  • For $1,000.00 you get all of the above AND an on-set "selfie" with Disco Girl, Funky Fresh and Groovy G!

  • For $2,500.00 you can get an autographed picture of the cast and the crew and an official Disco Girl and Funky Fresh T-Shirt and license plate, along with an additional autographed picture of Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set, along with an additional autographed picture of Groovy G, Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set AND an on-set "selfie" with Disco Girl, Funky Fresh and Groovy G!

  • For $5,000.00 you can get an autographed picture of the cast and the crew and an official Disco Girl and Funky Fresh T-Shirt and license plate, along with an additional autographed picture of Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set, along with an additional autographed picture of Groovy G, Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set AND a on-set "selfies" with Disco Girl, Funky Fresh and Groovy G in The G Spot (Headquarters) and in their "Super Vehicle"!

  •  For $6,200.00 you can get an autographed picture of the cast and the crew and an official Disco Girl and Funky Fresh T-Shirt and license plate, along with an additional autographed picture of Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set, along with an additional autographed picture of Groovy G, Disco Girl and Funky Fresh on set AND a on-set "selfies" with Disco Girl, Funky Fresh and Groovy G in The G Spot (Headquarters) and in their "Super Vehicle!

    We will also send Disco Girl, Funky Fresh, Groovy G and some bad guys too, to your event, birthday party, gathering, school function etc. to meet and greet, sign autographs and take pictures with all of your special people for up to four hours!!!

    If you contribute the whole amount--you (or your favorite family member or friend of your choosing) can even play a role in Episode 1, too!
We already know this will be the best TV show out of Atlanta since The Walking Dead. Be a part of history with us!
If we do not reach our small target goal, we will still apply whatever funds we do raise to the first things that come up during filming. We will all work towards the completed episode and reach our destination one way or another.

The Impact

We feel so strongly about Disco Girl and Funky Fresh, we are willing to share our experience with you by blogging at the end of each filming day, and even having each of you out to the last day of filming, so you will see firsthand what we did with your help as a thank you to every single contributor of any amount. 

We feel it is important to remind the world how special women are, that they can hold their own against any and all odds (just ask any kid about his or her Mom), and so many wonderful things about the 1970's too! America was at a wonderful height in the 70's.

Every episode will have a very meaningful topic in today's society, such as: the importance of Recycling, Electric Cars/Vehicles, the importance of Solar Power, Organic Food (Our heroes will stop The GMO Gang!, Conservation, Saving the Parks, Oil Spills, Poisoned Water, Peer Pressure, Sexual Pressure, Gay Bashing, Stalking, Craft Beer, Attacking The Honey Bees, Cutting (self mutilation) and even more important topics to our society and well being.

The statistics of our team as individuals is testimony to the strength of our team as a whole. With roles and parts in Fast 5, The Vampire Diaries, Indecent Proposal 2, Big Mommas House, Hall Pass, Drop Dead Diva, Single Ladies, Christmas Cupid, The Lost Footage, Bloated Minds, The Innocence of Darkness, Her, Nightstalking, Rite of Passage, Reunited: A Southern Touch, Saguaro, A Time For Everything, On the House, Blood Ties, Let It Shine, Photographers' Clubhouse, Kingdom Hearts, Intractable, Web of Dreams, Polarized, Birdcage, I've Ben Drinking About You,  Unleashed, It Should Have Been Me, The Legacy of Phineas, John & Mindy and many, many others! 

We are all available to write to, and in most cases call and chat how things are going during filming from our office.

Risks & Challenges

For Season 1 Episode 1 we will only film on weekends as to not disrupt two of our actresses school teacher jobs. Doing this could potentially make us run a little late wrapping up filming if we have more than one weekend of rain. From season 1 episode 2 forward, we most likely will not have to worry about this.

  • We have already addressed this possibility and have developed plans A, B and C to help us compensate.
  • If we ever do fall behind with our filming schedule, we'll have planned in advance for a substitute teacher for both actresses if necessary and film on two consecutive days to get us right back on track timing-wise. We have also made a special shoot-around schedule that will enable us to shoot other scenes featuring other characters in case weather ever did get us behind schedule.
  • ADDITIONAL RISK: Since this was my first IndieGoGo campaign, I did not know that there would be no place to add the costs of printing and mailing all of the items to our contributors. So, that left us with a $1,200.00 difference between $5,000.00 and $6,200.00. We are prepared to take the costs of printing and mailing out of the $5,000.00 balance if necessary.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to, but are unable to contribute funds to help make this wonderful TV show come to everyone--you can still help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise all over the internet, at work, at school and everywhere else about Disco Girl and Funky Fresh!
  • Please do use the Indiegogo share tools!

Disco Girl and Funky Fresh will tackle
 evil villains, evil henchmen, evil super gangs and some of the most 
important topics of today's society in each episode.
 Projected start date for filming is the first week of May 2015 
(weather permitting). 
Season 1 is expected to produce eight episodes. 
Season 2 is already nearing conceptual completion. Each episode is 
expected to be 24 minutes running time. 
Every episode will have a very 
meaningful topic in today's society, such as:

 being will be covered in each episode!


Contributors of this special project will help share the greatness of the 1970's with all ages and walks of life today. We're ready to do this series for 10 years for people to really enjoy and take trips down memory lane. 
Come along for the ride with crime fighting ladies who pay lots of homage to the 1970's!   What We Need & What You Get

We have an extremely talented team on board 100% to get this crucial episode completed--many by taking deferred or no pay because they feel so strongly about this project. That is how we have this down to a mere $6,200.00 for a full production team behind the cameras and a dozen actors and actresses, numerous locations in and around Atlanta, fuel costs, clothing and every single item needed for filming over the most part of a month--plus all of the perks to send to our contributors! 

To pull all of this off in a cinematic quality at this low amount is almost unheard of when you count all of the people, props and locations--along with fuel costs. That's how much we all believe in Disco Girl and Funky Fresh!

story:
History

     What started as an idea at the pub, quickly turned into a short film which won the Home Brew award by coming in first place for Local Shorts at the Kingston Canadian Film Festival. We, the film makers, now hope to take the next step and make the full-length feature film, but we need your help!

     'Sir John A. and the Curse of the Anti-Quenched’ follows two brothers during a night out in Kingston, Ontario, as they celebrate a recent promotion. Their night of celebration is interrupted when they find themselves stuck in the middle of a 150 year old curse that was initiated by Sir John A. Providing a comedic take on history, the film satirically describes one of Canada’s infamous histories: Sir John A’s well-known tendency to frequently be inebriated. The curse - which states that those who remain sober will be transformed into soul-sucking demons - is used to explain the true reason behind Canada’s first prime minister’s inclination to drink. The brothers, already out for a night on the town, are the city's only hope to dispel the curse. In addition to putting a comedic spin on actual events from Canada’s national and Kingston’s local histories, the film also narrates a coming of age story for the two protagonists. In the process of dispelling the curse, both brothers solve problems in their own lives and learn things about themselves as individuals.


"If you're not drunk you turn into a soul sucking demon"


Watch the short film


Who are you, and why do you want money?

     We are a small group of independant film makers from Kingston ON, who are hoping to make our little film a reality! 

The Team: 

Adam Kirkey: 

 

            Is an award winning writer director. When he's not making independent films, Adam is working on an NFL YouTube show produced by Epic Meal Time or providing Kingston realtors with cinematic virtual tours and photography. Adam also co-wrote a feature screenplay (Broke and Educated) with Matthew Bell set to star Harley Morenstein and Tony Hinchcliffe.

Matthew Bell:

       Is an actor and writer from Kingston, Ontario. Matthew co-wrote  Broke and Educated with Adam Kirkey which is set to star Harley Morenstein and Tony Hinchcliffe.

Timothy Bell:


      Is an actor and published fitness writer from Kingston, Ontario, who provides unique personal training in the city and online. 


Movies cost money!

     We’re hoping to raise $10,000 for development of the feature film version of 'Sir John A & The Curse Of The Anti-Quenched'. We do have stretch goals, but we want to keep it realistic. Reaching our goal will allow us to retain a better share with IndieGoGo, as well as continue funding after the 60Days. We will we still need to find investors, apply for grants, get production advances from distribution companies, and possibly incur some debt on our end.  Reaching the final stretch goal of $100,000.00 would mean the project is green lit! And ready to shoot!


"$10K= We still need more. $100K=We make a movie! "


Where is all that money going? 

     Your donations go to help us rent equipment, pay for insurance, actors, crew, food to feed them, special effects, visual effects, colour grading, and a sound mix! 

     By donating you’re supporting Canadian independant film. If you're from Kingston you're supporting local film makers, and local bussiness! Also you're reminding people of the great history of this awesome country!

If You Can’t Donate!

     All that osap money tapped out? No more room on that credit card? Thats ok! If you still want to help you can share our campaign with your friends, encourage others to donate. Retweets, and Facebook shares help!

The Perks!

Get this poster and show your support! It is a one of a kind poster and will never be sold again after the campaign.

     

Get campaign T-Shirts! Show your support by getting these one of a kind T-Shirts which will be made solely for campaign donators.

       

                     

Stretch Goals


Thanks for reading and we hope you keep an eye out for our work because we love what we do and will continue pursuing our passion in film making.
