story:
- An aspiring sports agent hungry to get ahead struggles to save his career and family while fighting everyday temptations -

H-Town ‘the movie’, set in 2015, will carry its audience through the main character’s life from the inception of Hurricane Katrina through the aftermath of where his life is a decade later. The main character was a teenaged orphan who had to succumb to the judgment and persecution of community members who labeled him as a refugee.

However, he was looked after and kept out of harm’s way with the help of a special group of people from his adopted neighborhood. He persevered and graduated from high school working hard on-and-off the court, and received scholarship offers to play basketball at several well-known universities. He decided to follow the love of his life to the west coast to attend college against the will of her father. He graduated, got married, and landed his dream job in sports working as a junior agent. He soon became a father, and finally had the family he always wanted until he has to confront life’s next big obstacle as the widowed parent of an infant child.

It is déjà vu like never before as the tragic loss of his wife forces him to return to Houston on the ten year anniversary of the tragedy that originally brought him there.

H-Town ‘the movie’ emotionally captures the main character’s struggle to maintain and survive as Segundo Barrio (Second Ward) is once again a major turning point in his life as he has to rely on the support of the old neighborhood to help raise his son. The audience learns what it takes for him to start all over again as an adult to thrive in the heart of the city and navigate around its many temptations as an up and coming sports agent.

story:
Project Summary

Hi Funders!

I would like to introduce you to Susan, one of life's idlers. She's too lazy to work, too lazy to exercise, too lazy to love. But she does like a good roll in the hay!

We are bringing brilliant literature back to life in a feature film!

We are Andrew Willig, Elisa King, and Will Shung, and we are bringing "Idle Thoughts of an Idle Fellow" back into the 21st Century. Idle thoughts was written in 1886 by well known British humorist Jerome K Jerome, who is best remembered for his work Three Men in a Boat. However, one of his other great works, Idle Thoughts, is almost unknown to modern readers and film goers.

We plan to change all that.

We are filmmakers from Vancouver, Canada and we want to make our first feature film. Andrew Willig has been working in TV and film for five years and has worked on movies such as Fifty Shades of Grey, and Tomorrowland in the lighting department. Not to mention dozens of TV shows such as Once Upon a Time, and Falling Skies. Elisa King is is both a singer-songwriter and an actress, writer and director. She produce several of her own short films and is ready for her first feature. Will Shung is a sales and marketing professional, and short film maker, who runs an award nominated cultural Blog on Vancouver's art scene.

And we think we can do a hell of a lot with a relatively small amount of money! We think we can make you a hilarious rom-com based on Idle Thoughts for just $60,000. And that's $60,000 Canadian dollars ;-).

What We Need & What You Get

We have already raised $10k in private funding, but filming is expensive. So we are looking to find a fan base who will buy tickets in advance, and help us raise another $50k. All the funding we receive will go into the cost of film production, there will be no production fee on the project, but we aim to raise enough to make reasonable payments to key cast and crew, and have all expenses covered. The costs are:
  • Cast & Crew
  • Production Equipment
  • Location fees
  • Insurance & Permits
  • Post Production
The Benefits:
Our best perks will get you a part in our movie, signed memorabilia, invitations to the premier (which will hopefully be at a major international film festival), or even an Executive Producer credit on IMDb!

Come hell or high water we are going to make this movie, but if funds are low, the current script will be descaled to make it more manageable (no horses or orcs).

The Impact of Your Support

This campaign is going to bring a truly wonderful, but largely forgotten piece of english literature back to life. Jerome K Jerome deserves to be remembered alongside Jane Austin as a great humorist and writer. We believe he needs to be resurrected in the public mind, because sadly at the moment he is almost unknown.

We have, individually and together made, dozens of local TV shows and short films, and developed a wide circle of contacts in the local film industry. Now is the time for our first feature film, and we are bursting to get this done!

This is an opportunity to bring truly artistic and poetic writing back into fashion.


Risks & Challenges! Oh My.

This production is very low risk if our funding goals are met. Our main obstacles will be getting quality locations that really leap off the screen and capture the key moments in the script.

Your funding will allow us budget for shooting in and around Vancouver, in national parks and at some of BC's most beautiful locations.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this idea but are a little short on cash, don't worry! If you have any experience on film sets you are welcome to come up and join us as a volunteer. And of course, if you think we are a worthy cause, tell your friends! And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

As a final note, please read Indiegogo's terms and conditions so you understand how your money can be used. Thanks.

Your funding will allow us budget for shooting in and around Vancouver, in national parks and at some of BC's most beautiful locations.

If you like this idea but are a little short on cash, don't worry! If you have any experience on film sets you are welcome to come up and join us as a volunteer. And of course, if you think we are a worthy cause, tell your friends! And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

As a final note, please read Indiegogo's terms and conditions so you understand how your money can be used. Thanks.

story:
PLEASE TAKE A LOOK AT THE GALLERY (VIDEOS) TO SEE US IN ACTION!

Hi everyone! I'm Guillermo Pepe, executive director at Fundacion Telmed. FT is a telemedicine NGO from Argentina that is helping to radically decrease the number of women dying of breast cancer. Argentina ranks number 2 in risk of dying of breast cancer in Latin America. 7000 WOMEN DIE EACH YEAR. THAT MEANS THAT IN 7000 FAMILIES A LOVED ONE GOES MISSING EVERY YEAR! 

IN FIGHTING BREAST CANCER, EARLY DIAGNOSIS IS, 98% OF THE TIME, A LIFE SAVIOUR!

How we are preventing women from dying of breast cancer:

  • Investing in state of the art technology
  •  Supporting on-going training of our medical staff
  • Opening mammography facilities in remote areas
  • Implementing awareness campaigns
  • Fighting for legislation that will allow women to have a "day off" to see their gynecologist and have a mammogram done. 
  • Partnering other NGO'S to rapidly reach women in need.
  • Donating mammograms (8000 mammograms donated in the last 5 years)

Our aim is to PREVENT WOMEN FROM DYING OF BREAST CANCER, starting in Argentina and expanding later to the rest of Latin America. It’s a moon shot but we are working tremendously hard and are very focused on this cause.

Helping people fulfills me in every possible way so I'm taking every chance I have to tackle this huge social problem.

Because I have had 3 surgical operations on my right knee I went through a lots of pain so in 2013 I decided to do something totally “counterintuitive” to solve my problem:  training for marathons…10 months after I started the hard traning sessions the pain was gone. Since then, I have managed to  succesfully  ran in Paris, Berlin and Buenos Aires supporting the fight against breast cancer.

This year, in 3 weeks (april the 26th), I'll be running the London Marathon in an attempt to raise money to donate mammograms to women, in Argentina, who are not covered by the national healthcare system and don't have any financial resources. 

Together with CARITAS, the well established charitable organization whose core mission is helping poor families, we are going to use the money raised to offer women at risk , in the province of Corrientes (northern Argentina), the possibility of having a mammogram…Women who may never have had a mammogram in their entire lives, women who may  never have heard about breast cancer, women who might die of this dreadful disease.

The GOAL of this campaign is to raise 15.000 USD (10.000 GBP) and donate 222 mammograms. This means that for every 67 USD (45 GBP) you donate, you are giving away one mammogram and you might be giving a woman the chance to save her life… Please think of their families, think of  yourself, think of your family… try to put yourself in their shoes!

If we can’t raise the funds for the 222 mammograms, we’ll be donating less mammograms but COME ON!!! Together, we can do this! During 2014 we managed to raise money for 2000 mammograms which are being donated in 2015.

If you don’t have the money to help these women but you still want to contribute, please share this story on social media or tell your neighbours but please DO SOMETHING!!!

I’ll be sending the details of  the women having a mammogram and sharing their personal stories with you on Facebook, Twitter and our website.

WE HAVE TO DO SOMETHING and WE HAVE TO DO IT NOW!!!

JOIN US AND YOU’LL BE HELPING TO SAVE A LIFE!

Best wishes,

Guillermo Pepe

P.S. april the 13th is my birthday...ALL OF MY WISHES GO TO STOP WOMEN DYING OF BREAST CANCER!

story:
Have you ever dreamt about going to Japan? Everyone knows how much fun it is to travel with friends, but only some know the excitement of traveling together to a completely different country. Language barriers? Even better. In this series, Lazy Sunday will be your group of friends. Come with us on an epic journey to the Land of the Rising Sun, and experience daily challenges such as navigating confusing subways and figuring out how to order food from a machine - we’ll show you things that you won’t see on an average travel show.

Join us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/projectyokoso

 

 

Yokoso is a comedy web series about discovering the Japan you wouldn’t be able to see in a regular documentary. Our team will take you to Tokyo - from the world famous Hachiko statue in Shibuya, to the most obscure game center in Akihabara. We’ll let you experience the best (and weirdest) parts of Japan. Yokoso will also help those who are planning to travel to Japan by giving out practical tips throughout the whole season.

 

And because it is a comedy show, we will attempt some stupid, yet funny and instructive challenges across the city. Seriously, brushing your teeth with wasabi is nothing more than awesome stupidity. In a few words, Yokoso is about taking the best elements of a documentary, including full cinematic treatment, but with a comedic undertone.

We want to step out of the regular documentary format because we think that there are already plenty of them out there - some of them are pretty awesome! What we want to do is to bring a new perspective, show you guys things you could really do in Japan. Of course, we will cover the major aspects of the Japanese culture, but what we really want to show you is what it’s actually like to travel there.

Here's a little sneak peek of the places we'll visit in Yokoso. Keep in mind that this is not an exhaustive list - we've got a lot more in store for you ;)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We thought about making a feature length movie but the huge amount of content we wanted to talk about wouldn’t fit in just an hour or two. Moreover, a web series format will allow us more flexibility so we can deliver theme-based episodes.

 

 

 

We aim to produce professional quality videos, which means investing in the right equipment. Your funding will help us to upgrade our existing equipment to better quality lenses, stabilizers and microphones.

Lazy Sunday will be flying to Japan from all around the world, but we intend to fund flights and living costs by ourselves.

 

 

 

 

If you cannot donate, please spread the word about our project through social media or in any way you can. We appreciate your help! Here's the link to our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/projectyokoso

 

 

Yokoso is currently in the pre-production stage. Some of the team members have already done a preliminary trip to scout locations and got footage for the trailer. Our screenplay is ready for filming.

 

 

 

 

What languages are/will be available?

Our series will be shot in English and dubbed in French. Depending on viewer demand, we may add more language options.

What does ‘Yokoso’ mean, and why did you choose it?

Yokoso is Japanese for ‘welcome’. You’ll come across this term in airports and planes, where people offer ‘yokoso’ as a warm welcome to Japan. We chose this name because it conveys our intention to let everyone experience Japan through our videos.

When will you be filming?

We are planning to film the whole series this summer!

story:
Welcome to Amsterdam

This will be Anne Leigh Cooper’s first feature film

Inspired by true events.

WELCOME TO AMSTERDAM, the film

It is a story about two young women in different moments of life, Finding out how true the saying “it can happen to anyone” can be. How easy it can be to have your life stolen from you.

In the next 7 months, we will shoot, edit, color correct, sound design and master this film to submit to the ROTTERDAM INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL for consideration, but without you this won’t be possible.

WOMEN IN FILM

Now here comes where I need YOUR consideration. After much needed research it shows only 5% of women directed the 250 top grossing films in the last year. This saddening fact drives me to want to change the demographic of the film community, while empowering women. We are still in an era of film where women are not taken seriously, sexually harassed and not treated equally and ladies, #wedeservemore

Photo: Women in film #wedeservemore

I believe we can make powerful compelling stories worthy of the big screen and it’s audiences.  We are enriching characters, powerful directors and any position we want, we can have.

For the last few years I have been trying to bring a feature film alive because it is my dream as an artist and a woman to direct powerful, moving films and I will do whatever it takes to get there. I have come close several times but I either get stopped by sexually harassing producers or crazy investors with different agendas, or nay-sayers; “You want to make a movie about sex trafficking? Nobody is going to watch that.” Well isn’t that a problem on its own?

I’m not trying to force my agenda down your throat, but nobody will get hurt by being more aware of what is going on in the world around you (It might actually save somebody).

The piece I have written has come from the heart and has a compelling new approach to filmmaking.

Poster for my first film "Where there is no light"

WHAT THIS FILM NEEDS

We need to raise $10,000 to complete to whole film from start to finish.
(I originally tried to raise $30.000 but I'm trying to make this film regardless of how much money I raise so I'm trying to figure out any possible situation to make it happen )

We will be utilizing our budget for the following;

-  Flights from NYC to Amsterdam (Soundman, Camera man, Make-up artist, Actress and myself)

-  Lodging fees

-  Location fee

-  Catering

-  Payroll

-  Props

-  Transportation

-  Post Production

The crazy challenge for all of us will be to complete the filming in 7 days with a 7- day pre-production in Amsterdam. That’s how we will be able to keep the cost of the budget this low.

The awesome thing is I am from Amsterdam and I will be able to utilize cheaper lodging fees, borrow someone’s car and find an awesome family member to help me with catering.  I am doing this on a shoestring budget but I know I can do this, and do it brilliantly, but of course with your help!

Our filming location @ Amsterdam, The Netherlands

THE FILMMAKER: ANNE LEIGH COOPER

My name is Anne Leigh Cooper AKA Annemijn Nieuwkoop (My real Dutch name) and I have been an artist for as long as I can remember. I moved to the USA when I was 18, all by myself to pursue a career as an actor (Which I still luckily do) but when I got out of acting school here in NYC I knew it wasn’t going to be an easy road and I figured what if I make my own project as a director? And so I went, I emptied my bank account, wrote a script and thought of every talented person I had come across my young years in New York and invited them to be a part of my first film “Where there is no Light’. It was an Official Selection at the Women Film Festival in Austin, a true events story about a woman who goes to the end of the world to save her sister from a sex trafficking ring. It was the best experience and learning curve I could have ever hoped for but what I didn’t realize what had happened was that I had completely and utterly fallen in love with directing. So I kept on going and I directed “$tockholm Syndroom”; an experimental short about the mind-bending journey a sex slave suffering from Stockholm Syndrome experiences. Then “Anti-Woman” about a woman’s right to say “no” when ever, where ever, and finally “A Caged Innocence”; a story of two women in love hoping to create a family in a world where that is not allowed. Now after making 4 short films I am ready to sink my teeth in a feature length film.

INSPIRATIONS FOR THE VISION OF THE FILM

INDIEGOGO AND YOU:

Your donation will go towards everything that we need, it will cover all the essentials such as Crew, Actors, Flights, Lodging, Editing and so forth.

You can pledge by clicking “Contribute Now” and you pick a perk from the column on the right. It will only take a few minutes of your time. We have some awesome perks donated by friends, loved ones, and of course, Me.

MY PLEDGE TO THE WORLD

When the film is made, completed, and screened it will be sold worldwide and I will donate 50% of the profits to an Anti-sex trafficking organization helping to improve this world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money to the campaign there are other ways you can help. You can share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and speak about it with your friends and family. Everything helps!

story:
Two and a half years ago a group of young filmmakers from a variety of different backgrounds got together and started a production company.The entire time that we've been making films together, we've had one larger goal in mind...a passion project so expansive that it's going to take YOUR help to make it finally come to life. 


SEA MONSTERS is primarily a love story. It's the tale of an old, dying sea captain on one final journey to reunite with his one true love. The Captain teams up with an eager, young sailor named Abe and together they journey into the heart of the mysterious Bermuda Triangle, following the spotty direction of a treasure map. Along the way, the pair face obstacles and begin to question each other's sanity. Abe is in it for the promise of pirate treasure, while The Captain has been withholding his true intentions the entire time. For in The Triangle, nothing is what it seems...

Sea Monsters is an incredibly ambitious short film project by any standard. In order to make the voyage feel epic and authentic, we plan to utilize all of our collective resources to make the film as large in scope as possible. The majority of principal photography will take place at sea. On a real boat. And some of it in a treasure cave. Oh...and some more of it will also be shot underwater. At a real shipwreck. 
Wondering how we're going to film all of this? The good news is, we've already figured it out! Our cast, crew and locations are secure and ready to go. We've worked tirelessly scouting the locations, researching the props and doing all of the necessary legwork to bring the film to life. We only lack the funding to move forward and begin principal photography!  We plan to apply the same process of hard work, love and intense collaboration to create the most immersive experience possible. 

In order to do our story justice, we need what feels like a fairly large sum of booty, but not quite as large as you might think for a film like this. Our funding will go towards: 

  • Renting our locations and chartering the boat where the majority of the film takes place. 
  • Crafting uniquely-textured costumes for each core character in the film 
  • Taking a dive team down to an ACTUAL sunken ship to film exciting underwater sequences 
  • Obtaining our equipment package, which includes our camera, lighting and underwater housing for our DSLR cameras. 
  • Making sure that we've hired the best possible crew we have to steer our ship to victory. 
Because we want our viewers/contributors to feel like they're a PART of the Sea Monsters experience, we've chosen perks at every level which allow us to share quintessential pieces of the film with YOU. 
At the lower tiers of funding we're offering shout-outs, postcards and digital downloads of the film, but the deeper you allow yourself to sink into the project, the greater treasure you'll find! 

♥ Booklets of fabric swatches which include samples of the actual fabric being used in the construction of The Captain and Abraham's costumes. 

♥ Key props from the film including The Captain's chest, silver coins (real currency), antique bookends and an actual, wearable deep-sea diving helmet! 


Right now, there is NO OTHER film quite like Sea Monsters even being attempted in the short-film genre. It's bold. It's risky. And we're so passionate about it we could cry (and already have). The film up for your consideration today is a return to epic, practical filmmaking, the likes of which hasn't been attempted at sea in a very long time. This is our 20,000 Leagues. Our Leviathan. Our Jaws. 

What you're ultimately investing in isn't just a killer short which will (hopefully) go on to be seen by people all around the world at festivals...you're also investing in a young, innovative team of filmmakers who plan to make feature films upon the completion of this project! 

We see SEA MONSTERS as our last, major short film effort. And because of that we want to pull out all the stops and make a jaw-dropping spectacle of a film. Your donation will allow us to pull off a brilliant spectacle and leave you wanting more. 

As you know based on what's been said above, this is a film rife with logistical challenges...but we're excited to face them! 

Naturally there there are risks in shooting a film at sea or even beneath it. But that's why the safety of our cast and crew is absolutely our number one priority. Rest assured that in our minds, NO film is worth endangering the people who helped bring it to life. And the film could not be in more capable hands. 

Pass the link along to your friends!

Obtaining our equipment package, which includes our camera, lighting and underwater housing for our DSLR cameras. 
Making sure that we've hired the best possible crew we have to steer our ship to victory.  
Because we want our viewers/contributors to feel like they're a PART of the Sea Monsters experience, we've chosen perks at every level which allow us to share quintessential pieces of the film with YOU. 
At the lower tiers of funding we're offering shout-outs, postcards and digital downloads of the film, but the deeper you allow yourself to sink into the project, the greater treasure you'll find! 




♥ Booklets of fabric swatches which include samples of the actual fabric being used in the construction of The Captain and Abraham's costumes. 

♥ Key props from the film including The Captain's chest, silver coins (real currency), antique bookends and an actual, wearable deep-sea diving helmet! 







Right now, there is NO OTHER film quite like Sea Monsters even being attempted in the short-film genre. It's bold. It's risky. And we're so passionate about it we could cry (and already have). The film up for your consideration today is a return to epic, practical filmmaking, the likes of which hasn't been attempted at sea in a very long time. This is our 20,000 Leagues. Our Leviathan. Our Jaws.  What you're ultimately investing in isn't just a killer short which will (hopefully) go on to be seen by people all around the world at festivals...you're also investing in a young, innovative team of filmmakers who plan to make feature films upon the completion of this project! 
We see SEA MONSTERS as our last, major short film effort. And because of that we want to pull out all the stops and make a jaw-dropping spectacle of a film. Your donation will allow us to pull off a brilliant spectacle and leave you wanting more. 




As you know based on what's been said above, this is a film rife with logistical challenges...but we're excited to face them! 





Naturally there there are risks in shooting a film at sea or even beneath it. But that's why the safety of our cast and crew is absolutely our number one priority. Rest assured that in our minds, NO film is worth endangering the people who helped bring it to life. And the film could not be in more capable hands. 



Pass the link along to your friends!

story:
Short Summary

Our goal is to laugh and cheer while you witness what it takes to prepare for a MASSIVE race, to inspire and motivate others to live a great life, and to show my Mom what I do.  She is in her 80's and after extensive heart surgery, has never, and will never see me race.

In 2010 I was training for my 4th Ironman and I met a man (Nick Mallet) who had raced (and won) Ultraman Canada.  I thought he was fully nuts, but as the conversation continued, I found myself very curious.  Day 1: A 10km (6.2 mi) swim followed by a 145km (90.6mi) bike.  Day 2: A 276km (172.5mi) bike.  Day 3: Run a double marathon, 84.4kms (52.8mi).  

No way....but maybe.....  

A year later I raced Ultraman Canada and placed 6th over all!  In 2013 I made it to the Ultraman World Championships and during what was the single hardest 3 days of my life, (in fact, any one of the days qualified as hardest) I had a total BLAST and made some incredible friends en route to a 21st place overall finish.

I am applying to go back to Kona to race the world championships in 2015 and along the way, working with a film maker to capture the whole experience, from training to racing, and submit it to the Banff Mountain Film Festival.  



What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is pretty clear, and daunting, but if enough people give just a little...it will happen!  Just to get me through a training season including training camp, the confirmation race (Ironman Coeur d'Alene Idaho), and the actual race in Kona Hawaii with crew and film folks is a mininmum of $25,000.  Add to that all the film and post production costs and travel for the film crew, and it adds up fast!

You get to help a regular guy like me, try something epic, and get your name in the credits, your own copy of the film and more depending on which perk you select when contributing. 


The Impact

As I sat and watched the Banff Mountain Film Festival World Tour this year, I saw once again how sharing a journey like this tends to inspire people to take action and do great things.  As a Personal Trainer and Coach, my life's work is to inspire people to create a healthy body and a great life.  If this film can help people do that, mission accomplished.  I think of how my friend, Dr Stacy Larsen talked with such passion about triathlon in 2004, that I decided to try one.  From there I have gone from Sprint Triathlon to Ultraman, and along the way, coached over 100 people to realize their goals.  So what could happen if a film could inspire thousands of people to chase their dreams?

Risks & Challenges

Getting in to Ultraman is a challenge - it is an invitation only race, limited to 40 people.  I have raced there before, and volunteered in 2014, and that should help me get in.  I also have to prove myself at Ironman again, and that again, is a big challenge.  Training for a year can be a wonderful challenge, or a mess of injuries.  So far this year, so good!  The race itself holds many, many challenges and unknowns.  Day one is the toughest of the 3 in many senses, with the 6 mile (10km) ocean swim that can go many, many different ways.  (In 2013 I puked for 3 hours while swimming, not planned, not fun.)  Filming the training, getting in the miles with a busy work and family life, as well as all of the travel, it's a lot!


Where Does the Money Go?

In order to get Scott to Ultraman in Kona and make a film about we need $50,000. 
Athlete Costs -$25,000
Film Production - $20,000
Fees and misc costs  (Indiegogo, music licensing) - $5000



Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends.......help get this off the ground.  Time is extremely limited and we need your help!

story:
Bj's love and support has touched so many within our community, lets love and support her through this fight through cancer and back to health. Together we can help her heal.


Dearest Community,
As many of you are aware, for those of you who are learning for the first time, Bj has been diagnosed with Bone Cancer. 
After bravely challenging and overcoming three separate breast cancers, our beautiful soul sister is up for the biggest fight of her life. And she needs our support for herself and her daughter.
We believe that this can and will be healed through medical treatment but also the healing and cleansing of the body and emotions at a cellular and spiritual level. 
Bj also has a strong belief in the power of alternative treatments as an adjunct to mainstream treatment and this has some financial burden involved. 
While this cancer may be strong and frightening and there are other health issues complicating recovery it is my belief that WE have one thing that it never will. We have LOVE and LIGHT. The LOVE for BJ. The LOVE for her family and community to be strong and in full support of her. We believe in the power of prayer, the power of intention and the LIGHT that is within everyone and that each and every one of us can make a difference in some way to help her in this journey.
Wouldn’t it be amazing if we, her community could provide the support to help her “Release the Cancer with Love”?  We say, “YES”! This would be a truly wonderful and generous thing, and we believe it can happen.
That's where you, the community come in. We need your financial support to hold this sacred healing space that is needed. The money will help Bj to access the healing services and medical care that is necessary to give her the best chance at overcoming this challenge and live a healthy and full life.
Do you make a charitable donation every year? Could you choose Bj this year? Any amount is received in GRATITUDE and every amount is USEFUL.
So…please, hit the DONATE button, share this with anyone you think may have $10 or $20 extra to share, or more! 
Please light a candle and share your prayers or blessings.
"We Love you Bj, you have touched so many lives, forever in debt. This is how our gratitude speaks. We hope our community backs you all the way. Love, Light and Blessings to you,  Becky and family xxx

story:
Hi, we are Neurowave productions.

We are currently producing a short documentary with the aim of finding out if there's a formula for becoming YouTube famous.

With YouTube being the 2nd largest search engine behind Google, and 100 hours of video being uploaded every minute, it's becoming the largest source of entertainment for people around the world.

More and more, people are uploading videos of themselves talking to the camera about their lives and their hobbies. These 'vloggers' are building up a huge following and some are even branching out into television.

In this documentary, we aim to find out how these YouTubers gain there following, and if there is a recipe for their success.

The film will follow our presenter and aspiring vlogger, Callum, who will speak to various YouTubers in his journey to become a YouTube star.

With the money raised, we plan to use it to cover travel expenses for our presenter, our stars and our crew. 

Any donations made would be extremely helpful and we are very grateful for every donation, big or small. £500 is our target but we won't stop there. Every donation leads to more opportunities to make a brilliant film to acknowledge the rise of a new platform of entertainment and a new age of celebrity.

Check us out on Facebook under 'Neurowave Productions' and 'Like Comment Subscribe', and make sure you share this with as many people as possible to spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Brianna Freese and I am the Writer/Director of Mustard Sandwiches.  Our team has created a beautiful piece full of love, compassion, and lot's of hard work. This short film is meant for anyone who has ever lost someone they've loved, and shows that they will never be forgotten. With your help, we will be able to reach our goal in submitting this film into festivals all over the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

Contributions will be used towards festival submissions! 
Depending on the contribution, we offer a personal thank you message, a thank you credit, a producer's credit, a DVD of the film, a bracelet from the film, and a special meet with the crew.

Risks & Challenges

You will make it possible for our film to make it into festivals. As any young artists, we fight and struggle to create art, but with support, the struggle is a lot less intimidating and a lot more possible! 

Other Ways You Can Help

As fellow students and artists, we understand if you are unable to contribute, but you can still help us by spreading the word about our film by sharing this campaign to your friends and family!


https://www.facebook.com/MustardSandwichesMovie...



Meet the Crew!


Brianna Freese (Director)

Jackson Warner Lewis (Cinematographer)


Aurora Alange (Producer)


Paola Bernardini (Assistant Director)


Alexandra Boskovich (Editor)


Henry Myers (Sound)

story:
Catastrophic Leave is an eerie and gritty true story of one woman’s terrifying battle with grotesque forces of unimaginable darkness, fear and terror.

Some have told us that these evil forces cannot be stopped. Others say they do not exist.

Global Partnerships

But you can make a difference now by becoming a partner and active supporter of this epic motion picture adventure.

The budget needed to tell this exciting action packed story

1) $100,000 for actor wages. To tell a story of this magnitude, we need the best talent our budget can afford. So, we intend to hire 100 actors including main cast and extras.

2) $150,000 for production crew and equipment. This amount will be budgeted to pay professional movie production personnel for pre-production, filming, post production, purchase quality cameras, dollies, rent cranes and other important equipment.

3) $100,000 for marketing and distribution. Distribution is the most important aspect of every movie and needs to be secured prior to or during filming. Marketing through TV, Radio, Social Media and Outdoor Media will be done to let everyone know about this dynamic movie. We believe that being able to show distributors your financial partnership and participation will be a huge help in our negotiations for the widest possible distribution.

And with your awesome partnership, the Catastrophic Leave movie will be a voice to the masses, a face to the faceless and bring hope to countless others amidst the massive mountain of denial and relentless fear.

Thank you so much for helping to make history in your partnership alongside us in this groundbreaking motion picture.

Did you know that a man in Ohio posted a photo of a potato salad and raised $55,492 - just to make potato salad? Listen, while we love a good potato salad ourselves, we are absolutely sure that the Catastrophic Leave movie is by far more important than any potato salad, and we hope you do too by your partnering with this powerful cause.

“…their fear is a real and founded fear.” – Victim, 11/2014 (Name Withheld) 

About us

We are film makers who are first hand witnesses and survivors of the terror and fear. Other victims have shared with us that this is a story that must be told.

story:
Chuck and Doug are best buds for life. Night after night, it’s the same routine – get high, watch B-Movies as introduced by the beautiful Camilla, Queen of the night, and basically float through life with nothing to show for it. Doug’s drug of choice is Marijuana. Chuck’s is Doug’s blood – he’s a vampire, drinking from his friend to get stoned.

When Doug is fired from his job, Chuck formulates an idea – what if they were to sell the weed laced blood to other vampires. They’d be rich! And thus, THC+ is invented, and these hapless idiots are on the road to success. But can their friendship, so long based on hanging out and going with the flow, stand the test ahead of them, as they must dodge shady vampires, the temptations of wealth and luxury, and a chance encounter with love?

Funny, blood-drenched and sweet, “THC+” is two best friends’ journey through the dark corners of the night, a wild and wacky look at the vampire world as seen through a bong haze.

THC+ is a feature length film written by Wiliam Andrews & Shawn McLaren

What goes into getting vampires high? A whole lot of love. In order to transition our story from paper to film we need your help! The money raised will go towards:

•fuel / transportation

•spfx materials

•payment for crew & actors 

•additional equipment rentals

•permit fees

•location fees 

•festival fees

•craft (food) services

•hardware (hard drives & cf cards)

•advertising & marketing 

We have a lot of support from local Sudbury artists, musicians & vendors who are contributing to our perks and production. Big thanks and shout out to all of our amazing friends! This wouldn't be possible without you 

•Don Kunto www.purevolume.com/donkunto

•The Sudbury Star www.tinyurl.com/po8w4g9

•Black Rectangle Brand Inc. www.blackrectanglebrand.com

•The Grand Nightclub www.facebook.com/GrandNightclub

• Fuse www.facebook.com/FuseSudbury

• SRO http://www.sronightclub.com/

•Respect Is Burning www.ribsupperclub.com

•Ristorante Verdicchio www.verdicchio.ca

•The Motley Kitchen www.themotleykitchen.com

•Sudbury Burlesque www.sudburyburlesque.com

•Glasswerx pinsta.me/glasswerx

•Crocodile Printing www.crocodilepress.com

•Stack Brewing www.stackbrewing.ca

•Nickel City Roller Derby www.ncrd.ca

•Fionn MacCool's www.primepubs.com

•The Mop Shop www.themopshop.ca

•Northern Print Brokers www.northernprintbrokers.com

•Sudbury R.E.S.T Centre www.therestcentre.com

•HoodooKitty www.tinyurl.com/pdqht26

•The Candy Store www.facebook.com/BooBahLou2



Wiliam Andrews - Director // Writer // Captain of the S.S. Orca 

A product of an English Teacher mother and salesman father, Wiliam Andrews grew up knowing two things – that stories are the most important thing in the world, and that if you use your words well enough, it can put food on the table. Reading since age 3 and writing since age 4, the written word has been his first love since before his memory accurately serves. A graduate of Laurentian University’s Rhetoric and Media Studies degree and the now defunct Toronto Media and Film College’s Film Production program, Wiliam has spent the past 5 years applying his storytelling dreams to the film industry, having worked in practically every department – grip, lighting, camera, locations, transport, assistant directing and the production office. Working in development at Hideaway Pictures, Wiliam has learned the ins and outs of developing a story from the blank white page through to distribution, and is ready to jump with both feet into the dark waters of his first feature film as Director. 

THC+ stems from a shelved idea from film school, a loving image of two buddies on a couch that was going nowhere until Wiliam met the rest of the crew, and magic was born. Such is the trouble of having a weed friendly idea without habitually smoking pot yourself. 

Shawn McLaren - Producer // Writer // Part Time Dress Wearer 

Shawn McLaren is a stand-up comedian, actor, writer, producer and pot enthusiast.  After starting in the acting world performing improvised murder mysteries with Murder By Appointment, Shawn spent a few years finding himself in country music radio.  Upon realizing he would never want a big green tractor and that country music was depressing, he turned his focus to stand-up comedy and film.  Working with Motion Arc Studios on short film projects led to the founding of Flickering Pictures with Wiliam Andrews and the inception of THC+. Serving as a co-writer with director Wiliam Andrews, THC+ is Shawn’s first feature film as a writer, despite having written several short films prior to this. Shawn is incredibly stoked to make a feature film with this magnificently talented team of people and he dreams of one day sharing more stories with you.

Mathieu Seguin - Director of Photography // Soulless Ginger

www.motionarcstudios.com

Mathieu Séguin is a Cinematographer and the Creative Director at MotionArc Studios. His work varies from commercials, to documentaries, to cinema but all with the common goal of telling a story through imagery. Aside from knowing the technical and logistical aspect of a production, Mathieu understands the art of lighting and uses it as his paintbrush.

His films have played internationally and through various film festivals. His work is often featured on Canadian television networks. Mathieu is currently in preproduction as Director of Photography for a one hour Documentary which will be featured on TVO.

Mathieu is an enthusiastic cinematographer and is most comfortable when he his behind a camera. 

Paul W. Los - Editor // Living Metaphor 

With a strong foundation in filmmaking and a serious passion for storytelling, Paul has travelled the globe in search of unique and compelling imagery. His innate passion for film led him to study Broadcasting - Television and Video Production at Canadore College in North Bay, Ontario.

Paul began his career in Florida collaborating with Ray Roman Films– one of the worlds leading event & wedding cinematographers. It was there he discovered the persuasive advantages and techniques of DSLR filmmaking.

Upon returning to Canada, Paul was offered a position with Emmy Award winning production company Stillmotion, where he was consistently encouraged to be a stronger storyteller – adding philosophy and grace into each piece. During his time with Stillmotion, Paul had the opportunity to collaborate with illustrious clients such as The NFL Network, Apple, CBS Sports, Showtime, Canon and AT&T. The culmination of his experience with the Stillmotion team was being one of the camera operators for the feature length docu-drama "A Game of Honor". This film would go on to be nominated for 5 Emmy Awards and recipient of 3, which included "Outstanding Sports Documentary".

Nora Burns - Producer // Sanity Manager 

Kaitlin Lutyk - Art Department // Wedding Planner 

"Lovely" Louise Bergeron - Production Designer // Funny Girl 

Adric P S Cluff - Story // The Slenderman...literally...

Craig Coupal - Story // Suspender Of All Things Big & Small

Other ways to get the word out on THC+ is to share, share, share! Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your non-pot smoking neighbour about the little movie that could! 

Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, watch our weekly featurettes and join us for one heck of a wild ride!

•festival fees
•craft (food) services
•hardware (hard drives & cf cards)•advertising & marketing We have a lot of support from local Sudbury artists, musicians & vendors who are contributing to our perks and production. Big thanks and shout out to all of our amazing friends! This wouldn't be possible without you •Don Kunto www.purevolume.com/donkunto•The Sudbury Star www.tinyurl.com/po8w4g9•Black Rectangle Brand Inc. www.blackrectanglebrand.com•The Grand Nightclub www.facebook.com/GrandNightclub• Fuse www.facebook.com/FuseSudbury• SRO http://www.sronightclub.com/•Respect Is Burning www.ribsupperclub.com•Ristorante Verdicchio www.verdicchio.ca•The Motley Kitchen www.themotleykitchen.com•Sudbury Burlesque www.sudburyburlesque.com•Glasswerx pinsta.me/glasswerx•Crocodile Printing www.crocodilepress.com•Stack Brewing www.stackbrewing.ca•Nickel City Roller Derby www.ncrd.ca•Fionn MacCool's www.primepubs.com•The Mop Shop www.themopshop.ca•Northern Print Brokers www.northernprintbrokers.com•Sudbury R.E.S.T Centre www.therestcentre.com•HoodooKitty www.tinyurl.com/pdqht26•The Candy Store www.facebook.com/BooBahLou2Wiliam Andrews - Director // Writer // Captain of the S.S. Orca A product of an English Teacher mother and salesman father, Wiliam Andrews grew up knowing two things – that stories are the most important thing in the world, and that if you use your words well enough, it can put food on the table. Reading since age 3 and writing since age 4, the written word has been his first love since before his memory accurately serves. A graduate of Laurentian University’s Rhetoric and Media Studies degree and the now defunct Toronto Media and Film College’s Film Production program, Wiliam has spent the past 5 years applying his storytelling dreams to the film industry, having worked in practically every department – grip, lighting, camera, locations, transport, assistant directing and the production office. Working in development at Hideaway Pictures, Wiliam has learned the ins and outs of developing a story from the blank white page through to distribution, and is ready to jump with both feet into the dark waters of his first feature film as Director. THC+ stems from a shelved idea from film school, a loving image of two buddies on a couch that was going nowhere until Wiliam met the rest of the crew, and magic was born. Such is the trouble of having a weed friendly idea without habitually smoking pot yourself. 
Shawn McLaren - Producer // Writer // Part Time Dress Wearer Shawn McLaren is a stand-up comedian, actor, writer, producer and pot enthusiast.  After starting in the acting world performing improvised murder mysteries with Murder By Appointment, Shawn spent a few years finding himself in country music radio.  Upon realizing he would never want a big green tractor and that country music was depressing, he turned his focus to stand-up comedy and film.  Working with Motion Arc Studios on short film projects led to the founding of Flickering Pictures with Wiliam Andrews and the inception of THC+. Serving as a co-writer with director Wiliam Andrews, THC+ is Shawn’s first feature film as a writer, despite having written several short films prior to this. Shawn is incredibly stoked to make a feature film with this magnificently talented team of people and he dreams of one day sharing more stories with you.
Mathieu Seguin - Director of Photography // Soulless Gingerwww.motionarcstudios.comMathieu Séguin is a Cinematographer and the Creative
Director at MotionArc Studios. His work varies from
commercials, to documentaries, to cinema but all with the
common goal of telling a story through imagery. Aside from
knowing the technical and logistical aspect of a production,
Mathieu understands the art of lighting and uses it as his
paintbrush.

His films have played internationally and through various
film festivals. His work is often featured on Canadian
television networks. Mathieu is currently in preproduction as
Director of Photography for a one hour Documentary which
will be featured on TVO.

Mathieu is an enthusiastic cinematographer and is most
comfortable when he his behind a camera. 



Paul W. Los - Editor // Living Metaphor With a strong foundation in filmmaking and a serious passion for storytelling, Paul has travelled the globe in search of unique and compelling imagery. His innate passion for film led him to study Broadcasting - Television and Video Production at Canadore College in North Bay, Ontario.

Paul began his career in Florida collaborating with Ray Roman Films– one of the worlds leading event & wedding cinematographers. It was there he discovered the persuasive advantages and techniques of DSLR filmmaking.

Upon returning to Canada, Paul was offered a position with Emmy Award winning production company Stillmotion, where he was consistently encouraged to be a stronger storyteller – adding philosophy and grace into each piece. During his time with Stillmotion, Paul had the opportunity to collaborate with illustrious clients such as The NFL Network, Apple, CBS Sports, Showtime, Canon and AT&T. The culmination of his experience with the Stillmotion team was being one of the camera operators for the feature length docu-drama "A Game of Honor". This film would go on to be nominated for 5 Emmy Awards and recipient of 3, which included "Outstanding Sports Documentary".Nora Burns - Producer // Sanity Manager Kaitlin Lutyk - Art Department // Wedding Planner "Lovely" Louise Bergeron - Production Designer // Funny Girl Adric P S Cluff - Story // The Slenderman...literally...
Craig Coupal - Story // Suspender Of All Things Big & SmallOther ways to get the word out on THC+ is to share, share, share! Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your non-pot smoking neighbour about the little movie that could! 

Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, watch our weekly featurettes and join us for one heck of a wild ride!

story:
Short Summary

The Team of Carpe Diem...Greg Washington, John W. Chambers, & Clint McCommon....we have a strong history of making films and completing projects.  Funding out of our own pockets we have sucessfully created the first finished Web Series in Louisiana, and the First Web Series Ever to feature an Emmy Award Winning Actor (Pruitt Taylor Vince) - Infamous Web Series - was distributed and received national attention with award nominations and Emmy Award Winners in the Cast.  Now after several sucessful projects and 5 years of experience under our belts we are hitting the creative pavement again with Carpe Diem and for the first time reaching out to help produce this larger than life thrill ride of a short film.

Carpe Diem - Seize The Day.  Time...it is our enemy and something that can be wasted so easily.  Carpe Diem is an action packed extraordinary look at how the day can get away from you.  This dark action-adventure comedy lets you escape reality while dealing with a very real ticking of a clock....Carpe Diem, you never know when your time is up!

Helping us create professional content with a team of creative artists, many of whom are currently working on WGN SALEM SEASON 2 along with Post-Production Support from one of the editors of the upcoming film South Paw, will create both jobs and something we can all be proud of.  The first stop on our debut will be the Louisiana Film Prize as we make our rounds and contend with other top professionals around the world in many more Film Festivals that we have lined up.  

We believe in the idea of Carpe Diem, and the dream of doing the most with the little time you have and with this in mind, once the goal is reached, a large portion of anything over that goal will go to Capes 4 Heroes, a foundation that is dear to our hearts and to the memory of one of our dearest and closest friend and colleague Micheal Ward.  This campaign is as much about helping others as it is about living the moment creatively.

What We Need & What You Get

Carpe Diem needs simply $15,000.00 US Dollars to bring everything to life.  The money will go to the many aspects of Production and Post-Production that is needed.  From Location Cost to Paid Actors, Crew, and Equipment.  Every dollar has been broken down to get the most out of the production.  Food cost alone for six days of production is high, and with the idea that a professional crew member should be paid for their creative work, we are attempting to give back to the wonderful film family that we all know and love in our community.  This creates jobs and income for artists while making something we can all be proud of and that has interest across the film world.  Any and all props and things that can be used afterwards will go to a local charity in need.

After we reach this goal, a large portion of the funds raised will be donated to Capes 4 Heroes.  It is a project that we are passionate about and something that has touched so many children and is a big part of who we are and what we believe in.

The Perks!!!!!!  SWAG!  Everyone loves it! And we have some great items...from a simple bracelet to VIP passes to the LA Film Prize and even a Gold....or at least golden....watch!  That's right, we have gotten serious with our swag....swagger in style and be a producer with us and truly Carpe Diem!

Finally, if the goals are not reached...we are still producing this puppy...two heads and all!  To show our determination, we have already begun Production and believe in putting our money where our mouths are.  We are working around the clock on other sets and films to bring in enough to make this happen and will push forward to Carpe Diem everything!  The money raised here will allow us to add more in every area from Production to Post-Production and to the distribution of the film.  Even if you give $5.00 you will see this film be made!  We believe in completing what we start and have done so with several productions over the years...it is what we do and we would love to have you along for the ride!

The Impact

Carpe Diem will allow for working professional Actors & Crew to be just that...working.  The money raised will impact over 45 individuals for over 3 months.  Money raised over our goal will impact children across the country by the donations raised for Capes4Heroes.  All props and bought items that can be used by families will go to donations for local shelters.  Capre Diem is about Seizing the Day and we believe with that, everyone should give back.  

The teams track record for completion and success out of our own pockets and lean project development has created the First Web Series ever finished in The State of Louisisana, the countries Number 3 spot for film and TV.  We have been nominated for several awards and have worked on productions outside of our own that include Olympus Has Fallen, True Blood, SALEM, Jonah Hex, and many more.  Our Filmography is expansive as a team and is one that we are very proud of.  This year alone we have won over 10 awards for featured commercial and web based work for companies across the industry.  Our campaigns are noted for not only being creative, but in giving back to the community and those in need.  

One person can make a difference in the world....we have a team.  Not only is this a story that is different than any other short film out there, but it is a project that will affect those that work on it, and those outside of the the team.  Monies raised will promote growth in film, allow for creative achievement and promote organizations that need help.  Giving as much as we receive is our goal and something we are now looking to take to the next level with Crowd Funding.

Risks & Challenges

Seizing The Day entails grabbing a dream and holding on to it, no matter what.  But being smart about it is what we do.  Risk and Challenges on this project include everything from the lean Production and Post-Production to the overall goal of creating entertainment and making a social impact with the success of the project.  Working in Video Production over the last few years on a Local and Regional level has honed our skill in keeping things under budget and completing the impossible.  Many times we have completed projects for half the price then other companies, in half the time, and created something that is over the top in production and quality.  We have been extensive in Pre-Production, have a dedicated team, and know the ropes to solving problems on the fly.  Constant Morning Meetings and Updates are key to this and communication with our audience and participation and working with festivals will be the goal of our success.  We have many more hurdles from Art Work, Promotion, and Post-Production Special Effects to cover.  Your donation will keep this on track and under budget and our track record of creating something from nothing will provide the road map.

Other Ways You Can Help

We have donated to other campaigns in the past and sometimes we come across some amazing projects that we would love to get behind, but are unable to.  It happens.  But don't sweat it!  Be a supporter of the project and get the word out to as many people that you can everyday by clicking and sharing Carpe Diem and our campaign.  The more the word gets out the more we can do as a community.  We are all part of this beautiful Collective Conscience of Artists and those that can inspire.  Seize The Day, Carpe Diem, and support!

story:
Summary

Hey guys this is Revan and TC from Crank Revolution. We are looking to share our love and passion for cycling. The world of Cycling needs excitement. We have an amazing plan to bring you in video and film our adventures and challenges. Our next endeavor is a border to border documentary from Mexico to Canada. At some point in life, you need to get lost to find yourself. 

TC is an experienced competitive cyclist, bike guru, and semi pro quesadilla  chef who wants to experience life and see the world from his saddle.

Revan is ,essentially, the exact opposite. Kilt wearin, bike ridin, A1C checkin once morbidly obese couch potato inspired by his dream of wearing spandex and becoming the king of the mamils (middle age men in lycra)

On April 27 TC will be heading out to location to begin the journey from the Mexico border. Filmimg is already in production and we have raised most of our budget.  BUT...we need to raise an additional 10,000 to support our technical costs and  post production. 

Select a perk and donate today!!!

With your contribution and support we will bring you the documentary, youtube videos (how-to, training, challenges, stunts, and cycling absurdity (In the style of a favorite motoring show whose 3 hosts recently quit.....)

We will be shooting footage from April 22 until mid June. At that time we will begin downloading footage and begin the editing process. 


What We Need 

  • Canon 70D dslr and variety of lenses.....We need to expand our Camera base. We have fabricated custom mounts and gear but with more versatility we will capture a mush more stunning documentary we are currently shooting with hd camcorders and GoPro's
  • Terabytes of RAID storage, SD Cards, and backup server
  • Funds will help cover Post production, motion, Final Cut, and other editing/distribution costs
  • Costs of a cool refreshing beverage on the end of our trip. CHEERS!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds you can still help!!!

  • Spread the word and share this page easily using  
    • Indiegogo share tools!
