story:
Short Summary

What is Choice Magazine? It is the modern gentleman’s magazine. But what is the modern Gentleman? Who is the modern gentleman? In this modern age never like never before has the modern man had to be so much all at once. Strong but Sensitive. Playful but Respectful. Competitive but Fair. Creative but Structured. Accomplished but Humble. Choice Magazine aspires to be the new voice, the new platform for the modern Gentleman. 

We need your support to bring Choice Magazine to the world! Choice Magazine is a new and exciting Gentleman’s Magazine. A GQ meets Playboy.  Choice Magazine will be a portal for the modern sophisticated man. We are not a Juvenile simplistic portrayal of the modern man such as FHM. At the same time Choice Magazine is not your Dad’s stodgy old Gentleman’s magazine reviewing million dollar cars. Choice Magazine will offer unique and exclusive content to its readers, ranging from Fashion, Art and Culture, Dating and Relationships, Tech and Toys, and yes plenty Female Beauties. As well as everything in between to inspire and entertain the modern man as well as our other readers and supporters.

And here is the key point to Choice Magazine, INSPIRE.  Meaning that while we will bring you unique exciting and entertaining content, we also know that like the modern gentleman our Magazine will need to grow and evolve.  We hope to bring to our readers content and imagery that not only entertains you but inspires you and helps the modern gentleman get along with better ease in his daily life. While our core idea, feel, and values will remain steady, our product and content will change alongside the modern gentleman.  Choice Magazine will be a platform for the creative edges out there. Be they photographers, writers,  painters, marketers, models, journalists we plan on opening our  digital pages to a wide variety of creators from all walks of life, from many paths so as to encompass all facets of the modern gentleman.  The modern Gentleman is well rounded and knows just a little bit about a little of everything.

But down to the nitty gritty. What will we have? 

·  Style: Dress and Fashion for the modern gentleman as well as popular fashion in general. (The modern gentleman must always be stylish and dashing.

·  Class:  A look at some of the old school gentleman rules that were once passed on from one generation to another. Think holding the door open for a woman. Removing your hat indoors or at the dinner table. We’re bringing it back; it’s going to be cool again.

·  Game: Dating and relationship content. A gentleman must have game.

·  Candy: Smashing pictorials of female beauties. Our Choice girls!

·  Gizmos:  Awesome Technology and Toys. Reviews and articles of the latest and greatest, and yet to come.

·  Culture: Again a gentleman should know a little bit about everything, art, fashion, music, travel.

·  Choice Life: For everything else that is Choice in life!

Our Values: When we started Choice Magazine, we saw a gap in the content and entertainment for the modern gentleman.  We didn’t want to dumb it down and make it xtreme to the max. You are out of college, working and creating, evolving to build a life and find your path. This is why Choice is here.  We loved the beauties, fun, and nostalgia that some other publications has been bringing  to the masses for years.  But you’re not buying a million dollar Ferrari any time soon, so why are you being forced to read a lengthy review on one? Yes we can dream and aspire and we’re all for that, here we are trying to make a go at it! But we wanted to bring you Choice content for the modern gentleman and where he is in the here and now, in his daily life.

Choice will always design and develop its own unique style of content. We will rarely if ever aggregate or regurgitate other’s content. Our content will of course change and evolve to fit our reader’s needs and tastes. But it will always be unique and specialized.

While like any other publication we will rely on advertisement revenue and offer many reviews on Choice products, we set out determined to make sure that the products and services that Choice Magazine brings to your interest will be well within reach of the modern gentleman.  No five thousand dollar TV write up found here, but an awesome reasonable and fairly affordable Choice flat screen. Sure, let’s go shopping! Please help us reach our funding goal, and bring Choice Magazine to life, and to the World!


What We Need & What You Get

  • Choice Magazine needs funding, your support to pay our awesome web designers to finalize the web-site, and format it for mobile platforms. So that we can bring the best i exclusive Choice content. As well as pay our writers, photographers, models, and all other support staff that help to bring you the very best Gentleman's magazine possible.  Your funding helps us flip on the "On" switch! While the same time bringing Choice Magazine to life while at the same time letting you Advertise, Promote, and be a part of the Choice Magazine story. 
  • The Impact

With your support and donation helping bring Choice Magazine to life not only are you supporting our Digital Magazine come to life, but in turn you are also supporting a fantastic roster of creators. While Choice Magazine will be a spectacular Gentleman's magazine  at the same time it is a platform for many creators to practice their trade, and skills. We encourage and support all of our creators to contribute to Choice Magazine some of their vision and creative voice. From photographers, to models, to writers, and all the way to our designers.

With your support and contributions not only do you help bring Choice Magazine to life, but at the same time allow us to give a platform and an outlet to many awesome creators!  Should we go past our funding goal all additional funds will continue to support Choice Magazine in its day to day operations, and the more funding we have the longer we can keep offering Choice Magazine to our readers without subscription fees or an onslaught of poor quality  cheap ads. /pop ups. 

Risks & Challenges

As in any venture there are risks, however with the vision and design of Choice Magazine that we have shared with many people we have always received nothing but positive and excited responses. We have awesome designers always looking for that new creative edge and look. Fantastic writers who bring set their voiced out into the world for all to read, share, and enjoy. Superb photographers and models who share nothing but fun, beauty, and enthusiasm when creating photo shoots to bring a story to our readers eyes. Many team member's have and will continue to put many long hours of hard work and dedication into Choice, because they believe in our concept, our vision and our message. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't contribute in any monetary way, all of your support via social media is greatly appreciated. Get the word out that Choice Magazine a cool new Gentleman's Magazine is on its way. Share our funding info with others  and get our message out. When we go live come join us and be one of our readers, and share your support with others.

story:
Short Summary

- We are a group of young filmmakers who are attempting to add an original idea to a very unoriginal industry. 

- Our story begins at the end of the Wizard Wars circa 1156 AD where the Wizard Army is defeated and their reign of terror is wiped from the face of history. Fast forward to present day where a young man finds the spell book and accidentally brings back the Wizard Army as Zombies. Now facing the possible end of life as we know it the fate of humanity lies in the hands of the person who caused this whole thing in the first place. 

What We Need (Hint: Explosives)

- We need money in order to make Zombie Wizards the way it deserves to be made.
- We need money for explosives, crew, equipment, and explosives.
- Due to the fact that we are amateur high school creators, we do not have all the equipment to make this type of movie possible at the moment, so we NEED your help!
The Impact

This will be our first major production as we plan to become an even bigger name in the future.

  • The project will help us in our goal to become the best creators we can be.
  • To create something that will make people cry.
  • To have fun in creating something and saying "Hey, I made that??"

Risks & Challenges

  • May I try to express in the most basic way: WE'RE HIGH SCHOOLERS! You should be surprised that we're still alive. We believe we have the ambition to create something beautiful, but it will take time.
  • This film will be a learning process for us, and we hope you understand that.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us buy explos- I mean uh make a pretty darn good movie, SPREAD THE WORD! Share on whatever social media outlet you're into. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, your local library, the neighbors dog, and of course...myspace...

And that's all there is to it.

story: Rußlandhetze und Feinbild-Denken im alten Ost-West-Schema haben die Welt an den Rand der Katastrophe geführt. Statt Gorbatschow's Vision vom "Europäischen Haus" welches es am Ende des kalten Krieges zu bauen gelte kam es zu ökonomischer Ausbeutung mithilfe des IWF unter Jelzin und Nemzow die Rußland in den Ruin trieb während kaltblütig die NATO-Osterweiterung ohne Rücksicht auf die Bedenken Rußlands betrieben wurde, Putin hatte sich längst gegen die mafiösen Strukturen der Jelzin-Ära gewandt und diesen schließlich abgelöst. Sein Bestreben: Rußland wieder stark und unabhängig werden lassen. Die von Jelzin und Nemzow hinterlassene Überschuldung führte er binnen weniger Jahre auf fast Null zurück, legte große Devisenreserven an und gab auch psychologisch Rußland seinen Stolz zurück. In den großen Angriffskriegen der USA und anderer westlicher Staaten behielt Putin einen kühlen Kopf und hielt dagegen, auch um russische Interessen zu wahren. Nun, in der Zeit nach dem Ukraine-Krieg und vor möglichen neuen Bedrohungen ist es an der Zeit, Putin die Gelegenheit zu geben das russische Fenster im Europäischen Haus zu öffnen. Unser Film wird hierzu beitragen.  Er wird produziert von dem Journalisten und Filmproduzenten Ralph T. Niemeyer, der für seine Filme über Gorbatschow, Mandela und Chávez bekannt ist. Als Co-Produzentin ist die Oscar-Preisträgerin Barbara Biemann, deren Film über Snowden ("Citizen Four") weltweit für Aufsehen sorgte, im Gespräch. Sie hatte Interesse signalisiert. Da unsere Produktion unabhängig ist müssen wir um Spenden bitten, da wir alles aus eigener Tasche vorfinanzieren.

story:
In 2004, the South Pacific island nation of Vanuatu brought joy and happiness to our living rooms on Survivor Season 9.  Today, that same beautiful nation is facing devastation after Cyclone Pam hit overnight on March 13-14.  The country was rocked by 150+ MPH winds and torrential rains, causing untold damage, destruction and loss of life.  Now, they need our help as they try to recover and rebuild.  

I am asking you, Survivor fans across the globe, to join together and make a donation to help save Vanuatu.

100% of funds raised will go directly to the following humanitarian organizations leading the relief and recovery effort:

  • Australian Red Cross (www.redcross.org.au)
  • Save the Children Australia (www.savethechildren.org.au)
  • OXFAM Australia (www.oxfam.org.au)

Thank you in advance for your contribution, big or small.  Please share with any fans you know.  

#SaveVanuatu
story_txt:
In 2004, the South Pacific island nation of Vanuatu brought
joy and happiness to our living rooms on Survivor Season 9.
 Today, that same beautiful nation is facing devastation after
Cyclone Pam hit overnight on March 13-14.  The country was rocked by 150+
MPH winds and torrential rains, causing untold damage, destruction and
loss of life.  Now, they need our help as
they try to recover and rebuild.   
I am asking you, Survivor fans across the globe, to join together and make a donation to help save Vanuatu.
100% of funds raised will go directly to the following humanitarian organizations
leading the relief and recovery effort:

Australian Red Cross (www.redcross.org.au)
Save the Children Australia (www.savethechildren.org.au)
OXFAM Australia (www.oxfam.org.au)

Thank you in advance for your contribution, big or small.  Please share with any fans you know.  #SaveVanuatu

story:
We – Arjun, Nishanth, Ravikiran and Tapass – are the guys behind Send It Sideways, a new media venture based out of Chennai, India. The four of us plan to travel to Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos and Thailand in 30 days on three motorcycles and one utility vehicle, and document our experiences of the new peoples, cultures and lifestyles we encounter using the mediums of music, photography, film and the written word.

Through our travels, we hope to provide a fresh perspective on the countries that neighbour us, and believe that our Indian backgrounds will be hugely helpful in our doing so. The four of us plan to embark on this great journey of discovery with no backup vehicles, crew or diplomatic support.

It is our combined professional backgrounds and varied skill sets in the media and entertainment industry that has given us the confidence to plan and embark on this admittedly ambitious but exciting endeavour. More importantly, each one of us is hugely interested in meeting new people and sampling the local cuisine, not to forget adventurous (and foolish!) enough to take the road less travelled!

Our primary goal is to have everyone experience these lands with us, and encourage more people to travel; there is nothing quite as educative and enriching as travelling out of one’s comfort zones – one expands one’s horizons & perspectives.

We realise that this project is much bigger than us, but we are ready to commit to doing everything to see it materialise. Through Indiegogo, we would like you to participate in the idea; after all, the greater the overall contribution, the more we can do!

We are asking for US$ 14,500 to bring out a documentary, photobook, music album and travelogue, all of which will capture the sights, sounds and smells of these beautiful countries from all angles, and get you as close to experiencing the place as possible.

This is truly a bare-bones budget, but a contribution of this amount is just about enough to deliver a product whose quality we will be satisfied with. The budget is broken-down as below:

The money we’ve budgeted may appear rather insufficient, but we plan to make do with renting or buying second-hand vehicles, carrying essentials from home, and skimping on stay. We’ve even done away with medical costs that may be incurred! If we manage to exceed the pledge, we will focus on spending the money on the delivering a better product… think an additional drone, newer places, etc.  Our perks are meant not just to fulfill the requirement of having rewards and promotions, but to hand every backer a product that each of us is personally invested in and very proud of!

In the event of us not meeting our desired target of US$14,500 (these things happen in crowdfunding!), we plan to use the funds we receive to execute our lofty plan anyway. We might have to make compromises regarding location, mode of transportation or the amount invested in post production;  but we are committed to doing the best we can with the funds at hand.

There is a rather important reason behind our choosing to embark on this project. The four of us have spent our adolescence and youth watching beautiful, moving movies, listening to music that has made our heart sing and forced us to wonder at the intent of the artist, reading books and editorials that have taken us straight to the place of action, and staring at pictures that have frozen moments in time (think Nat Geo’s Afghan Woman). Most of these life-impacting works of art, however, have originated from places away from home. Beginning a few generations before ours, India has seemed to find greater appeal in absorbing media that has been produced outside. India, a large, complex country with one of the biggest, most diverse populations in the world, has continually produced art and entertainment for the ‘masses’ – as opposed to the ‘classes’, for purely commercial reasons. We believe that art and entertainment can be packaged smartly and aesthetically while still being commercially viable. And since we are ourselves of the ‘masses’, we are aware that there is increasing demand for – and interest in – high quality productions.  

Individually, each of us brings into this project what we’ve learned from our professional experiences. Nishanth’s experience as Locations Assistant on the award-winning movie Life of Pi and as Assistant Director on a number of films, his technical expertise and the innumerable valuable life lessons learnt from his many years in the field of filmmaking are certain to enrich Send it’s video endeavour. Ravikiran has travelled across our subcontinent looking for beauty in places often overlooked by the hasty tourist or the daily commuter, punctuating his travels with the most potent of images. With his keen eye, sense of adventure and his trusty camera, the photobook will be a treasure trove of untold stories and eloquent sights. The sounds of south Asia are certain to be documented most creatively; Tapass’ versatility as a drummer is well known, and he has experimented widely with music ranging from Indian film to old-fashioned rock ’n’ roll. Finally, Arjun’s insatiable and voracious appetite for books, and his great ambition of writing, coupled with his experience in the advertising world, cannot but yield an unputdownable and engrossing book on the foursome’s travels through great new exotic lands waiting to be chronicled. 

Based on the success of this campaign we're sure to make Send It as an ongoing series showcasing other far away lands and cultures.

Our biggest challenge remains the fact that we are taking on the unknown. We plan to travel to four countries we know next to nothing about, and the enormous language barrier is certain to prove daunting. As far as production goes, laying a strong foundation and building on it thereafter is a formidable task for any first-time endeavour. There is good news however, India is a vast country in itself, with hundreds of diverse cultures, religions and languages. In our previous journeys across our own country, we have encountered completely alien customs and people. Our travels have taught us that people are, irrespective of their region or faith, by and large the same, and have always done their best to accommodate us and make sure we feel safe and comfortable. We have, in turn, learnt to ensure not to offend them or overstep boundaries. We are confident that Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos and Thailand will be no different in this respect.

Starting off on a new endeavour is a giant lesson in self-dependence, and we have questioned ourselves relentlessly on our ability to take this up, and this self-questioning shall compel us to deliver the product we’ve promised. Fortunately, we also have wonderful friends who are experts in domains that we remain uninitiated into, and who’ve watched us like hawks, guiding us along the way.

Get updates on our Facebook page. If you can’t contribute at this time, you can still help us out! We’re asking you to help get the work out and share our campaign with your social network. Every connection you create helps ensure the success of Send It Sideways, so please use the share tools in the top left of this page!

Here’s a sample Facebook post/tweet to get you started:
Join me in supporting @senditwithus in bringing a new perspective on travelling, film making, music production and the written word to the world!

Please Note: All the photo, video and audio content seen on this project were produced by the members of Send It. Shreya Ramnath has weaved her magic with words and written for us all of the content you see which reads like a dream. Samudra Gupta, using his signature brush strokes, made us a logo that will make you want to pack your bags right away and go. Madhuvanthi Senthilkumar & Nikhil Joseph along with Samudra have been giving us old farts (we were clueless about anything do with social media) weekly lessons on digital strategy & social media. Jhanu Chanthar & Bharath Sankar for all the inputs with the music and lastly, Sreerag Veeraraghavan for putting together the viusal feast seen in the Indiegogo video. A big big thank you to all of them for being such an integral part of Send It Sideways.

story:
Short Summary

Offroading with Luke & Eddie is a Jeep/Offroad Family. Over the past two years our Family has grown to over 12,000. It doesn't matter if you drive a Jeep or not, doesn't matter if it's lifted or stock, doesn't matter if you get it muddy or not. What we are all about is a welcoming place for all in the Jeep/Offroad Community.

Offroading with Luke & Eddie currently host two yearly Jeep events, The Romp in the Swamp held on the Eastern Shore of Maryland in April and the Outer Banks Jeep Mutiny held on the Outer Banks, NC in September. We are currently working on two more locations and will be adding more events for 2016.

Our next phase is to bring or family all of our Adventures. What we are doing is creating a video journal of the Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie. As we travel and even in our everyday lives we run into all kinds of great people that are part of the Jeep/Offroad Community. We have the opportunity to travel to Jeep events and see some awesome rigs and meet new people. We also have formed relationships with different manufactures and dealers of products that we all use for our rigs. We intend to bring all this information to our family in the form of interviews with manufactures, product reviews, interviews with guys and gals that built their rigs, event coverage, wrenchin tips and anything else we can get ourselves into all presented as only the Offroading with Luke & Eddie Family could do it.   

 Any of you that have met us know we are just regular guys who love their Jeeps and the great friendship we have made over the past two years. We want to continue to grow our family and provide that Offroading with Luke & Eddie entertainment and knowledge that so many have grown to love.  

What We Need & What You Get

Over the past year we have been capturing action from different events with 3 GoPro cameras and although they are great cameras for capturing action they have their limitations.  All of the interviews that we have attempted to film to put this show together have not been of the quality that we would put our names on. The sound quality is very poor and waiting until you get back to a computer to make sure you got the shot is nothing more than hit or miss.

Also the production and promotion costs are extremely high and for us to be able to get this product out we need help.

We need to purchase at least two professional video cameras and a minimum of four wireless microphone set ups to go with the cameras. This will give us the ability to film in high quality and capture the audio in a professional manner. Once we have the footage we will be able to get assistance in producing and editing the footage and putting it together in an entertaining format for everyone to enjoy. We also will be able to promote the show and drive more traffic to it and gain more regular viewers.

We have come up with a few ideas for those that are able to help us and will be exclusive to this campaign. First and most importantly any and all help will be greatly appreciated and you will know that because of your help we are able to move forward and The Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie will be dedicated to each and every one of you.

Mall Crawler $20

  • Family signed 11X17 poster 

  • Thank you on facebook

Offroader $50

  • Family signed 11X17 poster

  • Special The Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie Tee Shirt

  • Thank you on facebook

Mud Slinger $100

  • Family signed 11X17 poster

  • Special The Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie Tee Shirt

  • Special The Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie Ball cap

  • Thank you in the shows credits

Rock Crawler $250

  • Family signed 11X17 poster

  • Special The Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie Tee Shirt

  • Special The Adventures of Offroading with Luke & Eddie Ball cap

  • Your Rig featured in one episode

  • Thank you in the shows credits

Show Sponsor $1000

  • Company Logo in opening of show

  • Tour of your shop in one episode

  • company products highlight

Associate Producer $2500

  • Billed as Associate Producer in opening credits

Risks & Challenges

 

We know that what we set as a goal appears as a lot but in order to do this and put out a product that our family deserves this is what we need to make it happen. We have looked into all the options to fund this and we decided that in order for us to maintain control and give you what we know you will like we needed to keep it all in the family.

We do risk this campaign going nowhere or not reaching our goal. If this happens we will continue to look for ways to make this happen because we know that what we have in mind will be well accepted and will do nothing but add to the overall Offroading with Luke & Eddie experience.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to help in any way it will be greatly appreciated. If you can’t help financially that is ok too, just please pass this on to anyone you know in the hopes that this ends up in the hands of those who can.

We strongly believe in this project and we know that if you have met us and spent any amount of time with us this is all out of love for the Jeep/Offroad Community and to continue to grow Offroading with Luke & Eddie.

story:
Hello lovelies!

As you may know, I have been working with the International Design Clinic since 2009 when they were based in Philadelphia, creating architectural urban interventions throughout the United States and in Bolivia. Our humanitarian design/build work has been recognized internationally including at the U.S. Pavilion at the 2012 Venice Biennale "Spontaneous Interventions: Design Actions for the Common Good" and currently on display at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City at the "Uneven Growth" exhibition. (http://uneven-growth.moma.org/post/100197648883...)

This will be my second trip, and our fourth year working in Bolivia.

Here is a breakdown of the expenses of the trip:

$ 1850  Lodging & Program Costs (includes Materials)
$ 1000 Flight
$ 600  Food & Local Travel
$ 3450 Total

This will fund the advanced stages of a few unique projects! 1. The El Alto Makerspace, to be created in partnership with Teatro Trono, a well-respected performance troupe that has a deep history working in El Alto, will bring metal- and wood-working equipment, as well as a small-scale CNC router, to an arts organization that has the connections, expertise, and desire to bring these tools and the products they produce to the people of El Alto.

2. Park-in-a-Cart _ In the summer of 2013, our team partnered with Teatro Trono to develop a mobile park platform (a deployable parkscape) for El Alto, a fringe settlement without public lands or the governing authority to create them. In the summer of 2014, we shall use the El Alto Maker Space to create several new iterations of Park-in-a-Cart. In the years that follow Teatro Trono will use the
same space to create more profound versions of this work.

3. Mobile Cantina and Culinary Institute: The Mobile Cantina and Culinary Institute will use a van platform to celebrate native Bolivian agriculture and local methods of cooking through various pop-up educational initiatives, including free cooking workshops, community kitchens, and street-festivals. To realize this work, Teatro Trono and our team will partner with the non-profit arm of Gusto – a
philanthropic initiative by internationally-recognized chef Claus Meyer. In the summer of 2014, We shall use the El Alto Maker Space to create the first version of this work; in the years that follow, our partners will use the same space to realize more advanced initiatives.

Impact Beyond the Trip

Undoubtedly, the most compelling part of the El Alto Makerspace is not the work we shall create in 2014 and 2015, but the work that our partners will create long after we have gone. Teatro Trono is an incredibly well-respected, creative, and talented organization, situated in the center of the fastest-growing fringe settlement in South America. They have, to date, designed and built three large centers for the arts in El Alto as well as various mobile arts education platforms in an around La Paz. Having a dedicated maker space, free and open to the public, will give them, and the residents they serve, the chance to experiment with new techniques of making, offer new programs, and collaboratively develop a fantastic
platform for creative exchange. The resulting work will confront the persistent cycle of dependent labor within El Alto – a cycle produced through lack of educational and creative opportunity

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, I completely understand (I'm currently working 50+ hour weeks just to pay rent and tuition)

If you can, please share this fundraising campaign on any social media outlet that you use!

The next time you shop at amazon.com please go through http://smile.amazon.com/ and select your charity to be International Design Clinic Incorporated and Amazon will donate 0.05% of your purchase to benefit the IDC.

< 3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3

Keep in mind, all donations are made directly to the International Design Clinic and are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

celebrate native Bolivian agriculture and local methods of cooking 
through various pop-up educational initiatives, including free cooking 
workshops, community kitchens, and street-festivals. To realize this 
work, Teatro Trono and our team will partner with the non-profit arm of 
Gusto – aphilanthropic initiative by internationally-recognized chef
 Claus Meyer. In the summer of 2014, We shall use the El Alto Maker 
Space to create the first version of this work; in the years that 
follow, our partners will use the same space to realize more advanced 
initiatives.

Impact Beyond the Trip 
Undoubtedly, the most compelling part of the El Alto Makerspace is not 
the work we shall create in 2014 and 2015, but the work that our 
partners will create long after we have gone. Teatro Trono is an 
incredibly well-respected, creative, and talented organization, situated
 in the center of the fastest-growing fringe settlement in South 
America. They have, to date, designed and built three large centers for 
the arts in El Alto as well as various mobile arts education platforms 
in an around La Paz. Having a dedicated maker space, free and open to 
the public, will give them, and the residents they serve, the chance to 
experiment with new techniques of making, offer new programs, and 
collaboratively develop a fantasticplatform for creative exchange. 
The resulting work will confront the persistent cycle of dependent labor
 within El Alto – a cycle produced through lack of educational and 
creative opportunity
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute with money, I completely understand (I'm currently working 50+ hour weeks just to pay rent and tuition)If you can, please share this fundraising campaign on any social media outlet that you use!The next time you shop at amazon.com please go through http://smile.amazon.com/ and select your charity to be International Design Clinic Incorporated and Amazon will donate 0.05% of your purchase to benefit the IDC.< 3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3Keep in mind, all donations are made directly to the International Design Clinic and are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

story:
Türkçe açıklama için sayfanın en altına inin. (Turkish explanation at bottom of page)

The Istanbul LGBTI Pride Week is celebrating its 23rd year.

This year, The Pride Week will be held on 22-28 June with a new found energy by an independent volunteer activist group. The Pride will continue to follow its established model of anti-hierarchical collaboration.

In the previous years, The Istanbul Pride Week activities treated a variety of themes, including "Warning, Beware of Family," "Taboo," "Memory," "Touch," and "Resistance."

During the week, we produce new ways of communication and resistance that will empower us, by way of coming together around the topics that constitute our public agenda in panels and workshops and thereby sharing our experiences and troubles, transforming them into laughter in the process. In order for the activities of the week to be held for free and open to the public, we are trying to create our own resources. Your generous support on Indiegogo successfully allowed us to do so last year.

We will be opening to your votes the candidates of your choice for the 11th yearly Genetically Modified Tomato Awards for Homophobia and Transphobia, given to that year's most homophobic / transphobic discourses.

With the parties that we organize, we not only secure funding for future Pride events but also experience the beauty of having fun with hundreds of people from many cities coming together for the LGBTI Pride Week.

We conclude our week with the massive Pride Parade, joined by 70,000 people in 2014, and glamorize the earth and the skies with the magic of the rainbow.

We are calling on you to support us in covering some of the expenses and in amplifying the political effects of our struggle:

  • Travel expenses for representatives of local organizations, which continue to form all around Turkey,

  • Travel expenses for panel presenters,

  • Cost of the megaphones and the sound system we will use during the Pride Parade,

  • Cost of the printing of the signs and their sticks that we use during the Pride Parade.

In contrast to the last year's Indiegogo campaign, we will be sending the following items to our contributors. (Shipping fees will be paid by the contributor upon the delivery of the item.)

  • $30: Istanbul Pride Week Thank You Card

  • $70: Istanbul Pride Week Bag + Istanbul Pride Week Thank You Card

  • $100: Istanbul Pride Week Note Pad + Istanbul Pride Week Bag + Istanbul Pride Week Thank You Card

  • $300+: Upon request, we will announce your name on our web site or during a Pride event.

The 23rd Istanbul Pride Week awaits your support…


Bu sene İstanbul LGBTİ Onur Haftası 23. senesini kutluyor.

Her sene yapılan çağrıya kulak veren bağımsız bir gönüllü grubu tarafından, yeni bir enerji ve yıllardır sürdürdüğü anti hiyerarşik bir dayanışma modeliyle hazırlanan Onur Haftası bu yıl 22- 28 Haziran tarihleri arasında gerçekleşecek.

Yıllardır çeşitli tema başlıkları altında düzenlenen İstanbul Onur Haftası etkinlikleri şimdiye kadar Dikkat Aile Var, Tabu, Bellek, Temas, Direniş gibi temalarla işlendi.

Hafta boyunca gündemimizi oluşturan konular üzerinden kurguladığımız paneller ve atölyelerde biraraya gelerek deneyimlerimizi, dertlerimizi paylaşıp kahkahaya çeviriyor, bizi güçlendirecek yeni temas ve direniş yolları yaratmayı sürdürüyoruz.Tüm hafta boyunca etkinliklere katılımların ücretsiz gerçekleşmesi için kendi kaynaklarımızı yaratmaya çalışıyoruz. Geçen sene indiegogo üzerinden desteğiniz, istediğimiz bir hafta çıkartmak adına amacına ulaştı.

Bu sene 11. senesi olan Hormonlu Domates Ödülleri ile yılın en homofobik/ transfobik söylemlerini gene sizin belirlediğiniz adaylarla oylamaya sunarak seçiyoruz.

Düzenlediğimiz partiler ile hem gelecek etkinlikler için kaynak sağlıyor, hem de her şehirden LGBTI Onur Haftası için gelen yüzlerce kişiyle eğlenmenin büyüsünü yaşıyoruz.

Geçtigimiz sene 70.000 insanın katıldığı,  bu sene de yeri göğü gökkuşağının sihriyle donatacak kitlesel Onur Yürüyüşü ile haftamızı sonlandırıyoruz.

Onur Haftası çalışma grubu olarak sizden bazı masrafları karşılamak amacıyla destek çağrısı yapıyor, sizlerin de desteğiyle mücadelemizi büyütmek istiyoruz;

  • Turkiye'nin dört bir yanında oluşmaya devam eden yerel örgütlerden gelecek kişilerin yol masrafları,

  • Panel Katılımcılarının ulaşım masrafları,

  • Yürüyüş sırasında kullanacağımız megafon ve ses sistemi masrafları,

  • Yürüyüşte kullandığımız lolipopların baskı ve çıta masrafları.


Bu sene geçen seneden farklı olarak destekçilerimize hazırladığımız kitleri armağan ediyoruz.


30 $ bağış karşılığında İstanbul Onur Haftası Teşekkür Kartı,

70 $  bağış karşılığında İstanbul Onur Haftası Çantası + Istanbul Onur Haftası Teşekkür Kartı,

100 $  bağış karşılığında  Istanbul Onur Haftası Not Defteri +İstanbul Onur Haftası Teşekkür Kartı + İstanbul Onur Haftası Çantası,

300 $ ve üzeri bağış yapan destekçilerimizin isimlerini istekleri takdirde web sitesinde ya da belirlenen bir etkinlikte duyuruyoruz.


23. İstanbul LGBTİ Onur Haftası desteklerinizi bekliyor...

story:
Lety & Sebastian Wedding 

This campaign is to collect funds for Sister Lety Rivero's wedding to her sweetheart Sebastian. 

The big day is in early June 2015. Anyone who has been in a wedding or has their own knows all the work it takes and how many loved ones come together to make it the spectacular celebration of a sacred union it should be. We know that she is in Chile and most of us are not, as much as we would love to be. The best, and simplest way to express our support and steam for the start of Lety and Seba's eternal adventure is by using this campaign, set up by her fortunate mission companions. Lets share the love!

We ask you to share this idea with anyone who knows and loves this couple like we do.

Thank you not only for your contribution, but more valuable you love, support, ecouragement, and enthusiasm to help in this new journey for Leticia Rivero and Sebastian Iribarra. 

Matrimonio de Lety & Sebastian 

Esta campaña es para recaudar fondos para la boda de la Hna. Lety Rivero. 

Su matrimonio será en junio 2015. Sabemos que ella está en Chile y la mejor forma de expresar nuestro apoyo y estima es por medio de esta campaña que creamos para ella las excompañeras de su misión.

Te pedimos que compartas con tus amigos  de esta idea. 

Le agradecemos por su valiosa colaboración y ayuda en esta nueva jornada de vida de Leticia Rivero y Sebastian Iribarra.

story:
The Story

Set in the beautiful Dillon Valley, From Yesterday utilizes the gorgeous landscapes of Montana all around us to tell the story of time, love, and reality. For those who enjoy mind bending stories, this will certainly be worth the watch.

We follow four characters - Moby, Jaden, Sarah, and Marie - who find themselves trying to correct a mistake which leaves the entire universe in turmoil. 

The film starts with Jaden and Moby working together in an attempt to create a machine that will allow for long distance space travel. They abandon the project after they discover that the machine wields power much too dangerous to be meddled with. However, greed, jealousy, and depression drives one of them to do the unthinkable...

Carefully researched, the screenplay works hard to convey accurate scientific theories that will make you question what is reality once you leave the theater. It has been months in the making with many more still to come! Though a script has been finished and edited many times, it is still going through an advanced writing workshop to ensure that the story is told clearly and effectively. A couple professionals in the industry are even helping in the revision stage!


The Funding

Now we come to the part where we ask for the money. But don't worry: we are not sticking out of hands and jiggling a cup in hopes of spare change. We are here to produce a professional product and we want you to be part of the epic journey! Funds from your generous donations will go to a plethora of things but some of the most important include payment for actors and crew members, food, camera equipment, props, and festival fees because yes, we are sending this film to any and all film festivals that we can. 

You can look through all the different perk options to see what fits you but to give you an idea here are some of our more popular perks: 

  • Signed copies of the movie poster, the production script, and Blu Rays
  • Tickets to our premiere in which you get to sit with the cast and crew. Be a part of the experience!
  • Access to behind the scenes footage. 
  • Sneak peak at many of the storyboards so you can see how many of the scenes are going to turn out!
  • Finally, two extremely generous donors will be given custom bead work from Morgan Kuntz. Handcrafted at every stage, any leather craft accessory you want! Examples include bracelets and belts. We will get you in contact with Morgan and you can discuss with her what you want in terms of design! It is truly a custom, one of a kind creation. 

Any donation, no matter how small, will get you on our emailing list so you can keep up to date with everything that is happening during pre-production, production, and post-production!

Remember to also like Euterra Films and Media on Facebook so you can noticed when we release a new vlog!


The Crew

Jace Kuntz - Director/Writer

An award-winning poet from the wilds of Montana, Jace Kuntz has dedicated his life to creating for audiences. A fiddle player since the age of six, he has taken part in many creative opportunities and has won awards for his musical merit including: two time National FFA Talent Competition participant, two time Montana All-State Choir member, and performing in Jamestown, Virginia to commemorate the 400th anniversary of the landing there. 
He career as a filmmaker began after being inspired by the photography of Nikki Sixx. After that, he went out and bought a DSLR - beginning his journey of photography and filmmaking. With the goal of bringing more filmmaking to Montana, he has had his sights set on producing a feature in his native town of Dillon for many years. 

 The writer and director of the feature, he has been very serious about creating the best story he can including bringing the screenplay to professionals in the industry to get their opinions and working with other filmmakers to help develop the vision.

When not filmmaking, he loves mountain biking, baseball, and hiking through the Montana landscape. 


Veronica Malesinski - Director of Photography

Award-winning filmmaker, Veronica Malesinski, is currently majoring in Digital Cinema with a concentration of Cinema Production at DePaul University's School of Cinema and Interactive Media. She is minoring in Documentary Studies. Television Student of the Year '14, Producer of the Year '14, Speech Arts Merit Recipient '14, Senior Service Recipient '14, MEHS Broadcasting Scholarship Recipient '14, her work has been showcased and has won awards at film festivals such as the All-American High School Film Festival '14 & Chicagoland Television Educators Council Film Festival '14. Recently, her photography has been published in The Smithsonian's Magazine '14. A few months ago she also won Cook County Clerk, David Orr's, Voting at 17 Video Contest '14. 

Veronica has served as the Special Projects Manager/Live Streaming Coordinator for WMTH-TV, and she has also produced for HighSchool Cube. 

When not making films, she enjoys playing sports such as volleyball, basketball, and soccer. Veronica was an CSL Student-Athlete Leader, All-Conference, and All-Sectional athlete in high school.

Jacki Colombari - Producer

A native of New Jersey, Jacki has found her niche in filmmaking as a producer. Working on MFA films and other projects all across Chicago, she as asserted herself as a go to person for putting together productions. This comes from her past experiences involving ballet and even being a registered travel agent. 
An artist in every sense of the word, she not only makes films, but also dances and draws - being the principle artist for From Yesterday's storyboards. 
When not creating, she finds herself enjoying the world. Able to speak Italian, she found herself living in that wonderful country for an extended period of time. That time helped her to focus in on what she wanted to become and that in turn has made her a valuable member of the Euterra Films and Media production team.

The Actors

Corey Renfree - Jaden 


Playing the part of Jaden is Corey Renfree. No stranger to acting, he has been performing on stage for over a decade, starting out in the Missoula Children's Theater. Since those days, he has gone on to acting camps and has been blessed with a plethora lead roles and successful campaigns during high school in Speech and Drama. 

A jack of many trades, he is also the lead singer of a local Montana band, Climax Community, and is even writing the music for the feature, which has been sampled in the teaser video. Performing is his passion and acting in front of the camera is just one of many ways he can indulge in it. 

Always looking to challenge himself, Corey has also had successful endeavors in sports such as baseball, which he has played for longer than he has even acted. This commitment to the past-time has allowed him to be a starter on numerous All-Star teams and has appeared in State Championships. 

Excited to stretch his acting muscles, Corey has put in many hours of hard work and practice to prepare himself for this role. 


Andrea Garneata - Sarah


Cast in the role of Sarah is Andrea Garneata. Hailing from Chicago, her and Director of Photography, Veronica, have a professional relationship that has spanned many years, making her an obvious choice to be a part of the production. Graduating high school early, Andrea is pursuing a career as a TV host. She has plenty of practice as she is also a YouTuber who has amassed over one hundred and fifty thousand views on her channel. 

Her experience in acting spans across many short films done throughout the city of Chicago. The role of Sarah will be her second major role. Her first being "the girlfriend" in a Tribeca short film. 


John Bodnar - Moby


The role of Moby belongs to John Bodnar. A National Merit Scholar, John comes from a similar situation as Andrea's in which he has been a part of many of Jace Kuntz's creative projects including music and photography. A veteran of the theater, John has excelled in the many roles he has been given throughout his lifetime. 
A multi-instrumentalist, he is the drummer of Climax Community and has traveled across the country with Jace performing in places such as Indianapolis for the National FFA Talent Competition. Though unable to read sheet music, John has written and produced many original piano scores and is even helping some in the creation of the soundtrack for the feature. 

The Documentary

As mentioned above, the feature isn't the only project that we are tackling this summer. Alongside the narrative, we will also be producing two full-length documentaries. One is a record of our journey from start to finish as we create this film in Montana. Think of it as an epic behind the scenes movie. Community involvement is important to us and we want to get you as close to the action as possible! While many of you can't make out to the production to see things first hand, we feel that a behind the scenes documentary will be the next best thing. 
The other is something that is dear to all of our hearts. As the world continues to become more and more connected, we have reached an age where culture is becoming more and more obscure. The effects of this is very evident in the cultures of the Native Americans and the ranchers of Montana. 
During filming of the feature and for months afterwards, we will be following family owned ranches, Native American gatherings, and Montana's very own Folk Festival so we can record how these cultures cope with the ever shrinking world and try to figure out what the future holds for traditions that have stood for hundreds of years. 
We would like to express our gratitude to Heidi Hirschy, the Big Hole National Battlefield, and the Montana Folk Festival for allowing us to record their message. 

Thank You

There are not enough words to express how thankful we are of any and all support you can give us as we bring this story to life. This film is something that we as a production crew cannot wait to share with the public and for this reason, we want you to feel as much a part of this process as possible! 
Even something as small as a share on your social media pages could mean all the difference in the world. 
We will be regularly updating the campaign so you can track what progress is being made. Along with the perks for donations, we hope to make it unique and interesting so it can be our way of showing our appreciation for everything that you have done for us. 
Again, thank you for everything and we can't wait to share all of this with you!

Television Student of the Year '14, Producer of the Year '14, Speech Arts Merit Recipient '14, Senior Service Recipient '14, MEHS Broadcasting Scholarship Recipient '14, her work has been showcased and has won awards at film festivals such as the All-American High School Film Festival '14 & Chicagoland Television Educators Council Film Festival '14. Recently, her photography has been published in The Smithsonian's Magazine '14. A few months ago she also won Cook County Clerk, David Orr's, Voting at 17 Video Contest '14. 
Veronica has served as the Special Projects Manager/Live Streaming Coordinator for WMTH-TV, and she has also produced for HighSchool Cube. 
When not making films, she enjoys playing sports such as volleyball, basketball, and soccer. Veronica was an CSL Student-Athlete Leader, All-Conference, and All-Sectional athlete in high school.
Jacki Colombari - Producer

A native of New Jersey, Jacki has found her niche in filmmaking as a producer. Working on MFA films and other projects all across Chicago, she as asserted herself as a go to person for putting together productions. This comes from her past experiences involving ballet and even being a registered travel agent. 
An artist in every sense of the word, she not only makes films, but also dances and draws - being the principle artist for From Yesterday's storyboards. 
When not creating, she finds herself enjoying the world. Able to speak Italian, she found herself living in that wonderful country for an extended period of time. That time helped her to focus in on what she wanted to become and that in turn has made her a valuable member of the Euterra Films and Media production team.

The Actors
Corey Renfree - Jaden 



Playing the part of Jaden is Corey Renfree. No stranger to acting, he has been performing on stage for over a decade, starting out in the Missoula Children's Theater. Since those days, he has gone on to acting camps and has been blessed with a plethora lead roles and successful campaigns during high school in Speech and Drama. A jack of many trades, he is also the lead singer of a local Montana band, Climax Community, and is even writing the music for the feature, which has been sampled in the teaser video. Performing is his passion and acting in front of the camera is just one of many ways he can indulge in it. 
Always looking to challenge himself, Corey has also had successful endeavors in sports such as baseball, which he has played for longer than he has even acted. This commitment to the past-time has allowed him to be a starter on numerous All-Star teams and has appeared in State Championships. 
Excited to stretch his acting muscles, Corey has put in many hours of hard work and practice to prepare himself for this role. 

Andrea Garneata - Sarah




Cast in the role of Sarah is Andrea Garneata. Hailing from Chicago, her and Director of Photography, Veronica, have a professional relationship that has spanned many years, making her an obvious choice to be a part of the production. Graduating high school early, Andrea is pursuing a career as a TV host. She has plenty of practice as she is also a YouTuber who has amassed over one hundred and fifty thousand views on her channel. 
Her experience in acting spans across many short films done throughout the city of Chicago. The role of Sarah will be her second major role. Her first being "the girlfriend" in a Tribeca short film. 

John Bodnar - Moby




The role of Moby belongs to John Bodnar. A National Merit Scholar, John comes from a similar situation as Andrea's in which he has been a part of many of Jace Kuntz's creative projects including music and photography. A veteran of the theater, John has excelled in the many roles he has been given throughout his lifetime. 
A multi-instrumentalist, he is the drummer of Climax Community and has traveled across the country with Jace performing in places such as Indianapolis for the National FFA Talent Competition. Though unable to read sheet music, John has written and produced many original piano scores and is even helping some in the creation of the soundtrack for the feature. 

The Documentary
As mentioned above, the feature isn't the only project that we are tackling this summer. Alongside the narrative, we will also be producing two full-length documentaries. One is a record of our journey from start to finish as we create this film in Montana. Think of it as an epic behind the scenes movie. Community involvement is important to us and we want to get you as close to the action as possible! While many of you can't make out to the production to see things first hand, we feel that a behind the scenes documentary will be the next best thing. 
The other is something that is dear to all of our hearts. As the world continues to become more and more connected, we have reached an age where culture is becoming more and more obscure. The effects of this is very evident in the cultures of the Native Americans and the ranchers of Montana. 
During filming of the feature and for months afterwards, we will be following family owned ranches, Native American gatherings, and Montana's very own Folk Festival so we can record how these cultures cope with the ever shrinking world and try to figure out what the future holds for traditions that have stood for hundreds of years. 
We would like to express our gratitude to Heidi Hirschy, the Big Hole National Battlefield, and the Montana Folk Festival for allowing us to record their message. 

Thank You
There are not enough words to express how thankful we are of any and all support you can give us as we bring this story to life. This film is something that we as a production crew cannot wait to share with the public and for this reason, we want you to feel as much a part of this process as possible! 
Even something as small as a share on your social media pages could mean all the difference in the world. 
We will be regularly updating the campaign so you can track what progress is being made. Along with the perks for donations, we hope to make it unique and interesting so it can be our way of showing our appreciation for everything that you have done for us. 
Again, thank you for everything and we can't wait to share all of this with you!

story:
Documentary Triple Feature!

Documentary Triple Feature (DTF) is the beginning of a project with the aim of showcasing people in small towns across the Maritimes. With the big push towards urban life, it is important to remember, take pride, and recognise the contributions of people from all walks of life in communities big and small. 

DTF will be employing talented people in all the communities we visit as well as contributing to local economies.


Who's doing this?

   

PRODUCER/DIRECTOR- Troy Howell has been working in media for over a decade. He has produced short films of all kinds, worked for television companies, acted, directed, production managed a travelling show, and helped countless friends and associates with their films.
PRODUCER/DIRECTOR- DT Siddhartha Fraser has worked with Troy over the years and won awards from short and feature length script writing. Originally from the Annapolis Valley, he has spent several years in Asia where he is also working on a short subject documentary. Besides writing, Fraser produced a short series for NJTV's Mobile Channel in Nanjing, China.
COMPOSER- Clayton Murray is a master of the guitar. He has created countless pieces of music in a variety of styles for musicians across the country and continually performs live on a weekly basis.
EDITOR- Chris Campbell is a master craftsman with decades of experience behind the camera and in the editing room. He is also an accomplished film/video teacher with the NSCC, contributes to a variety of art programs, tirelessly helps out friends and colleagues with their productions, and won various awards for filmmaking.
 More on Chris Campbell click here!

WHY DOCS? 
Every community has individuals who stand out in a variety of ways. We want to celebrate those people who contribute in their own way to make communities more enjoyable. The long term vision is to produce dozens of films on people from towns all over the Maritimes and then the rest of Canada. The result will be documents of the people and culture of what Canada is all about!

HOW DOES IT WORK?

We want to make all three films and if we can get to at least 60% of our goal we can make them. They will still look good and be put together well but we want to make them shine!
If we are able to reach our goal, we would be able to add that extra mile to all of them. The bulk of expenses will be post-productions; when we are editing the films together. Post-production is where most of the budget will be spent on things like colour correction, sound, music, insurance, marketing, effects and titles, online/offline editors, etc.
Most of the crews we are going to hire for when we shoot will be from the communities the documentaries are based in. That also applies for post-production services, so the money will be going to those communities!


The DOCS:

  


1. Currently Untitled explores the friendship of two of Atlanic Canada's most relevant painters: Wayne Boucher and Geoff Butler.

MORE on Wayne Boucher here!

Go with Wayne and Geoff on the journey of their lifetime to discover decades of shared experiences, fantastic collections of art, and one of the most intriguing friendships between artists. For the FIRST time, Geoff and Wayne will be collaberating on an art project exclusively for this film!



  
2. OWL'S HEAD ROAD HOUSE CONCERTS  is a compelling story about a retired St. Mary's University professor and his passion for live music. From his home in Liverpool, NS, Harold McGee invites friends and members of the community to experience live music by various artists from across the country. 

Check out the OHRHC FB page here!

Experience great music, fun times, and discover Hal's path through life that lead him to create a unique and magical venue for everyone to enjoy! PLUS you'll get to see Hal create fantastic hand-painted scarves in his secret workshop!

  


3. ELLSWORTH the life story of Canada's youngest cinema manager: Al Whittle of Wolfville, NS. Originally from New Brunswick, Al started working in the movie business in his late teens. Beginning in Amherst, NS, he quickly rose in the ranks to become Canada's youngest theatre manager!

     

Al settled in Wolfville where he managed the Acadia Cinema until his retirement in 2000. Not only was he the cinema manager, he was a man everyone recognised and knew for his warm-hearted greetings and open acceptance of every person who went to the movies. And he worked at Acadia University during the day so all the students knew him by name!


What will they look like?

Both films are being shot in HD for maximum picture quality. They will be easily screened in a digital cinema or scaled all the way down to an iPad. 

Principle photography will begin in August 2015 and will continue intil the middle to end of October 2015. Post-production will follow with all three films edited and mixed by August 2016.


Currently Untitled will feature direct cinema as the process of Wayne & Geoff creating their collaboration and executing their plan will be shown as it actually unfolds mixed with interviews from five women who know them well. to tie it all together Dave Whitney will guide us through the ins and outs of this unique friendship!

Owl's Head Road House Concerts will feature live performances, interviews with past and present artists who have attended Owl's Road concerts, and an in-depth look at the life journey of founder Harold McGee. Hal will guide us through the process of setting the stage for so many talented artists while at the same time exploring a rich and full life of a very tall man and a master of scarf painting!

ELLSWORTH will have interviews conducted of people close to Al as well as dramatisations on the five most important moments in his life. These dramatisations will be in a live theatre format with each segment at about 5-8 minutes, spread throughout the film. Each segment will feature a different director (TBA) and reflect a specific time period in Al's life.


What Else Can I do?

As we approach summer, we will be casting for parts in the five dramatic segments for ELLSWORTH! We are looking for talented screen and stage actors in the Wolfville and surrounding area. We'll also be hiring small crews starting in August so keep checking here and on the official website!


What will happen when the films are finished?

Once the films are complete, we will submit them to documentary film festivals around the world. We are currently pursuing a broadcasters agreement so that we can also put them on television! They will be available to rent or watch online after their runs on the festival circuit and television circuit.

Check out one of the perks: The ELLSWORTH mug!

Help yourself by helping us make great films on people in our communities!

Contribute today, contribute often!

story:
UPDATE: Cecil Baldwin of Welcome to Nightvale joins the cast! Get a signed poster from him and be featured in the film's credits!


Is your name Joe? Joseph? Josephine? Joey?

Is your name Bob? Robert? Bobbi? Roberta?

Little did you know that you were part of a vast conspiracy. 
The Joeolution and the Bobolution.
  • Ever see the store Trader Joes? The Joes have created that franchise as a means of promoting themselves. Bob Evans is an equivalent for the Bobs.
  • "Bobbing for apples" comes from a time when Joes would try and drown Bobs. 
  • "Average Joe" and "Joe schmo" are terms that derive from Bobs demeaning the Joes' individuality.
It's all hiding right in front of our eyes and Billie Jessup and Custodia Saxon are here to bust open these secrets on the silver screen. With cameos from famous folk such as James Marsters (Buffy the Vampire Slayer), Chef Buddy of Cake Boss, Hank Green of the Vlogbrothers, and Dav Pilkey (author of the Captain Underpants series), you know it's going to be insane!

I, Joe Kowalski, am many things. I am a YouTuber who has created over 200 short films, music videos, interviews, and comedy sketches. I am a professional video editor who has worked on national television, feature films, and digital media. And, most recently, I am a filmmaker. Last year, I made my first full-length film, One Day: A Musical, which was a lot of fun and enjoyed by thousands of people. That production was also partially funded through Indiegogo.

You know what's harder than making a first movie? A second movie. The stakes are higher. People expect it to be better in every single way. We're up for the challenge.

I'm really excited about the screenplay. It's got a weird conspiracy, and stepsisters attempting to reconnect, and laughs, and tears, and it's going to be a roller coaster of a ride. Through the oh-so-glorious magic of Indiegogo, you can now join us along on this exciting journey.

Here's our IMDb page: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4499630/

Here is what we'll be spending the budget on, in order of crucialness:

1. Meals (20%)

2. Transportation (20%)

3. Props/Locations (20%)

4. Renting equipment we don't currently have (15%)

5. Premiere/Marketing/Film Festivals (15%)

6. Indiegogo Perks (5%)

7. Any other unforeseen funds (5%)

One reason I wanted to make this movie is that a lot of films lack great female leads. I tried my best to write two female leads with depth, humor, and character development. More of that is needed in our entertainment. 

This movie will also focuses on positive messages of unity in the face of prejudice, the conflicts that comprises sibling relationships, and, yes, even the importance of friendships. Aw.

This movie is designed to look like a documentary and will require filming ALL O'ER THE PLACE. There will be a lot of shoot days with a lot of actors and actresses that we have already cast.

I can assure you that this project will be completed by August of this year and that you will also get your prizes before the year is out, after our premiere is over. We were able to meet this goal last year and we are going to do it again.

I, being a lowly college student, understand financial woes completely. If you cannot afford to pitch in money towards this movie there are still other things you can do! Give us a like on our "Billie Bob Joe" Facebook page. Share a link to the Indiegogo page. Watch the movie online when it premieres on there. Every action helps.

Thank you for your help. Let's make something awesome together. :)

-Joe Kowalski

story:
Thank you for all of your support, contributions, and sharing!

Our campaign is closed now, and we are moving forward with finishing this film!




In this film we ride along with Ryan and Sam Weber (The Weber Brothers) as they continue to pursue their dream of living as musicians, being the best at what they do. We witness the struggles they have encountered over the past 15 years, and the struggles they currently face as they continue on their journey with no record labels, managers or booking agents. They have made it work by building a dedicated fan base, and it has allowed them to do what they love, every day. 

The story to this point has been an exciting one, providing them with countless opportunities to learn more about themselves and what really matters in life. For them, what matters most is not fame, fortune, or mainstream success. It is simply about making music. This film is a vehicle that will carry this message and their music to the world, inspiring old and new fans alike.


This film is currently in post-production. This story needs to be told, and it will happen! 

Whatever funds that have been raised here will be used to support this project in achieving its potential. This film will be finished, regardless. Every contribution has made this film better.


  • Advance downloads of the film + bonus features and deleted scenes. There are lots of extras! Extended interviews, exclusive live performances, side-stories that didn't make the cut, and more.
  • We will be hosting a Private Pre-Release Screening exclusively for our contributors in our hometown of Peterborough. An exciting way to celebrate, and thank you for being a part of it.
  • Full-size, limited edition Movie Posters signed by the Weber Brothers. 
  • Digital Download of the Weber Brothers Unreleased Demos (2000-2001) These are never-before heard demos... kind of like the basement tapes! Really cool!
  • Grab bags of goodies. These will be packed with some cool merch for you to take home.
  • CREDITS - our higher-tiered contributors will be credited at the end of the movie. The ever coveted Executive Producer credit being the top dog. This could be your ticket into the biz! Associate Producer credits are right up there too, and we must not undervalue the significance of a Special Thanks! 
Perks will be honoured as soon as they become available. You will receive updates on their status!
Any questions about perks or anything else, please email: robviscardis@gmail.com
 Thanks!
