story:
Who were Los Cautivos?

In 1892, the Pueblo of Isleta, New Mexico, enlisted the skills of journalist Charles Lummis to gain the release of their children being held captive at the Albuquerque Indian School.

The final act in America’s 19th Century conquest of Native Americans was to forcibly re-educate their children at Indian Boarding Schools.  Here the children could be held without parental permission, while their language, identity and culture were stripped from them and replaced with Anglo versions.  Many Eastern reformers truly believed this was the best way to help a "dying culture" assimilate into America.

For three years the children of Isleta were held at the Albuquerque Indian school and were denied any contact with their parents.  The Pueblo enlisted the help of noted journalist Charles Fletcher Lummis who brought their plight to national attention.  The weight of public opinion combined with a law suit, forced the school to return The Captives, Los Cautivos, to their families.

Set against the background of the final Indian Wars and the closing of the Western Frontier, the film uses Lummis’s articles, his photographs along with official records to explore the racial, cultural and religious prejudice that informed politics and determined the national policy. The damage these policies did to family and tribe are examined through interviews with Isletan elders and contemporary graduates of Indian Boarding Schools.

Why this is important:

After generations of mis-education, today’s Native peoples are still subject to State and Federal standards that often don’t take into account community needs and customs. 

(Photo: Charles F. Lummis, Marcelina Abeita  and three boys. Braun Research Library Collection, Autry National Center, Los Angeles, CA.)

Why we need your help:

1. We need to hire a researcher who can scour the National Archives for the official documents about the problems at the Albuquerque Indian School  and to find the letters of complaint by the Pueblo.

2. Cover costs of a camera crew and travel to Isleta to record Elders who’s parents were involved with this story and to record their own personal boarding school experiences.

3.  Pay for transcripts of interviews and Tigua to English translations, where necessary.

4. Additional monies raised will go to securing rights to various images and to pay for the next stage; Scripting.

How you can help!

Make a donation.  No amount is too small. There are some incredible perks as well, including prints of a Charles Lummis photograph of an Isleta woman with the corn harvest and a hand-made Hopi basket by award winning basket-maker Kelsey Kayquoptewa, of Third Mesa!

Or

Share this campaign with your friends and family, through email or social media and encourage them to share it as well.  The more people aware of this film the sooner we can finish the project.

Who we are... The Production Crew: 

Bert Atkinson – Producer/Director 

As an award winning filmmaker, Bert specializes in documentaries for the non-profit company. Recently, Bert worked with The Huntington Library Art Collection and Botanical Gardens on a bilingual series documenting the development of The Huntington’s Chinese Garden. Other clients include the Los Angeles Unified School District, The Exceptional Children’s Foundation, WYNGS – Project for Spinal Cord Injury and Pacific Oaks Teacher’s College. As an independent producer, Bert created the award winning Grief In America, about social patterns of bereavement and recovery.

Bob Burris – Writer 

Bob has been a writer/producer since the early 1980’s working on Network shows such as “Growing Pains,” “Just the Ten of Us,” “Thunder Alley,” and “In the House.” In feature films he did the final polish for Warner Brothers on “Scooby Doo,” and for Disney’s “Beverly Hills Chihuahua.” He wrote and produced the recently released “1000 to 1.” In documentaries he was a producer and writer on “Sample This,” and is currently writing a feature length documentary on the Oneida Nation’s part in the Revolutionary War entitled “American Warrior.” Bob is a member of the Chickasaw Nation.

James Mathers – Director of Photography 

Experienced with over 40 feature films and Movies of the Week. James is a pioneer in the use of digital cinema cameras and is the founder of the Digital Cinema Society. In the documentary realm, James was the DP on “The US vs John Lennon” for Lionsgate. The Showtime special “Beautiful Dreamer: Brian Wilson and the Story of Smile.” He also shot segments for Sundance Documentary winner “For The Bible Tells Me So.”

Jim Sevin – Editor 

Jim has 30 years experience editing everything from “Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling” to Catholic religious programing and from rap music videos to America’s Funniest Videos. Jim has a number of documentaries to his credit including “Grief In America” and “Liu Fang Yuan” Chinese Garden Series for The Huntington with Mr. Atkinson. For several years, Jim has specialized in building fake television shows for playback in dozens of movies like “Jurassic Park: The Lost World” and “Independence Day,” and for television shows like “Without A Trace” and “Scandal.” He is also the technical director for the show “The Newsroom.” His technical position on these shows challenges him to be current with the latest editing technology and styles to ensure a fresh and cutting edge look that the networks demand.


(Photo: Charles F. Lummis, Braun Research Library Collection, Autry National Center, Los Angeles.)

 

Production Advisors:

Theodore Jojola, Ph.D.

Professor of Planning for the Masters Program in Community & regional Planning University of New Mexico 1996 – present.  Past Director of Native American Studies UNM 1980-1996.  Dr. Jojola is a member of the Pueblo of Isleta and as such is in a unique position to comment on Lummis and his relations with the Pueblo. Dr. Jojola is engaged in ongoing research for a number of Federal and State projects pertaining to  the needs of Native Americans.

K. Tsianina Lomawaima Ph.D. 

Professor of Justice and Social inquiry, Distinguished Scholar in Indigenous Education Arizona State University 2009 – present.  Faculty of American Indian Studies University of Arizona 1994-2005.  2005-2009 Head of the that Department. Her interests include the history of American Indian education. Her books have garnered national recognition, including: To Remain an Indian (Outstanding book ward, American Educational Research Assoc.); and They Called it Prairie Light (North American Indian Prose Award, American Educational Assoc. Critic’s Choice Award). She helped found and is past president of the Native American and Indigenous Studies Assoc.

Mark Thompson 

Author of American Character: The Curious Life of Charles Fletcher Lummis and the Rediscovery of the Southwest.  This was Mark's first book and it won the 2002 Spur Award from the Western Writers of American. In addition, Mark has written for the Atlantic Monthly, Wall Street Journal and the Los Angeles Times.

Henry Walt Ph. D.  

Mr. Walt is an advisor on the film and acts as a liaison between the filmmaker and the Isleta Cultural Affairs Council. He is an author of 3 books on the region and acting advisor to the Cultural Affairs Council of Iselta.  Mr. Walt was the project director for the traveling museum exhibit entitled Isletan Images: a photographic history of the Pueblo in the 19th Century.  As project director he oversaw an NEH grant in the excess of $300,000.

Kim Walters  

Past Director of the Braun Research Library for 20 years and current Ahmanson Curator of Native American History and Cutlure at the Autry National Center. Ms. Walters has a number of publications to her credit including the finding aids to the Charles F. Lummis Manuscript Collection: Journal Series and Charles F. Lummis Manuscript Collection: Correspondence Series Volumes I-III.  Ms. Walters also has intimate knowledge of the over 4,000 photographs that Lummis made as well as the 500 plus wax cylinder recordings he captured of Native and Mexican folksongs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to our campaign, there are many other ways to help!

  • Spread the word by sharing this campaign to your friends, family, and social networks.
  • Educate yourself and other about the history of Los Cautivos and spread awareness!

Thanks so much for your time, attention, and support! 

(Henry Kendall at Carlisle.  Dickinson College Archives & Special Collections.)

All photographs courtesy of the Braun Research Library, Autry National Center, CA,.  The Dickinson College Archives & Special Collections. Keith Lummis and the Lummis family.
story_txt:
Who were Los Cautivos?
In 1892, the Pueblo of Isleta, New Mexico, enlisted the skills of journalist Charles Lummis to gain the release of their children being held captive at the Albuquerque Indian School.
The final act in America’s 19th Century conquest of Native Americans was to forcibly re-educate their children at Indian Boarding Schools.  Here the children could be held without parental permission, while their language, identity and culture were stripped from them and replaced with Anglo versions.  Many Eastern reformers truly believed this was the best way to help a "dying culture" assimilate into America.
For three years the children of Isleta were held at the Albuquerque Indian school and were denied any contact with their parents.  The Pueblo enlisted the help of noted journalist Charles Fletcher Lummis who brought their plight to national attention.  The weight of public opinion combined with a law suit, forced the school to return The Captives, Los Cautivos, to their families.
Set against the background of the final Indian Wars and the closing of the Western Frontier, the film uses Lummis’s articles, his photographs along with official records to explore the racial, cultural and religious prejudice that informed politics and determined the national policy. The damage these policies did to family and tribe are examined through interviews with Isletan elders and contemporary graduates of Indian Boarding Schools.

Why this is important:
After generations of mis-education, today’s Native peoples are still subject to State and Federal standards that often don’t take into account community needs and customs. 


(Photo: Charles F. Lummis, Marcelina Abeita  and three boys. Braun Research Library Collection, Autry National Center, Los Angeles, CA.)

Why we need your help:

1. We need to hire a researcher who can scour the National Archives for the official documents about the problems at the Albuquerque Indian School  and to find the letters of complaint by the Pueblo.
2. 
Cover costs of a camera crew and travel to
Isleta to record Elders who’s parents were involved with this story and to
record their own personal boarding school experiences.

3.  Pay for
transcripts of interviews and Tigua to English translations, where necessary.
4. Additional monies raised will go to securing rights to
various images and to pay for the next stage; Scripting.

How you can help!
Make a donation.  No amount is too small. 

There are some incredible perks as well, including prints of a Charles Lummis photograph of an Isleta woman with the corn harvest and a hand-made Hopi basket by award winning basket-maker Kelsey Kayquoptewa, of Third Mesa!
Or
Share this campaign with your friends and family, through email or social media and encourage them to share it as well.  The more people aware of this film the sooner we can finish the project.



Who we are... The Production Crew: 


Bert Atkinson – Producer/Director 


As an award winning filmmaker, Bert specializes in documentaries for the non-profit company. Recently, Bert worked with The Huntington Library Art Collection and Botanical Gardens on a bilingual series documenting the development of The Huntington’s Chinese Garden. Other clients include the Los Angeles Unified School District, The Exceptional Children’s Foundation, WYNGS – Project for Spinal Cord Injury and Pacific Oaks Teacher’s College. As an independent producer, Bert created the award winning Grief In America, about social patterns of bereavement and recovery.


Bob Burris – Writer 
Bob has been a writer/producer since the early 1980’s working on Network shows such as “Growing Pains,” “Just the Ten of Us,” “Thunder Alley,” and “In the House.” In feature films he did the final polish for Warner Brothers on “Scooby Doo,” and for Disney’s “Beverly Hills Chihuahua.” He wrote and produced the recently released “1000 to 1.” In documentaries he was a producer and writer on “Sample This,” and is currently writing a feature length documentary on the Oneida Nation’s part in the Revolutionary War entitled “American Warrior.” Bob is a member of the Chickasaw Nation.

James Mathers – Director of Photography 
Experienced with over 40 feature films and Movies of the Week. James is a pioneer in the use of digital cinema cameras and is the founder of the Digital Cinema Society. In the documentary realm, James was the DP on “The US vs John Lennon” for Lionsgate. The Showtime special “Beautiful Dreamer: Brian Wilson and the Story of Smile.” He also shot segments for Sundance Documentary winner “For The Bible Tells Me So.”

Jim Sevin – Editor 
Jim has 30 years experience editing everything from “Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling” to Catholic religious programing and from rap music videos to America’s Funniest Videos. Jim has a number of documentaries to his credit including “Grief In America” and “Liu Fang Yuan” Chinese Garden Series for The Huntington with Mr. Atkinson. For several years, Jim has specialized in building fake television shows for playback in dozens of movies like “Jurassic Park: The Lost World” and “Independence Day,” and for television shows like “Without A Trace” and “Scandal.” He is also the technical director for the show “The Newsroom.” His technical position on these shows challenges him to be current with the latest editing technology and styles to ensure a fresh and cutting edge look that the networks demand.


(Photo: Charles F. Lummis, Braun Research Library Collection, Autry National Center, Los Angeles.)
 

Production Advisors:
Theodore Jojola, Ph.D.
Professor of Planning for the Masters Program in Community & regional Planning University of New Mexico 1996 – present.  Past Director of Native American Studies UNM 1980-1996.  Dr. Jojola is a member of the Pueblo of Isleta and as such is in a unique position to comment on Lummis and his relations with the Pueblo. Dr. Jojola is engaged in ongoing research for a number of Federal and State projects pertaining to  the needs of Native Americans.

K. Tsianina Lomawaima Ph.D. 
Professor of Justice and Social inquiry, Distinguished Scholar in Indigenous Education Arizona State University 2009 – present.  Faculty of American Indian Studies University of Arizona 1994-2005.  2005-2009 Head of the that Department. Her interests include the history of American Indian education. Her books have garnered national recognition, including: To Remain an Indian (Outstanding book ward, American Educational Research Assoc.); and They Called it Prairie Light (North American Indian Prose Award, American Educational Assoc. Critic’s Choice Award). She helped found and is past president of the Native American and Indigenous Studies Assoc.

Mark Thompson 
Author of American Character: The Curious Life of Charles Fletcher Lummis and the Rediscovery of the Southwest.  This was Mark's first book and it won the 2002 Spur Award from the Western Writers of American. In addition, Mark has written for the Atlantic Monthly, Wall Street Journal and the Los Angeles Times.

Henry Walt Ph. D.  


Mr. Walt is an advisor on the film and acts as a liaison between the filmmaker and the Isleta Cultural Affairs Council. He is an author of 3 books on the region and acting advisor to the Cultural Affairs Council of Iselta.  Mr. Walt was the project director for the traveling museum exhibit entitled Isletan Images: a photographic history of the Pueblo in the 19th Century.  As project director he oversaw an NEH grant in the excess of $300,000.


Kim Walters  
Past Director of the Braun Research Library for 20 years and current Ahmanson Curator of Native American History and Cutlure at the Autry National Center. Ms. Walters has a number of publications to her credit including the finding aids to the Charles F. Lummis Manuscript Collection: Journal Series and Charles F. Lummis Manuscript Collection: Correspondence Series Volumes I-III.  Ms. Walters also has intimate knowledge of the over 4,000 photographs that Lummis made as well as the 500 plus wax cylinder recordings he captured of Native and Mexican folksongs.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute to our campaign, there are many other ways to help!  Spread the word by sharing this campaign to your friends, family, and social networks. Educate yourself and other about the history of Los Cautivos and spread awareness!  Thanks so much for your time, attention, and support! 

(Henry Kendall at Carlisle.  Dickinson College Archives & Special Collections.)
All photographs courtesy of the Braun Research Library, Autry National Center, CA,.  The Dickinson College Archives & Special Collections. Keith Lummis and the Lummis family.

story:
Our father is in hospice in Maine, USA, suffering from terminal cancer. Donate to help us make the trip from Israel to America to see him for the first time in 30 years.

Our parents separated when Deborah was a year old and Shayna was still a "bun in the oven." We found him later in life but have not yet been able to make a trip to meet in person.

We were recently informed that he has late-stage cancer, in his lungs and bladder, which has metastasized to his brain, leaving him moderately immobile. Our only hope at this point to meet him, for once in our lives, is for us to travel to Maine.

We are working hard to scrape together our shekels, but are turning to you for help before time runs out. Shayna is a single mother to four children, and to put perspective on our situation for our friends in America, the minimum wage in Israel is currently equivalent to less than $1200 a month, with the cost of rent typically half that.

Our goal of $3500 is the estimated cost of round-trip airfare between Tel Aviv and New York, and domestic travel to Maine. We have already renewed our passports (we don't get out much and they all expired) and have arranged lodging and most meals. Any contributions above this goal will further help to defray travel to/from the airports, and childcare while away.

Our biological father has no other children around to care for him in this difficult time.  Your support will help us be there for him and bring comfort while filling this hole in our own hearts.

story:
What is SPUNKFLICKER?

SPUNKFLICKER is a short film that tells the story about an 8 year old named Karen, who struggles to fit in because her personality and imagination can get out of hand.

Karen is often left alone because of her raw nature. Karen's father steps in to fill her void and begins to nurture her imagination.

Eventually Karen picks up on her father's natural nerdiness and hobbies, because of this, their bond is quickly sowed and grown.  

When her father passes away in the line of duty, Karen pushes her loss into her aspirations in space exploration that are way beyond of what her father could ever have imagined.

Who are you?


J.O. Malone, Producer
JOMaloneUSA.com
J.O. Malone's last project, H - Town, "The Movie" was completed in March. J.O. has a film & photography studio(J.O. Malone Studios) near downtown Houston which served as the home base for the project. 
H - Town, "The Movie" (Concept Trailer) 

Adonay H. Gallardo, Director
Adonay's Directing/Motion Graphics Reel/
His unique energy and workhorse attitude makes him perfect for a film of this nature. His previous efforts have seen him not only lead big crews but also being a great on set spark plug.


Esteban Valencia, DP
Estaban is a graduate of the University of Houston's Digital Media Program, he has collaborated with Adonay on projects w/Savage Henry Films and NOC Films. Although this is his first DP credit, his unique visual style will strike the hearts of viewers. 

Ryan Shoots, 1st AD
Is a graduate of UH's Media Producitons program. His long standing collaboration with Adonay is unique in partnership that produces the highest production level and no bullshit creativity.

Why should I give you my money? 
The amount we're asking for is what we need to get everything done... basically saying that every dollar donated goes directly into production value. Craft Services, Equipment, Crew, Locations and Post P


From start to finish of the pre-production phase to production to post, you will be making this film happen. And it will be an incredible story.

REWARDS
Also, we have some great rewards.  In addition to posters, digital downloads, you can own some of the coolest parts of the film: signed script, space suit, helmets - it's all up for grabs.  In addition, if you're interested in some of the unusual technical aspects of the film, we're offering consultation.

Tech
We are excited to shoot RAW on the Black Magic Cinema Camera Anamorphic Lenses 

Anamorphic Lenses provide a wide cinematic aspect ratio that delivers great optics at the highest quality. 

POST
Post production will include minor special effects that help build Karen's character and as well as the color grading that will additionally push the look and style of the film. 


Custom Props & Wardrobe  

We have already begun the design. Custom-made props and costume will give SPUNKFLICKER a distinctive anime space look. 

Risk and challenges
Filmmaking always comes with many risks and challenges particular to each project. For this one it includes things like working with kid actors on a tight schedule, and getting a whole bunch of different people's schedule's lined up to shoot on a particular week. But this is what we do and in fact we've never been so ready. Our experience in both narrative and commercial filmmaking has prepared us. And of course, there will be unforeseen obstacles, but that's par for the course and we're ready to take it all on.

story:
YOU CAN HELP TO GIVE WAR VETERANS WITH BRAIN INJURY AND POST TRAUMATIC STRESS DISORDER AND THEIR FAMILIES A LIFE BACK!

Hello, we are a team of five at the CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK in Orlando, Florida. 

The goal of this fundraiser is to rescue as many at-risk and injured veterans as possible in order to restore wholeness to their lives. Effective biological repair treatments therapies like Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy will be made FOR FREE AVAILABLE for treatment of veterans who suffer from trauma brain injury and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), if you help us to succeed !

We think that goal is worth the effort, please help our subdivision the Veterans Trauma Support Network  in the battle for veterans with Brain Injuries (BI) and Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). 

Think about, these patients are totally "cought up" by their brain disorder, which acts like a mental prison, and you and me we can help them to "get back to normal"! 

Our goal here is to create treatment funds to provide FREE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) to War Veterans with Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder), as  HBOT is one of the proven "Better Care" solutions to heal INVISIBLE WOUNDS like TBI and PTDS. Think about helping thousands of Wounded War Veterans and their families getting a live back, yeep !

ABOUT CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK & VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK

The Veterans Trauma Support Network (VTSN) is a tax-exempt not-for-profit (501c3) Florida based organization established to generate and accept tax-exempt monetary and equipment donations to provide veterans with brain injuries with free primarily neurological hyperbaric therapy and other alternative forms of trauma therapy. 

We are active under the umbrella of CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK who is constantly providing services and therapy to families in trauma and to service men and women living with the invisible wounds of war including combat-related stress, major depression, and post-traumatic stress disorder. 

Initially searching for ways to help more families we have discovered effective methods to help trauma survivors. Our main method to assist anyone affected by trauma which changed our organization forever is called Rapid Resolution Therapy  (RRT). We have worked with children, parents, veterans, first responders and childhood abuse survivors with remarkable life changing results, as well as provided many therapy services for trauma patients in need. You can go here for more information on RRT...http://www.crisisreliefnetwork.org/programs.html

The combination of RRT and Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) for treatment of War Veteran patients with Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder) seems to be one of the BEST solutions to heal INVISIBLE WOUNDS like TBI and PTDS without having to many side effects like from heavy impact medications. 

Crisis Relief Network is approved as non-profit organization by the IRS as 501 (c)(3) tax exempt organization incorporated in Florida and is operating several division organizations under the same tax ID, like the Veterans Trauma Support Network and other sub organizations. All our divisions operate under the same umbrella of CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK. 


PLEASE HELP TO WIN THE BATTLE FOR BETTER VETERANS HEALTH CARE !

Support FREE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for Brain Injury Veterans...FINALLY the Answer to treating Wounded Warrior Brain Injury and PTSD Challenges ! 

Come and join our movement where we address the intense distress our returning veteran’s experience. Many of these brave men and women have been repeatedly exposed to traumatic events and life-threatening situations on multiple deployments to combat zones and suffer Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI). They return home to their families and now have these health issues to deal with.

"There are many different treatments for veterans with PTSD and TBI although research shows that many veterans drop out of traditional therapeutic treatments because the process of recounting traumatic events is emotionally taxing. They often fail to continue drug treatments due to the drugs side effects along with the potential for addiction."  (From the Mayoclinic)

Why we are here…

According to The Mayo Clinic (www.mayoclinic.org) the FDA approved drugs for PTSD, such as anti-anxiety medication, can relieve severe anxiety and related problems  for a short time, although because of the potential for abuse, they are not usually taken long term. They also list the FDA approved medications for insomnia and nightmares as well as approved antidepressants as solutions. We feel in some situations drugs can be helpful short term. The goal is to eventually be able to function without drugs and without the need for prolonged psychotherapy, living as close to how our veteran’s felt before their deployment in a natural state of calm and good health.


Many war veterans without hope for recovery are at risk for suicide. There is clearly an urgent need to provide alternate methods of helping our returning veterans reclaim their lives and you can now help to provide these veterans and their families with alternative relief based on the study approved Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy, which is currently a way to heal brain injury patients. 


Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) is unique to any other therapy used for brain injuries and neurological conditions: It is the only therapy known that can significantly raise the oxygen content in the brain and cause an adaptation for repair and quicker recovery for TBI patients such as war veterans. Neil Young of The Daily News wrote an article about Marine Corps. Lt. Col. (RET) Alan Burghard, a bronze star and Purple Heart recipient, is quoted as contributing his TBI improvement to Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy. It is stories like this that bring hope to us in making this available to more veterans.

Medication affects cognitive abilities. When tissue is injured, it requires even more oxygen to survive. Hyperbaric oxygen therapy increases the amount of oxygen brain blood can carry. An increase in blood oxygen temporarily restores normal levels of blood gases and tissue function to promote healing and fight infection.

In a hyperbaric oxygen therapy room, the air pressure is raised up to three times higher than normal air pressure. Under these conditions, your lungs can gather up to three times more oxygen than would be possible breathing pure oxygen at normal air pressure.

Blood carries this oxygen throughout your body, stimulating the release of substances called growth factors and stem cells, which promote healing.

And so the brain gets a chance to heal and re-establish some of those processes.

                                       

FINALLY the Answer to Wounded Warrior Brain Injury and PTSD Challenges !

Neurological Injuries are conditions where the brain has developed normally and then has had some type of trauma, whether it is physical such as (TBI) or physiological such as a (stroke). One of the most important applications has got to be immediate HBOT to help recover viable brain tissue that is compromised and minimally functioning with low oxygen content. This therapy has proven effectiveness and should now be considered as a primary treatment option in conjunction with other primary treatments, but insurance providers still don’t cover the costs for this treatment.

The evidence is overwhelming what the chamber has done for TBI. It is extremely unfortunate so far, that insurance does not cover this. 

"There are case history’s of people who were destined to be in a vegetative state for the rest of their life, that now are walking, talking, laughing and joking. They have a life. And – this is case after case after case."                           Don Wood, Founder Veterans Trauma Support Network, Florida

At Hyperbaric clinics in the USA thousands of patients get helped with these ailments, some just needing moderate support and others who were in very acute or critical conditions. But the treatment is normally expensive.

"HBOT for veterans would save the federal government money, since it would no longer need to pay for pharmaceuticals for the rest of their lives. It's a disgrace how the United States mistreat our veterans. It makes me ashamed to call myself an American knowing that there is much, much more that we could & SHOULD be doing. It breaks my heart."                                                                   From a licensed nurse  

FDA

HBOT was tested and further developed by the US military after World War I. Today, nearly every hospital owns a hyperbaric oxygen chamber. Most of these sit empty and unused!

The FDA has approved already several treatments based on HBOT, but not for all kinds of diseases like cancer, multiple-sclerosis, TBI, etc.  Therefore insurance providers still are not forced to pay for the more expensive HBOT treatments.  Veterans are suffering in the mean time. Time is of the essence with brain injuries, the longer they are left without treatment the more suffering continues. The hope is that the FDA will at some point in the near future accept HBOT and get it through the approval process. There are many people working towards this goal, although again, many men and women are suffering while the process unfolds.

HELP US TO BRING HBOT TO TBI AND PTSD WAR VETERANS RIGHT NOW !

SUPPORTERS OF HBOT

The White House has also recognized the importance of HBOT brain research as beneficial to the health of the men and women who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan. “The mental health challenges many of our troops face once they return home are very important” Michelle Obama said recently from a podium in Richmond, while launching a new program to help the troops coming home from war by supporting veterans with traumatic brain injuries.


FOTO CREDIT: First Lady Michelle Obama and Second Lady Jill Biden’s 2012 “Joining Forces” initiative to support and medically treat the nation’s veterans is spanning medical schools nationwide around service members, veterans, and their families to support them through wellness, education, and employment opportunities. Especially the offering of alternative health treatments for PTSD and TBI with Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) has been discussed widely during campaign kick off. Foto credit  http://www.whitehouse.gov/joiningforces/issues/wellness

DISCLAIMER: VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK AND CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK IS NOT RELATED TO ANY GOVERNMENT CAMPAIGNS AND IS THE SOLE CAMPAIGN ADMINISTRATOR FOR THIS FUNDRAISING PROJECT.   


How We Help Hospitals, Institutions, and/ or Medical Facilities

Every TBI or PTSD patient should have the possibility to enjoy HBOT treatment and we know that working with hospitals is the best way to make this great treatment as useful as possible. Patients with Brain Injury will be better cared for and will have better outcomes just like in many other medical fields as well, where healthcare improvement took place.

You can be one the first HOSPITAL EARLY ADOPTER and show the world you care about reducing BI and PTSD and veterans suicide mortality through BHOT. We would also love if you would sign up to be a full participant in one of our upcoming clinical trials. To do so, please send us an email to bettercareforvets@gmail.com , so we can contact you and discuss all details. 

If you are a Foundation or Non-Profit Organization or seeking Sponsorship

In partnership with the VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK our work seeks charitable contributions from private and institutional entities to fund this important ongoing effort. Philanthropic and humanitarian oriented individuals and organizations are encouraged to participate with us and our state-of-the-art medical research on HBOT. 

How can we help Physicians and other partners?

We know our idea can inspire many physicians, partners and collaborative organizations to get involved. We have been fortunate to have gotten this far with the help of such organizations. We know that many of you can imagine how we can help your patients, practice or company in other ways. Please reach out to us and tell us what you are thinking or post a comment here on INDIEGOGO and let’s start the discussion.

Want to talk about becoming an adviser or investor?

For accredited investors and advisers that can help, please take the change and let’s talk.  There is no implied or explicit offering made herein, just a conversation over coffee. 

What We Need & What You Get

Phase 1 Partnership

As HBOT treatment follows already standardized recognized treatment procedures with authorized treatment modalities, and brain injury and PTSD are already approved medical conditions requiring treatments, all can be managed accordingly.

The VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK has partnered with...                           The Total Family Healthcare & Wellness Centers in Clermont, Florida which is a small family practice group that is dedicated to providing compassionate care and personalized family medicine for patients from six years old to mature adults. Doctors at Total Family Healthcare truly care about the patient’s health and well-being and believe in total wellness and preventative medicine. If you or a loved one are addicted to alcohol or prescription pain pills, substance abuse help with medically-assisted therapy is offered, as well as Vitamins & Supplements advice. The practice offers a warm and friendly office environment with doctors and staff who know you by name and who are responsive to your physical and emotional health concerns. 

                                                                                                            Cara L. Jakob, MD 

Dr. Jakob, a board certified family physician has enjoyed medical education degrees from University of Connecticut, Drexel University School of Medicine in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Tallahassee Memorial Regional Medical Center. What makes Dr. Jakob’s practice unique is her approach to medicine. At Total Family Healthcare, disease prevention and patient quality of life are the cornerstones of her practice.

This attributes make her the ideal partner to introduce Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy at her practice under the partnership with the VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK to patients. Her practice number one goal is to help patients achieve and maintain good health and well-being by providing comprehensive primary care, preventative care and wellness services.

All doctors and staff of the Total Family Healthcare & Wellness Centers strongly believe in total wellness and preventative medicine. To ensure the accuracy and privacy of health information, the practice utilizes fully electronic medical records. For more information www.totalfamilyhealthcare.com

The partnership will ensure that under the guidance of Dr. Jakob…

Trained and experienced personnel will converse with the veteran patient and caregiver prior to any HBOT treatment to ensure the patient is making adequate progress anticipated under a specified treatment protocol,

Validation will be applied, that any HBOT treatment given is in accordance with the patient’s current treatment protocol,

Protocols will make sure, that during the treatment time all is proceeding smoothly for the HBOT patient.

All of the patient’s treatment record will be filed appropriately, validating the date of HBOT treatment, the protocol followed and the duration of HBOT treatment. The partnership will also ensure, that all HBOT equipment will be validated at delivery, verify testing, and to conduct appropriate inspections, under international and national HBOT recognized protocols. 


How We Will Spend Your Contributions

All funds will help to acquire ONE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy System to equip our medical facilitation partner with ONE HBOT Chamber. Expenses are planned for therapy readiness, operational expenses, HBOT System hardware and software and some office equipment. Also some interior improvement has to be conducted within the 3,000 square feet building. Total use of proceeds has added up to $55,000 to start operations and WE CAN START to provide FREE HBOT to TBI and PTSD veteran patients today !


Phase 2 Partnership

We are working also with other dedicated Medics in Florida to start operations and who want to engage with us and provide services to veterans for FREE HBOT, as soon as enough funds are available. We are planning to expand nationwide too, as many are in need of HBOT all over the country.


DONOR REWARDS

SUPPORTER REWARD 1 - $25 donation

YOU CAN SECURE A SPOT FOR YOUR INJURED FRIEND: If you love the idea of transforming healthcare you can make HBOT treatment for war veterans with TBI or PTSD a reality. By supporting HBOT you will receive your very own spot in the Hall of Fame on our website after the fundraiser campaign. See more at: http://www.bettercareforvets.com

Also you can provide one war veteran with the opportunity to be on our list of FREE HBOT patients. CLAIM HIS/HER SPOT by providing us his/her name and address, and we will contact your patient friend and tell him/her all about the HBOT treatment opportunity. Please note: It is still up to the patient, whether he/she wants to take FREE HBOT, plus for now we only provide HBOT in Florida, but we are considering to open also other locations nationwide to serve all TBI and  PTSD veterans in need. In any case he/she will appreciate your caring, that’s for sure, plus in any case you help the HBOT health movement get going!

SUPPORTER REWARD 2 - $50 donation

Receive REWARD 1 plus...

 

VTSN FEATURING ACTOR ASHLEIGH ANN WOOD LIMITED EDITION 2015             BTI & PTSD AWARENESS CALENDAR

Are you tired of waiting until the last minute to pick up a wall calendar or desk calendar for the upcoming year? You’re certainly not alone, we’ve got you covered. Our 2015 VTSN calendar with participation of Actor ASHLEIGH ANN WOOD  lets you get a calendar that will not only help you stay organized and on time during the year, but features images, photographs and quotes from her as LIMITED EDITION 2015.

Her highlights of elegant, funny, but also mindful quotes and pictures are entertaining and remind us on how live can be in all its facets. Need an uplifting smile on your face, this calendar will do the trick, while being mild and family friendly. This calendar is ready to take you through the end of 2015. If you know someone who could benefit from a good dose of entertaining quotes, give them one of these as a gift, but don’t forget to donate and pick up one for your own home!

REWARD 3 - $100 donation SPONSOR

Get REWARD 1 and 2 plus a $500 value coupon book plus 501 C3 donation receipt for your tax form.

We are excited and take pride to bring you the highest coupon booklet in the nation available, which has helped thousands of community organizations raise millions of dollars to meet their fundraising needs, while YOU can use the book just once or twice and it pays for itself. Enjoy! The folks from Enjoy the City, Inc. (ETC) produce the absolute best coupon books in the nation. 

Plus you get a 501 C3 donation receipt for your tax.

REWARD 4 - $500 donation SPONSOR


You receive REWARD 1, 2 and 3 and we say THANK YOU with one Entertainment Event Gift Card for 2 person in your town of joice (Retail value $40). Just send us your location choice by email to: bettercareforvets@gmail.com

We’ll also make sure your Founding Sponsor status is clearly shown on our website SPONSOR Hall of Fame, along with a logo and link to your person, company or website - See more at: www.bettercareforvets.com

Plus you will receive a 501 (C.3) donation receipt for your tax forms.

REWARD 5 - $1,000 donation PLATINUM SPONSOR

REWARD 1, 2, 3 and 4 plus Don Wood, our Founder will jump on a call to thank you and hear your thoughts on how we can make our veterans healthcare cause even better! Plus you will receive a 501 (C.3) donation receipt for your tax forms.

REWARD 6 - $5,000 donation GOLD SPONSOR

REWARD 1, 2, 3, 4 plus we will offer you if you like a seat on our Advisory Board of our Non Profit Organization.

Don Wood, our Founder will welcome you and discuss all details with you, so you can become the valuable Advisory Board Member, you may always wanted to be; as this is truly the most rewarding best value, which is to create true health care improvement for our society. Welcome in the club !

Plus you will receive a 501 (C.3) donation receipt for your tax forms.

When will I receive my perk? 

All perks, including THE LIMITED EDITION CALENDAR 2015 will be sent out after the campaign closes. We can guarantee that with our name. We are focusing on shipping out calendars immediately after the campaign.

The Impact

So, whether you know about the problem equation around HBOT from your profession, or you lost somebody, or you know somebody who is facing currently acute challenges with urinary catheterization, this is your call.

If you support our cause, you will really help and actually enable everybody within the healthcare community to provide great relief and “Better Standard of Care” for the many who are facing BI and PTSD on a daily basis, plus you will be proud of yourself, as you are participating in one of the most positive healthcare performance improvement changes of our decade.

Your name will be associated next to the ones, who’s name is associated with innovative value creation. We see us as value provider and drivers of positive healthcare improvement, as this is what our healthcare system needs most.

Your contribution will allocate funding exactly where it is needed most. As time is of the essence, if we do not treat BI and PTSD matters and fatal suicide rates in the right manner with more adequate medical treatment, our society will continue to have serious health care cost problems. Every dollar accounts!

Other Ways You Can Help

The VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK is bringing HBOT in front of the U.S. Congress. Please support also our PETITION to U.S. Congress...

We pledge that the FDA stops limiting treatment protocols that have not had reports of harming patients. Also to remove approval for drugs that have had reports of harming patients. Please FDA do your job right!

The recently approved bill in the Oklahoma Legislature will make hyperbaric oxygen therapy available for free to any Oklahoma veteran who has been diagnosed with traumatic brain injury and received a prescription for the treatment through the Oklahoma State University Center for Health Sciences. Senate Bill 1604 passed unanimously out of the Senate. It now heads to the House.

We are following this trend and have enacted a PETITION to U.S. Congress for mandating HBOT for TBI and PTSD as you can see below. You can sign up or follow our ongoing petition movement here below. 

LINK TO THE BETTER CARE FOR VETS PETITION

"To provide a vehicle to turn charitable contributions into meaningful healing activities for those needy veterans who may not be able otherwise to afford medical technologies, equipment, and treatments is a reasonable cause. In order to fulfill our intended mission to help others, this non profit must acquire the monetary resources to purchase and administer works to the fullest social benefit. 

As founders we are particularly aware of the need to help our returning soldiers who are Wounded Warriors, Wounded Airmen, the Disabled Veterans National Foundation, Disabled American Veterans, and the National Association of American Veterans, as well as accident victims, burn victims, stroke victims, and recovering surgery patients. Doctors Without Borders, the United Spinal Association, and other caregiving and support agencies also will benefit from our work."

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION !

Don Wood

Founder of CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK and 

VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK 

www.crisisreliefnetwork.org

email: bettercareforvets@gmail.com


CAMPAIGN TEAM MEMBERS

DON WOOD 

Founder CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK & VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK

DON WOOD (right)

Don Wood is the founder of the Crisis Relief Network & Veterans Trauma Support Network in Orlando, Florida. As the driving force for supporting families in trauma, Don is practicing non profit work already since 1993. He has founded also other very successful non profit organizations like Child Watch of North America and the Childhood Abuse and Trauma Foundation. Don has studied Clinical Psychology at Florida Christian University and has enjoyed certifications as a clinical hypnotherapist. Further training with Dr. Jon Connelly in Rapid Resolution Therapy has allowed him to reach out to many more people in need of assistance. The skills he has acquired have been instrumental in helping survivors of abuse and trauma heal more quickly. Don lives with his wife and children in Windermere, Florida.         For more information about the life achievement of Don Wood, please go to...

www.crisisreliefnetwork.org 

www.childwatch.org 

www.veteranstraumasupportnetwork.org

BRIDGET WOOD

Bridget was responsible for the organization adding in therapy services as changing of its mission. Now the organization operates as Crisis Relief Network and offers services to veterans, childhood and abuse survivors and families dealing with health or trauma related issues. Bridget has completed over 500 hours of training and is certified as a clinic hynotherapist. In addition, she has trained for the past five years in Rapid Resolution Therapy.

Bridget married her husband Don at the age of 19 and raised three children while at the same time running several family owned businesses. In 1992, Bridget and her family moved to Florida and started a non-profit missing child organization called Child Watch of North America. While working side by side with her husband, Bridget has worked at Child Watch of North America and has helped to attract national partnerships with Shell Oil, Texaco, AT&T, Toys R Us, Pizza Hut, Continental Airlines, KB Toys and Epson to the non profit organization. Bridget and her family have been featured on CBS 48 Hours featuring a five-year abduction case they solved. Through their efforts, Child Watch has assisted in the rescue of over 260 missing children.

ALEXANDER T. GIMON, Ph.D.

Dr. Gimon is a licensed psychologist and neuropsychologist in the State of Florida. He has more than 40 years of experience in private practice, after teaching and working on research teams in numerous universities in Massachusetts, Puerto Rico, and Florida. He has worked in all areas of evaluating and treating the learning disabled, brain injured, and with patients suffering from all manner of psychological and neuropsychological problems. Dr. Gimon is certified as an expert by many courts in the area of closed head injuries, and other psychological and neuropsychological injuries and pain management, as well as disability and vocational evaluations. He specializes in working with the non-verbal evaluations of children and severely injured patients, and in assisting caregivers in therapeutic treatment. However, he works with patients of all ages and abilities, as well as with married couples and families. He also works as a sports psychologist assisting both professional and Olympic athletes with performance anxiety and injury recovery. Dr. Gimon is bilingual, and conducts evaluations and therapy in both Spanish and English. For more information about Dr. Gimon please click here... http://www.drgimon.com/biography.htm

WILLIAM S. MAXFIELD - M.D., F.A.C.N.M.

As member of the task force that has developed an international protocol for use of HBOT in acute stroke, Dr. Maxfield has a special interest in the use of HBOT for central nervous system diseases. He also initiated the use of HBOT for ataxia-telangectasia. Recently, Dr. Maxfield was also a member of the ethics task force in hyperbaric medicine.

During his service with the navy, Dr. Maxfield worked on the development of many nuclear medicine procedures that are routine today, including more than 1,000 positron brain scans. As a member of the Plutonium Decontamination Team, Dr. Maxfield was introduced to hyperbaric chambers and the field of hyperbaric medicine.

Upon becoming board certified by the American Board of Radiology in December 1961 with a medallion in Nuclear Medicine, he was promoted to Assistant Professor at Johns Hopkins.

Dr. Maxfield is the author of 38 scientific publications, 2 short publications, 12 abstracts,  9 scientific exhibits and a video tape. His 45 years of clinical practice and research including 19 years of clinical hyperbaric medicine provide him a broad base of knowledge. His interest in clinical hyperbaric medicine resurfaced in the mid-1970’s when he searched for assistance for his father-in-law who had developed speech and balance problems. When four top neurological centers could provide no specific diagnosis or treatment, he took his father-in-law to Dr. Richard Neubauer’s center in Lauderdale-by-the-Sea, Florida, for hyperbaric oxygen treatment. The HBOT gave his father-in-law more than four years of independent life.

Dr. Maxfield has extensive experience in treatment of stroke, multiple sclerosis, brain trauma, cerebral palsy and congenital problems such as ataxia-telangectasia as well as many other diseases that are treated with HBOT. Dr. Maxfield’s experience in imaging and hyperbaric medicine provide a unique background for his work in developing protocols to diagnose and treat conditions that may benefit from hyperbaric oxygen therapy.

Dr. Maxfield comes from a pioneering medical family. He was born in Waco, Texas and grew up in Dallas, Texas, receiving a BA in psychology from Southern Methodist University. He was the fourth member of his family to receive an M.D. degree from Baylor University College of Medicine, Houston, Texas.

Dr. Maxfield’s father James R. Maxfield Sr. M.D., in 1903, had the first x-ray unit in Texas for his practice of family and industrial medicine in Grand Saline, Texas. This was only seven years after Roentgen discovered the x-ray. His brothers, James R. Maxfield Jr., M.D. and Jack G.S. Maxfield M.D., were pioneers in the fields of nuclear medicine, radiation oncology, and clinical hyperbaric medicine.

The Maxfield Clinic-Hospital in Dallas, Texas was one of the first institutions licensed by the Atomic Energy Commission to use radioactive isotopes in clinical medicine and research. In 1955,  the Maxfield Clinic-Hospital installed the third cobalt treatment unit in the USA. Dr. Maxfield and his brothers developed the techniques of treating bone metastasis with radioactive Phosphorus (P32) plus testosterone. They were also co-developers of the technique of implanting radioactive seeds encased in nylon tubes, a technique which is used increasingly today to treat various types of cancer. In 1978 a clinical hyperbaric oxygen therapy program was started at the Maxfield Clinic-Hospital.

Dr. Maxfield and his brothers were founders of the American College of Hyperbaric Medicine and the American Board of Hyperbaric Medicine. Previously they founded the American College of Nuclear Medicine and were charter members and co-founders of the Southwestern Chapter of the Society of Nuclear Medicine. After serving as President of the American College of Nuclear Medicine, Dr. Maxfield was elected a Fellow of the American College of Nuclear Medicine.

When he entered active duty with the US Navy in August 1956, he was assigned to the US Navy Hospital, Chelsea, Massachusetts to establish the hospital’s nuclear medicine laboratory because of his experience in nuclear medicine and radiology. He was then transferred to the US Navy Hospital in Bethesda, Maryland where he was chief of the Nuclear Medicine Section of the Department of Radiology and Instructor in Nuclear Medicine at the US Navy Medical School. While at Bethesda Navy Hospital, Dr. Maxfield was part of the USA delegation to the Second International Atoms for Peace Conference in Geneva, Switzerland. At the meeting, the Navy team demonstrated the production and utilization of short half-life radioactive isotopes

CERTIFICATION

American Board of Radiology since 1961, Radiology with Nuclear Medicine Medallion. American Board of Nuclear Medicine since 1973, American Board of Hyperbaric Medicine Founding Member. 

ACTIVE MEDICAL LICENSES

Florida 3/6/70 MEOO15266 By examination, current

Texas 8/14/54 C4442 By examination, current

MILITARY SERVICE

ACTIVE DUTY: U.S. Navy 8/30/56 - 7/6/59; Chief, Radioisotope Laboratory, U.S. Navy Hospital, Chelsea, MA; Chief, Radioisotope Laboratory, U.S. Navy Hospital, Bethesda, MD. RESERVE DUTY: 1959-64, Medical Officer destroyer escort squadron, Washington, D.C.

For more information on Dr. Maxfield please go to...

http://www.hyperbaric-care.com

CARA L. JAKOB, MD 

     

Dr. Jakob is a board certified family physician who has enjoyed medical education degrees from University of Connecticut, Drexel University School of Medicine in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Tallahassee Memorial Regional Medical Center. At Total Family Healthcare, disease prevention and patient quality of life are the cornerstones of her practice. What makes Dr. Jakob’s practice unique is her approach to medicine and her dedication to help patients in need of "Better Care" Treatments like Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for war veterans with brain injury and post traumatic stress dissorder. For more information on Total Family Healthcare go to... www.totalfamilyhealthcare.com

Dr. KRISTY KOTTWITZ “Dr. K” - CHIROPRACTOR

A New Yorker at heart, Kristy grew up in a beautiful town nestled in the Finger Lakes region of Upstate New York and attended the State University of New York at Buffalo where she earned a Bachelor of Science in Nutrition Sciences, and supported the Blue and White as a Cheerleader….GO BULLS!!! As a chiropractic patient of many years, she decided to pursue a vision of all natural healthcare and went on to study at the prestigious Palmer College of Chiropractic Florida, where she obtained a Doctor of Chiropractic Degree. After the completion of all four examinations given by the National Board of Chiropractic Examiners as well as the Florida State Chiropractic Board Exam, Kristy moved to the greater Orlando area in 2004, where she has been practicing and living the Chiropractic lifestyle ever since.

Kristy also enjoys participating in the Veterans Trauma Support Network HBOT movement to provide facilitation for FREE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for war veterans with brain injury and PTSD within her practice in Altamonte Springs, Florida. For more information on Kristy and her practice, please go to... 

http://www.balancedbackbody.com/

BRANDON WOOD

Brandon has worked since 1993 as one of the Founders at Child Watch of North America with the main focus of trying to prevent abductions through the KidGuard Safety Program, providing free safety rules, picture id cards and fingerprints to children and their parents. Child Watch then started including investigating child abductions and later developed the Abduction Response Team to assist law enforcement in the hours after a stranger abduction. To date Child Watch of North America has become integrated into CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK, where Brendon actively participates as Marketing and Outreach professional to drive fundraising for projects in need of funding. He has participated successfully in the rescue of 189 missing children. Brandon has also a high sense for environmental protection, which he has manifested within several Renewable Energy Development business projects with focus on Residential and Commercial Energy Audits, Natural Gas capture, International Renewable Power projects and the development of solar, geothermal and other renewable energy strategies. For more information on Brendon Wood go to... www.myenergygeek.com 

ASHLEIGH WOOD

Ashleigh Ann Wood was born in Toronto, Canada. She is an actress, known for acting in CSI Miami, Bloodknot (1995), Saint Henry (2004),  Grease, Tom Saywer and many other movies and NBC, ABC TV series. Ashleigh is the daughter of Don Wood, the Founder of the CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK and VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK. Within her busy schedule Ashleigh participates actively within all the non-profit-organizational campaign management. For more information about Ashleigh, please go to... http://ashleighannwood.com

ROBERT JASPER

Consultant & Crowdfunding Campaign Manager

Robert Jasper is the operational campaign manager for this important not-for-profit crowdfunding project. As business consultant working many years in the medical field, he understands the needs for "Better Standards of Care" and he supports this project during the entire campaign with operational management. For more information on Robert Jasper, please go to:  www.artofqualityconsulting.com
story_txt:
YOU CAN HELP TO GIVE WAR VETERANS WITH
BRAIN INJURY AND POST TRAUMATIC STRESS DISORDER AND THEIR FAMILIES A LIFE BACK!

Hello, we are a team of five at the CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK in Orlando, Florida. 

The goal of this fundraiser is to rescue as many at-risk and
injured veterans as possible in order to restore wholeness to their lives. Effective biological repair
treatments therapies like Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy will be made FOR FREE AVAILABLE for
treatment of veterans who suffer from trauma brain injury and
posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), if you help us to succeed !
We think that goal is worth the effort, please help our subdivision the Veterans Trauma Support Network  in the battle for veterans with Brain Injuries (BI) and Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). 
Think about, these patients are totally "cought up" by their brain disorder, which acts like a mental prison, and you and me we can help them to "get back to normal"! 

Our goal here is to create treatment funds to provide FREE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) to War Veterans with Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder), as  HBOT is one of the proven "Better Care" solutions to heal INVISIBLE WOUNDS like TBI and PTDS. Think about helping thousands of Wounded War Veterans and their families getting a live back, yeep !

ABOUT CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK & VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK



The Veterans Trauma Support Network (VTSN) is a
tax-exempt not-for-profit (501c3) Florida based organization established to generate and accept tax-exempt monetary and equipment donations
to provide veterans with brain injuries with free primarily neurological
hyperbaric therapy and other alternative forms of trauma therapy. 
We are active under the umbrella of CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK who is constantly providing services and therapy to families in trauma and to service men and women living with the invisible wounds of war including combat-related stress, major depression, and post-traumatic stress disorder. 
Initially searching for ways to help more families we have discovered effective methods to help trauma survivors. Our main method to assist anyone affected by trauma which changed our organization forever is called Rapid Resolution Therapy  (RRT). We have worked with children, parents, veterans, first responders and childhood abuse survivors with remarkable life changing results, as well as provided many therapy services for trauma patients in need. You can go here for more information on RRT...http://www.crisisreliefnetwork.org/programs.html
The combination of RRT and Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) for treatment of War Veteran patients with Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder) seems to be one of the BEST solutions to heal INVISIBLE WOUNDS like TBI and PTDS without having to many side effects like from heavy impact medications. 
Crisis Relief Network is approved as non-profit organization by the IRS as 501 (c)(3) tax exempt organization incorporated in Florida and is operating several division organizations under the same tax ID, like the Veterans Trauma Support Network and other sub organizations. All our divisions operate under the same umbrella of CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK. 



PLEASE HELP TO WIN THE BATTLE FOR BETTER VETERANS HEALTH CARE !


Support FREE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for Brain Injury Veterans...FINALLY the Answer to treating Wounded Warrior Brain Injury and PTSD Challenges ! 

Come and join our movement where we address the intense distress
our returning veteran’s experience. Many of these brave men and women have been
repeatedly exposed to traumatic events and life-threatening situations on
multiple deployments to combat zones and suffer Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
(PTSD) and Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI). They return home to their families and
now have these health issues to deal with.
"There are many different treatments for veterans with PTSD and TBI
although research shows that many veterans drop out of traditional therapeutic
treatments because the process of recounting traumatic events is emotionally
taxing. They often fail to continue drug treatments due to the drugs side
effects along with the potential for addiction."  (From the Mayoclinic)
Why we are here…


According to The Mayo Clinic (www.mayoclinic.org) the FDA approved
drugs for PTSD, such as anti-anxiety medication, can relieve severe anxiety and
related problems  for a short time, although because of the potential for
abuse, they are not usually taken long term. They also list the FDA approved
medications for insomnia and nightmares as well as approved antidepressants as
solutions. We feel in some situations drugs can be helpful short term. The goal
is to eventually be able to function without drugs and without the need for
prolonged psychotherapy, living as close to how our veteran’s felt before their
deployment in a natural state of calm and good health.

Many war veterans without hope for recovery are at risk for suicide. There is clearly an urgent need to provide alternate methods of
helping our returning veterans reclaim their lives and you can now help to
provide these veterans and their families with alternative relief based on the
study approved Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy, which is currently a way to heal
brain injury patients. 


Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) is unique to any other therapy
used for brain injuries and neurological conditions: It is the only therapy
known that can significantly raise the oxygen content in the brain and cause an
adaptation for repair and quicker recovery for TBI patients such as war
veterans. Neil Young of The Daily News wrote an article about Marine Corps. Lt.
Col. (RET) Alan Burghard, a bronze star and Purple Heart recipient, is quoted
as contributing his TBI improvement to Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy. It is stories
like this that bring hope to us in making this available to more veterans.


Medication affects cognitive abilities. When tissue is injured, it requires even more oxygen to survive. Hyperbaric oxygen therapy increases the amount of oxygen brain blood can carry. An increase in blood oxygen temporarily restores normal levels of blood gases and tissue function to promote healing and fight infection.
In a hyperbaric oxygen therapy room, the air pressure is raised up to three times higher than normal air pressure. Under these conditions, your lungs can gather up to three times more oxygen than would be possible breathing pure oxygen at normal air pressure.
Blood carries this oxygen throughout your body, stimulating the release of substances called growth factors and stem cells, which promote healing.
And so the brain gets a chance to heal and re-establish some of those processes.
                                       
FINALLY the Answer to Wounded Warrior Brain Injury and PTSD Challenges !
Neurological Injuries are conditions where the brain has developed
normally and then has had some type of trauma, whether it is physical such as
(TBI) or physiological such as a (stroke). One of the most important
applications has got to be immediate HBOT to help recover viable brain tissue
that is compromised and minimally functioning with low oxygen content. This
therapy has proven effectiveness and should now be considered as a primary
treatment option in conjunction with other primary treatments, but insurance
providers still don’t cover the costs for this treatment.

The evidence is overwhelming what the chamber has done for TBI. It is extremely unfortunate so far, that insurance does not cover this. 
"There are case history’s of people who were destined to be in a vegetative state for the rest of their life, that now are walking, talking, laughing and joking. They have a life. And – this is case after case after case."                           Don Wood, Founder Veterans Trauma Support Network, Florida
At Hyperbaric clinics in the USA thousands of patients get helped with these ailments, some just needing moderate support and others who were in very acute or critical conditions. But the treatment is normally expensive.
"HBOT for veterans would save the federal government money, since it would no longer need to pay for pharmaceuticals for the rest of their lives. It's a disgrace how the United States mistreat our veterans. It makes me ashamed to call myself an American knowing that there is much, much more that we could & SHOULD be doing. It breaks my heart."                                                                   From a licensed nurse  



FDA

HBOT was tested and further developed by the US military after World War I. Today, nearly every hospital owns a hyperbaric oxygen chamber. Most of these sit empty and unused!

The FDA has approved already several treatments based on HBOT, but
not for all kinds of diseases like cancer, multiple-sclerosis, TBI, etc.
 Therefore insurance providers still are not forced to pay for the more
expensive HBOT treatments.  Veterans are suffering in the mean time. Time
is of the essence with brain injuries, the longer they are left without
treatment the more suffering continues. The hope is that the FDA will at some
point in the near future accept HBOT and get it through the approval process.
There are many people working towards this goal, although again, many men and
women are suffering while the process unfolds.
HELP US TO BRING HBOT TO TBI AND PTSD WAR VETERANS RIGHT NOW !

SUPPORTERS OF HBOT
The White House has also recognized the importance of HBOT brain research as beneficial to the health of the men and women who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan. “The mental health challenges many of our troops face once they return home are very important” Michelle Obama said recently from a podium in Richmond, while launching a new program to help the troops coming home from war by supporting veterans with traumatic brain injuries.


FOTO CREDIT: First Lady Michelle Obama and Second
Lady Jill Biden’s 2012 “Joining Forces” initiative to support and medically
treat the nation’s veterans is spanning medical schools nationwide around
service members, veterans, and their families to support them through wellness,
education, and employment opportunities. Especially the offering of alternative
health treatments for PTSD and TBI with Hyperbaric
Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) has been discussed widely during campaign kick off. Foto
credit  http://www.whitehouse.gov/joiningforces/issues/wellness
DISCLAIMER: VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK AND CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK IS NOT RELATED TO ANY GOVERNMENT CAMPAIGNS AND IS THE SOLE CAMPAIGN ADMINISTRATOR FOR THIS FUNDRAISING PROJECT.   

How We Help
Hospitals, Institutions, and/ or Medical Facilities
Every TBI or PTSD patient should have the possibility to
enjoy HBOT treatment and we know that working with hospitals is the best way to
make this great treatment as useful as possible. Patients with Brain Injury will
be better cared for and will have better outcomes just like in many other
medical fields as well, where healthcare improvement took place. 
You can be one the first HOSPITAL EARLY ADOPTER and show the
world you care about reducing BI and PTSD and veterans suicide mortality
through BHOT. We would also love if you would sign up to be a full participant
in one of our upcoming clinical trials. To do so, please send us an email to bettercareforvets@gmail.com , so we can contact you and discuss all details. 
If you are a Foundation or Non-Profit Organization or
seeking Sponsorship
In partnership with the VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK our
work seeks charitable contributions from private and institutional entities to
fund this important ongoing effort. Philanthropic and humanitarian oriented
individuals and organizations are encouraged to participate with us and our state-of-the-art
medical research on HBOT. 
How can we help Physicians and other partners?
We know our idea can inspire many physicians, partners and
collaborative organizations to get involved. We have been fortunate to have
gotten this far with the help of such organizations. We know that many of you
can imagine how we can help your patients, practice or company in other ways.
Please reach out to us and tell us what you are thinking or post a comment here
on INDIEGOGO and let’s start the discussion.
Want to talk
about becoming an adviser or investor?
For accredited investors and advisers that can help, please
take the change and let’s talk.  There is no implied
or explicit offering made herein, just a conversation over coffee. 
What We Need & What You Get
 

Phase 1 Partnership

As HBOT treatment follows already standardized recognized
treatment procedures with authorized treatment modalities, and brain injury and
PTSD are already approved medical conditions requiring treatments, all can be
managed accordingly.



The VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK has partnered with...                           The Total Family Healthcare & Wellness Centers in
Clermont, Florida which is a small family practice group that is dedicated to
providing compassionate care and personalized family medicine for patients from
six years old to mature adults. Doctors at Total Family Healthcare truly care
about the patient’s health and well-being and believe in total wellness and
preventative medicine. If you or a loved one are addicted to alcohol or
prescription pain pills, substance abuse help with medically-assisted therapy
is offered, as well as Vitamins & Supplements advice. The practice offers a
warm and friendly office environment with doctors and staff who know you by
name and who are responsive to your physical and emotional health concerns. 
                                                                                                            Cara L. Jakob, MD 
Dr. Jakob, a board certified family physician has enjoyed
medical education degrees from University of Connecticut, Drexel University
School of Medicine in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Tallahassee Memorial
Regional Medical Center. What makes Dr. Jakob’s practice unique is her approach
to medicine. At Total Family Healthcare, disease prevention and patient quality
of life are the cornerstones of her practice.
This attributes make her the ideal partner to introduce Hyperbaric
Oxygen Therapy at her practice under the partnership with the VETERANS TRAUMA
SUPPORT NETWORK to patients. Her practice number one goal is to help patients
achieve and maintain good health and well-being by providing comprehensive
primary care, preventative care and wellness services. 
All doctors and staff of the Total Family Healthcare & Wellness Centers strongly believe in total wellness and
preventative medicine. To ensure the accuracy and privacy of health
information, the practice utilizes fully electronic medical records. For more information www.totalfamilyhealthcare.com
The partnership will ensure that under the guidance of Dr.
Jakob…
Trained and experienced personnel will converse with the veteran
patient and caregiver prior to any HBOT treatment to ensure the patient is
making adequate progress anticipated under a specified treatment protocol,
Validation will be applied, that any HBOT treatment given is
in accordance with the patient’s current treatment protocol,
Protocols will make sure, that during the treatment time all
is proceeding smoothly for the HBOT patient.
All of the patient’s treatment record will be filed appropriately,
validating the date of HBOT treatment, the protocol followed and the duration
of HBOT treatment. The partnership will also ensure, that all HBOT equipment
will be validated at delivery, verify testing, and to conduct appropriate
inspections, under international and national HBOT recognized protocols. 

How We Will Spend Your Contributions
All funds will help to acquire ONE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy System to equip our medical facilitation partner with ONE HBOT Chamber. Expenses are planned for therapy readiness, operational expenses, HBOT System hardware and software and some office equipment. Also some interior improvement has to be conducted within the 3,000 square feet building. Total use of proceeds has added up to $55,000 to start operations and WE CAN START to provide FREE HBOT to TBI and PTSD veteran patients today !

Phase 2 Partnership
We are working also with other dedicated Medics in Florida to start operations and who want to engage with us and provide services to veterans for FREE HBOT, as soon as enough funds are available. We are planning to expand nationwide too, as many are in need of HBOT all over the country.



DONOR REWARDS
SUPPORTER REWARD
1 - $25 donation


YOU CAN SECURE A SPOT FOR YOUR INJURED FRIEND: If you love the idea of transforming healthcare you can make HBOT treatment for war veterans with TBI or PTSD a reality. By supporting HBOT you will
receive your very own spot in the Hall of Fame on our website after the
fundraiser campaign. See more at: http://www.bettercareforvets.com
Also you can provide one war veteran with the opportunity to be
on our list of FREE HBOT patients. CLAIM HIS/HER SPOT by providing us his/her
name and address, and we will contact your patient friend and tell him/her all
about the HBOT treatment opportunity. Please note: It is still up to the
patient, whether he/she wants to take FREE HBOT, plus for now we only provide
HBOT in Florida, but we are considering to open also other locations nationwide
to serve all TBI and  PTSD veterans in
need. In any case he/she will appreciate your caring, that’s for sure, plus in
any case you help the HBOT health movement get going! 
SUPPORTER REWARD
2 - $50 donation
Receive REWARD 1 plus...
 
VTSN FEATURING ACTOR ASHLEIGH ANN WOOD LIMITED EDITION 2015             BTI & PTSD AWARENESS CALENDAR
Are you tired of waiting until the last minute to pick up a
wall calendar or desk calendar for the upcoming year? You’re certainly not
alone, we’ve got you covered. Our 2015 VTSN calendar with participation of Actor ASHLEIGH ANN WOOD  lets you get a
calendar that will not only help you stay organized and on time during the year,
but features images, photographs and quotes from her as LIMITED EDITION 2015. 
Her highlights of elegant, funny, but also mindful quotes and
pictures are entertaining and remind us on how live can be in all its facets.
Need an uplifting smile on your face, this calendar will do the trick, while
being mild and family friendly. This calendar is ready to take you through the end of 2015.
If you know someone who could benefit from a good dose of entertaining quotes,
give them one of these as a gift, but don’t forget to donate and pick up one
for your own home!


REWARD 3 - $100
donation SPONSOR


Get REWARD 1 and 2 plus a $500 value coupon book plus 501 C3 donation receipt for your tax form.



We are excited and take pride to bring you the highest coupon
booklet in the nation available, which has helped thousands of community
organizations raise millions of dollars to meet their fundraising needs, while
YOU can use the book just once or twice and it pays for itself. Enjoy! The
folks from Enjoy the City, Inc. (ETC) produce the absolute best coupon books in
the nation. 
Plus you get a 501 C3 donation receipt for your tax.
REWARD 4 - $500 donation SPONSOR

You receive REWARD 1, 2 and 3 and we say THANK YOU with one Entertainment Event Gift Card for 2
person in your town of joice (Retail value $40). Just send us your location
choice by email to: bettercareforvets@gmail.com
We’ll also make sure your Founding Sponsor status is clearly
shown on our website SPONSOR Hall of Fame, along with a logo and link to your person,
company or website - See more at: www.bettercareforvets.com
Plus you will receive a 501 (C.3) donation receipt for your
tax forms.
REWARD 5 -
$1,000 donation PLATINUM SPONSOR
REWARD 1, 2, 3 and 4 plus Don Wood, our Founder will jump on
a call to thank you and hear your thoughts on how we can make our veterans
healthcare cause even better! Plus you will receive a 501 (C.3) donation receipt for your tax forms.
REWARD 6 -
$5,000 donation GOLD SPONSOR
REWARD 1, 2, 3, 4 plus we will offer you if you like a seat on our Advisory Board
of our Non Profit Organization.
Don Wood, our Founder will welcome you and discuss all
details with you, so you can become the valuable Advisory Board Member, you may always
wanted to be; as this is truly the most rewarding best value, which is to
create true health care improvement for our society. Welcome in the club !
Plus you will receive a 501 (C.3) donation receipt for your tax forms.When will I receive my perk? 
All perks, including THE LIMITED EDITION CALENDAR 2015 will
