be sent out after the campaign closes. We can guarantee that with our name. We are focusing on shipping out calendars
immediately after the campaign.


The Impact


So, whether you know about the
problem equation around HBOT from your profession, or you lost somebody, or you
know somebody who is facing currently acute challenges with urinary
catheterization, this is your call. 
If you support our cause, you
will really help and actually enable everybody within the healthcare community
to provide great relief and “Better
Standard of Care” for the many who are facing BI and PTSD on a daily basis,
plus you will be proud of yourself, as you are participating in one of the most
positive healthcare performance improvement changes of our decade. 
Your name will be associated
next to the ones, who’s name is associated with innovative value creation. We
see us as value provider and drivers of positive healthcare improvement, as
this is what our healthcare system needs most.
Your contribution will
allocate funding exactly where it is needed most. As time is of the essence, if
we do not treat BI and PTSD matters and fatal suicide rates in the right manner
with more adequate medical treatment, our society will continue to have serious
health care cost problems. Every dollar accounts!
Other Ways You Can Help
 The VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK is bringing HBOT in front of the U.S. Congress. Please support also our PETITION to U.S. Congress...


We pledge that the FDA stops limiting treatment protocols that have not had reports of harming patients. Also to remove approval for drugs that have had reports of harming patients. Please FDA do your job right!
The recently approved bill in the Oklahoma Legislature will make hyperbaric oxygen therapy available for free to any Oklahoma veteran who has been diagnosed with traumatic brain injury and received a prescription for the treatment through the Oklahoma State University Center for Health Sciences. Senate Bill 1604 passed unanimously out of the Senate. It now heads to the House.
We are following this trend and have enacted a PETITION to U.S. Congress for mandating HBOT for TBI and PTSD as you can see below. You can sign up or follow our ongoing petition movement here below. 
LINK TO THE BETTER CARE FOR VETS PETITION




"To provide a vehicle to turn charitable contributions into meaningful healing activities for those needy veterans who may not be able otherwise to afford medical technologies, equipment, and treatments is a reasonable cause. In order to fulfill our intended mission to help others, this non profit must acquire the monetary resources to purchase and administer works to the fullest social benefit. 

As founders we are particularly aware of the need to help our returning soldiers who are Wounded Warriors, Wounded Airmen, the Disabled Veterans National Foundation, Disabled American Veterans, and the National Association of American Veterans, as well as accident victims, burn victims, stroke victims, and recovering surgery patients. Doctors Without Borders, the United Spinal Association, and other caregiving and support agencies also will benefit from our work."THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION !Don WoodFounder of CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK and VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK www.crisisreliefnetwork.orgemail: bettercareforvets@gmail.comCAMPAIGN TEAM MEMBERSDON WOOD Founder CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK & VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORKDON WOOD (right)Don Wood is the founder of the Crisis Relief Network & Veterans Trauma Support Network in Orlando, Florida. As the driving force for supporting families in trauma, Don is practicing non profit work already since 1993. He has founded also other very successful non profit organizations like Child Watch of North America and the Childhood Abuse and Trauma Foundation. Don has studied Clinical Psychology at Florida Christian University and has enjoyed certifications as a clinical hypnotherapist. Further training with Dr. Jon Connelly in Rapid Resolution Therapy has allowed him to reach out to many more people in need of assistance. The skills he has acquired have been instrumental in helping survivors of abuse and trauma heal more quickly. Don lives with his wife and children in Windermere, Florida.         For more information about the life achievement of Don Wood, please go to...www.crisisreliefnetwork.org www.childwatch.org www.veteranstraumasupportnetwork.orgBRIDGET WOODBridget was responsible for the organization adding in therapy services as changing of its mission. Now the organization operates as Crisis Relief Network and offers services to veterans, childhood and abuse survivors and families dealing with health or trauma related issues. Bridget has completed over 500 hours of training and is certified as a clinic hynotherapist. In addition, she has trained for the past five years in Rapid Resolution Therapy.Bridget married her husband Don at the age of 19 and raised three children while at the same time running several family owned businesses. In 1992, Bridget and her family moved to Florida and started a non-profit missing child organization called Child Watch of North America. While working side by side with her husband, Bridget has worked at Child Watch of North America and has helped to attract national partnerships with Shell Oil, Texaco, AT&T, Toys R Us, Pizza Hut, Continental Airlines, KB Toys and Epson to the non profit organization. Bridget and her family have been featured on CBS 48 Hours featuring a five-year abduction case they solved. Through their efforts, Child Watch has assisted in the rescue of over 260 missing children.ALEXANDER T. GIMON, Ph.D.Dr. Gimon is a licensed psychologist and neuropsychologist in the State of Florida. He has more than 40 years of experience in private practice, after teaching and working on research teams in numerous universities in Massachusetts, Puerto Rico, and Florida. He has worked in all areas of evaluating and treating the learning disabled, brain injured, and with patients suffering from all manner of psychological and neuropsychological problems. Dr. Gimon is certified as an expert by many courts in the area of closed head injuries, and other psychological and neuropsychological injuries and pain management, as well as disability and vocational evaluations. He specializes in working with the non-verbal evaluations of children and severely injured patients, and in assisting caregivers in therapeutic treatment. However, he works with patients of all ages and abilities, as well as with married couples and families. He also works as a sports psychologist assisting both professional and Olympic athletes with performance anxiety and injury recovery. Dr. Gimon is bilingual, and conducts evaluations and therapy in both Spanish and English. For more information about Dr. Gimon please click here... http://www.drgimon.com/biography.htmWILLIAM S. MAXFIELD - M.D., F.A.C.N.M.As member of the task force that has developed an international protocol for use of HBOT in acute stroke, Dr. Maxfield has a special interest in the use of HBOT for central nervous system diseases. He also initiated the use of HBOT for ataxia-telangectasia. Recently, Dr. Maxfield was also a member of the ethics task force in hyperbaric medicine.During his service with the navy, Dr. Maxfield worked on the development of many nuclear medicine procedures that are routine today, including more than 1,000 positron brain scans. As a member of the Plutonium Decontamination Team, Dr. Maxfield was introduced to hyperbaric chambers and the field of hyperbaric medicine.Upon becoming board certified by the American Board of Radiology in December 1961 with a medallion in Nuclear Medicine, he was promoted to Assistant Professor at Johns Hopkins.Dr. Maxfield is the author of 38 scientific publications, 2 short publications, 12 abstracts,  9 scientific exhibits and a video tape. His 45 years of clinical practice and research including 19 years of clinical hyperbaric medicine provide him a broad base of knowledge. His interest in clinical hyperbaric medicine resurfaced in the mid-1970’s when he searched for assistance for his father-in-law who had developed speech and balance problems. When four top neurological centers could provide no specific diagnosis or treatment, he took his father-in-law to Dr. Richard Neubauer’s center in Lauderdale-by-the-Sea, Florida, for hyperbaric oxygen treatment. The HBOT gave his father-in-law more than four years of independent life.Dr. Maxfield has extensive experience in treatment of stroke, multiple sclerosis, brain trauma, cerebral palsy and congenital problems such as ataxia-telangectasia as well as many other diseases that are treated with HBOT. Dr. Maxfield’s experience in imaging and hyperbaric medicine provide a unique background for his work in developing protocols to diagnose and treat conditions that may benefit from hyperbaric oxygen therapy.Dr. Maxfield comes from a pioneering medical family. He was born in Waco, Texas and grew up in Dallas, Texas, receiving a BA in psychology from Southern Methodist University. He was the fourth member of his family to receive an M.D. degree from Baylor University College of Medicine, Houston, Texas.Dr. Maxfield’s father James R. Maxfield Sr. M.D., in 1903, had the first x-ray unit in Texas for his practice of family and industrial medicine in Grand Saline, Texas. This was only seven years after Roentgen discovered the x-ray. His brothers, James R. Maxfield Jr., M.D. and Jack G.S. Maxfield M.D., were pioneers in the fields of nuclear medicine, radiation oncology, and clinical hyperbaric medicine.The Maxfield Clinic-Hospital in Dallas, Texas was one of the first institutions licensed by the Atomic Energy Commission to use radioactive isotopes in clinical medicine and research. In 1955,  the Maxfield Clinic-Hospital installed the third cobalt treatment unit in the USA. Dr. Maxfield and his brothers developed the techniques of treating bone metastasis with radioactive Phosphorus (P32) plus testosterone. They were also co-developers of the technique of implanting radioactive seeds encased in nylon tubes, a technique which is used increasingly today to treat various types of cancer. In 1978 a clinical hyperbaric oxygen therapy program was started at the Maxfield Clinic-Hospital.Dr. Maxfield and his brothers were founders of the American College of Hyperbaric Medicine and the American Board of Hyperbaric Medicine. Previously they founded the American College of Nuclear Medicine and were charter members and co-founders of the Southwestern Chapter of the Society of Nuclear Medicine. After serving as President of the American College of Nuclear Medicine, Dr. Maxfield was elected a Fellow of the American College of Nuclear Medicine.When he entered active duty with the US Navy in August 1956, he was assigned to the US Navy Hospital, Chelsea, Massachusetts to establish the hospital’s nuclear medicine laboratory because of his experience in nuclear medicine and radiology. He was then transferred to the US Navy Hospital in Bethesda, Maryland where he was chief of the Nuclear Medicine Section of the Department of Radiology and Instructor in Nuclear Medicine at the US Navy Medical School. While at Bethesda Navy Hospital, Dr. Maxfield was part of the USA delegation to the Second International Atoms for Peace Conference in Geneva, Switzerland. At the meeting, the Navy team demonstrated the production and utilization of short half-life radioactive isotopesCERTIFICATIONAmerican Board of Radiology since 1961, Radiology with Nuclear Medicine Medallion. American Board of Nuclear Medicine since 1973, American Board of Hyperbaric Medicine Founding Member. ACTIVE MEDICAL LICENSESFlorida 3/6/70 MEOO15266 By examination, currentTexas 8/14/54 C4442 By examination, currentMILITARY SERVICEACTIVE DUTY: U.S. Navy 8/30/56 - 7/6/59; Chief, Radioisotope Laboratory, U.S. Navy Hospital, Chelsea, MA; Chief, Radioisotope Laboratory, U.S. Navy Hospital, Bethesda, MD. RESERVE DUTY: 1959-64, Medical Officer destroyer escort squadron, Washington, D.C.For more information on Dr. Maxfield please go to...http://www.hyperbaric-care.comCARA L. JAKOB, MD      Dr. Jakob is a board certified family physician who has enjoyed medical education degrees from University of Connecticut, Drexel University School of Medicine in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Tallahassee Memorial Regional Medical Center. At Total Family Healthcare, disease prevention and patient quality of life are the cornerstones of her practice. What makes Dr. Jakob’s practice unique is her approach to medicine and her dedication to help patients in need of "Better Care" Treatments like Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for war veterans with brain injury and post traumatic stress dissorder. For more information on Total Family Healthcare go to... www.totalfamilyhealthcare.comDr. KRISTY KOTTWITZ “Dr. K” - CHIROPRACTORA New Yorker at heart, Kristy grew up in a beautiful town nestled in the Finger Lakes region of Upstate New York and attended the State University of New York at Buffalo where she earned a Bachelor of Science in Nutrition Sciences, and supported the Blue and White as a Cheerleader….GO BULLS!!! As a chiropractic patient of many years, she decided to pursue a vision of all natural healthcare and went on to study at the prestigious Palmer College of Chiropractic Florida, where she obtained a Doctor of Chiropractic Degree. After the completion of all four examinations given by the National Board of Chiropractic Examiners as well as the Florida State Chiropractic Board Exam, Kristy moved to the greater Orlando area in 2004, where she has been practicing and living the Chiropractic lifestyle ever since.Kristy also enjoys participating in the Veterans Trauma Support Network HBOT movement to provide facilitation for FREE Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy for war veterans with brain injury and PTSD within her practice in Altamonte Springs, Florida. For more information on Kristy and her practice, please go to... http://www.balancedbackbody.com/BRANDON WOODBrandon has worked since 1993 as one of the Founders at Child Watch of North America with the main focus of trying to prevent abductions through the KidGuard Safety Program, providing free safety rules, picture id cards and fingerprints to children and their parents. Child Watch then started including investigating child abductions and later developed the Abduction Response Team to assist law enforcement in the hours after a stranger abduction. To date Child Watch of North America has become integrated into CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK, where Brendon actively participates as Marketing and Outreach professional to drive fundraising for projects in need of funding. He has participated successfully in the rescue of 189 missing children. Brandon has also a high sense for environmental protection, which he has manifested within several Renewable Energy Development business projects with focus on Residential and Commercial Energy Audits, Natural Gas capture, International Renewable Power projects and the development of solar, geothermal and other renewable energy strategies. For more information on Brendon Wood go to... www.myenergygeek.com ASHLEIGH WOODAshleigh Ann Wood was born in Toronto, Canada. She is an actress, known for acting in CSI Miami, Bloodknot (1995), Saint Henry (2004),  Grease, Tom Saywer and many other movies and NBC, ABC TV series. Ashleigh is the daughter of Don Wood, the Founder of the CRISIS RELIEF NETWORK and VETERANS TRAUMA SUPPORT NETWORK. Within her busy schedule Ashleigh participates actively within all the non-profit-organizational campaign management. For more information about Ashleigh, please go to... http://ashleighannwood.comROBERT JASPERConsultant & Crowdfunding Campaign ManagerRobert Jasper is the operational campaign manager for this important not-for-profit crowdfunding project. As business consultant working many years in the medical field, he understands the needs for "Better Standards of Care" and he supports this project during the entire campaign with operational management. For more information on Robert Jasper, please go to:  www.artofqualityconsulting.com

story:
What is Old Baby?


Tolikaan, NM:

In the small New Mexico town of Tolikaan...

 ...the locals worship a strange folk hero they call “Old Baby.” 
America's Ancient Idols, a popular TV show dedicated to documenting and exploring the folk heroes and local legends that built America, sends a crew to explore and document this little known, but much adored, local folk hero.
As the crew digs deeper into the story of Old Baby and Tolikaan, they realize there is something unsettling about the town, the people, and the water. Old Baby might be something more sinister than they were expecting.


But it’s ok, it’s just a Movie… or is it?:

Old Baby is an unsettling mashup that flows in and out of a TV-style documentary set in a bizarre small-town run by a bumbling mayor, populated a plethora of local weirdos, strange customs, and an otherworldly occult nightmare like you have never seen - complete with a few commercial breaks from local chapters of the Church of the Black Nothingness, mattress stores, party lines for lonely people.

A little bit The Taking of Deborah Logan, a little bit Gummo, with a touch of Sam Raimi and John Carpenter - Old Baby will be a bizarre journey through absurdity and horror.  


Who would do such a thing?:

Hello, I am Adam Petke and I'm looking for help creating my next film, Old Baby.

I have a solid record of making highly innovative, quality, low-budget films. 
...Old Baby will be no exception.

Sandland: Summer’s Kiss (short 2010)

An short film about a family coping with their lives in an existential void, created with miniatures and puppets:

-"Most Original” and “Best Production Design” UCLA Festival of New and creative works
-“Best Animation” Shockfest,
-“Third Place of Festival” and “Best Sound Design”  at LA New Wave
-“Official Selection” Seattle Int. Film Festival
- “Official Selection” New Filmmakers LA
-“Official Selection” Lake Travis Film Festival 

Fat Rabbit (short 2014)

A short film about a couple struggling with ascension to the great beyond when the creature they summon from the ground is less than they were expecting: 

-"Official Selection" of H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival Los Angeles
-”Official Selection” of Best of the H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival Portland
-”Official Selection” of Fester: The Mindfuck Festival
-”Official Selection” of Los Angeles International Underground
-”Official Selection” of Another Hole in The Head
-”Official Selection” of Atlanta Underground Film Festival

Old Baby my second feature, the first being EXILE which was paid for out of pocket with production beginning in 2010. 


EXILE (feature 2014)

An isolated community has been controlled by an alien creature calling itself "The Angel." The children of this community reach an age where they must choose to become "blessed" like their parents, or "fall" and fend for themselves in the wastelands:

EXILE has been featured in a number of festivals.  It won “Audience Choice” at the 2014 H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival Portland (the first time in the festivals 19 years that the award had gone to a feature film) and “Best Feature” at Buried Alive Film Festival 2014. 

EXILE recently had its worldwide DVD and VOD release on April 7th, 2015 courtesy of Midnight Releasing.


This is what reviewers have to say about EXILE:

"Though crude and twisted EXILE is a fantastic little sci fi yarn juggling gore and horror with a skill I haven’t seen in a while." - Ain't it Cool News 
"This film is a testament to how small funds do not have to equal cheap quality." - Shattered Ravings
"Gruesome and thought provoking horror that was incredibly effective in all the best ways" - LA Horror.com
“Exile is testament to the fact that good movies can be made with small budgets and  is one of the best indie horror movies we’ve seen this decade” – Indie Horror Central.

Outside of my own projects I have also worked as a Production Designer and Special Effects Artist bringing out the blood and fears on films such as Hazard Jack:

Children of Sorrow starring Bill Oberst:



And the graphic Shock TIll you Drop Halloween special Short Film Candy:



This year I am more excited than ever for the opportunity to make Old Baby.


Dollhairs and Scents:

Indie horror films are hard work. Things get bloody. There is always a lot of screaming. And then you have to get people in front of the camera and then you have to keep those people happy and alive…


-Production Costs:

The Oscar nominated production company, Dirty Robber, has generously agreed to supply the production with $50,000 worth of great production gear, but equipment is nothing without the right people using it.


  • Camera dept:           $2000

  • Sound:                        $2000

  • G&E:                            $3000

  • Costume/Makeup: $2000

  • Prod. Design/Set:   $3000

  • Food:                           $3000

  • Lodging:                     $5000


Production Total:            $20,000


-Post Production Costs:

Cannes Lion Award winning post-production company, Coyote, has graciously offered to assist in providing their resources to procure the most talented to help handle post on Old Baby if we reach our goals.


  • Edit:                            $8000

  • VFX and Color:        $8000

  • Sound Design:         $6000


Post Production Total:  $20,000


-Cast:

There is a world here that needs to be filled with skilled creeps and well-crafted weirdos and the more the of the budget we can use to acquire those creeps and weirdos the better. We are already lining up to work with some talented up-and-comers as well as some amazing cameos but with your help we can populate this town with some amazing characters.


  • Leading Cast:           $6000

  • Supporting Cast:    $4000


Casting Total:                    $10,000


Perks Galore:



Now here is the best part, perks. Old Baby has only the best to offer in perks. Please browse our wide selection of desirable goods:

  1. $5 Thanks - A place in the credits and a place in our hearts.

  2. $20 "Special" Thanks - You get a special place in the credit crawl to the name of your choosing, any name… yes even that one.

  3. $25 Backstage Pass - Special access to our Snapchats from set - some special behind the scene footage as well as a Special Thanks

  4. $30 The Visitor - a postcard from Tolikaan plus perks 2 and 3

  5. $50 The Hole in the Wall - Poster plus perks 2 and 3

  6. $70 The Naked Man - Tshirtplus perks 2 and 3

  7. $100 Package Deal Shirt and poster plus perks 2 and 3

  8. $100 The Top of Father’s Shelf - Go where you were always told never to look and find a Special VHS edition of Old Baby plus perks 2 and 3 (Limited to 50)

  9. $200 The Collector - All Items 2 through 8 (Limited to 50)

  10. $300 The Cult Member - access to private Screening plus perks 2 and 3

  11. $500 Local Legend - A special featured prop from the film plus perks 2 and 3 Limited to 10

  12. $1000 National Hero - Associate producer (limit of 5)

  13. $5000 The Grand Old God - Executive producer

  14. $6000 Product Placement - Have 15 seconds dedicated to your product, service, or website featured in a commercial segment within the film.


Meeting our Goal

By supporting Old Baby you are taking part in the creation of something unique, a film outside of the safety and conventions of mainstream movies that would might never have the chance to be made if it wasn’t for the direct support of fans. Supporting this project goes beyond just creating this film. It goes to expanding the types of movies that get to be made and expanding the audiences for those movies as well. I want you to support this project not only as the filmmaker but as a lover of the strange and weird movies that live in the borders of obscurity.

Back on the ground floor, the direct impact you will have with your contributions will be noticeable. With micro budget movies every single penny counts toward something necessary to the process of making the film. You are contributing directly to obtaining talented cast and crew and keeping them alive, happy, and creative. You WILL be making a difference as every dollar donated is one less tear of frustration.

As with anything we are limited to what is achievable based on our budget. Not meeting meeting our goal means noticeable cuts in our production. I will do my best to make sure everything that makes it into the film is high


One of the most difficult cuts will be time. Everything will take a lot longer to finish and having to cut back on the scale of the production. My last feature took over 4 years to complete as we were unable to afford post services and thus everything had to be done ourselves. Having the funds to pay for post production would mean you get to see the film at its absolute best within a year, not 4 or 5.


Additionally on the importance of time, not having the funds to shoot everything in a consolidated schedule means breaking up the filming across weeks, even months, slowly piecing together the film.


Join the fun. Spread the word. Let's party.


As always, please share this project with anyone you know who is into strange, uncomfortable, otherworldly, occult, lo-fi nightmare, indie-horror. 

This is going to be a lot of fun.

-”Official Selection” of Los Angeles International Underground

-”Official Selection” of Another Hole in The Head

-”Official Selection” of Atlanta Underground Film Festival




Old Baby my second feature, the first being EXILE which was paid for out of pocket with production beginning in 2010. 

EXILE (feature 2014)

An isolated community has been controlled by an alien creature calling itself "The Angel." The children of this community reach an age where they must choose to become "blessed" like their parents, or "fall" and fend for themselves in the wastelands:
EXILE has been featured in a number of festivals.  It won “Audience Choice” at the 2014 H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival Portland (the first time in the festivals 19 years that the award had gone to a feature film) and “Best Feature” at Buried Alive Film Festival 2014. 

EXILE recently had its worldwide DVD and VOD release on April 7th, 2015 courtesy of Midnight Releasing.


This is what reviewers have to say about EXILE:

"Though crude and twisted EXILE is a fantastic little sci fi yarn juggling gore and horror with a skill I haven’t seen in a while." - Ain't it Cool News 


"This film is a testament to how small funds do not have to equal cheap quality." - Shattered Ravings


"Gruesome and thought provoking horror that was incredibly effective in all the best ways" - LA Horror.com


“Exile is testament to the fact that good movies can be made with small budgets and  is one of the best indie horror movies we’ve seen this decade” – Indie Horror Central.

Outside of my own projects I have also worked as a Production Designer and Special Effects Artist bringing out the blood and fears on films such as Hazard Jack: 


Children of Sorrow starring Bill Oberst:

And the graphic Shock TIll you Drop Halloween special Short Film Candy:

This year I am more excited than ever for the opportunity to make Old Baby.


Dollhairs and Scents:
Indie horror films are hard work. Things get bloody. There is always a lot of screaming. And then you have to get people in front of the camera and then you have to keep those people happy and alive…
-Production Costs:

The Oscar nominated production company, Dirty Robber, has generously agreed to supply the production with $50,000 worth of great production gear, but equipment is nothing without the right people using it. 

Camera dept:           $2000
Sound:                        $2000
G&E:                            $3000


Costume/Makeup: $2000
Prod. Design/Set:   $3000
Food:                           $3000

Lodging:                     $5000

Production Total:            $20,000

-Post Production Costs:

Cannes Lion Award winning post-production company, Coyote, has graciously offered to assist in providing their resources to procure the most talented to help handle post on Old Baby if we reach our goals.


Edit:                            $8000
VFX and Color:        $8000
Sound Design:         $6000


Post Production Total:  $20,000

-Cast:
There is a world here that needs to be filled with skilled creeps and well-crafted weirdos and the more the of the budget we can use to acquire those creeps and weirdos the better. We are already lining up to work with some talented up-and-comers as well as some amazing cameos but with your help we can populate this town with some amazing characters.


Leading Cast:           $6000
Supporting Cast:    $4000

Casting Total:                    $10,000

Perks Galore:

Now here is the best part, perks. Old Baby has only the best to offer in perks. Please browse our wide selection of desirable goods:

$5 Thanks - A place in the credits and a place in our hearts.
$20 "Special" Thanks - You get a special place in the credit crawl to the name of your choosing, any name… yes even that one.
$25 Backstage Pass - Special access to our Snapchats from set - some special behind the scene footage as well as a Special Thanks
$30 The Visitor - a postcard from Tolikaan plus perks 2 and 3
$50 The Hole in the Wall - Poster plus perks 2 and 3
$70 The Naked Man - Tshirtplus perks 2 and 3
$100 Package Deal Shirt and poster plus perks 2 and 3
$100 The Top of Father’s Shelf - Go where you were always told never to look and find a Special VHS edition of Old Baby plus perks 2 and 3 (Limited to 50)
 $200 The Collector - All Items 2 through 8 (Limited to 50)
 $300 The Cult Member - access to private Screening plus perks 2 and 3
 $500 Local Legend - A special featured prop from the film plus perks 2 and 3 Limited to 10
 $1000 National Hero - Associate producer (limit of 5)
 $5000 The Grand Old God - Executive producer
 $6000 Product Placement - Have 15 seconds dedicated to your product, service, or website featured in a commercial segment within the film.


Meeting our Goal



By supporting Old Baby you are taking part in the creation of something unique, a film outside of the safety and conventions of mainstream movies that would might never have the chance to be made if it wasn’t for the direct support of fans. Supporting this project goes beyond just creating this film. It goes to expanding the types of movies that get to be made and expanding the audiences for those movies as well. I want you to support this project not only as the filmmaker but as a lover of the strange and weird movies that live in the borders of obscurity.






Back on the ground floor, the direct impact you will have with your contributions will be noticeable. With micro budget movies every single penny counts toward something necessary to the process of making the film. You are contributing directly to obtaining talented cast and crew and keeping them alive, happy, and creative. You WILL be making a difference as every dollar donated is one less tear of frustration.





As with anything we are limited to what is achievable based on our budget. Not meeting meeting our goal means noticeable cuts in our production. I will do my best to make sure everything that makes it into the film is high






One of the most difficult cuts will be time. Everything will take a lot longer to finish and having to cut back on the scale of the production. My last feature took over 4 years to complete as we were unable to afford post services and thus everything had to be done ourselves. Having the funds to pay for post production would mean you get to see the film at its absolute best within a year, not 4 or 5.





Additionally on the importance of time, not having the funds to shoot everything in a consolidated schedule means breaking up the filming across weeks, even months, slowly piecing together the film.





Join the fun. Spread the word. Let's party.

 As always, please share this project with anyone you know who is into strange, uncomfortable, otherworldly, occult, lo-fi nightmare, indie-horror. 
This is going to be a lot of fun.

story:
RECOUNT SOUTH KOREA TO ITALIANS MAKING A GUIDEBOOK WITH MANY BREATHTAKING CLIPS!

Hi all!

I'm a girl who loves Asian culture and philosopy, and I wish Italians knew something more about this beautiful reality!
But.. recently I made a shocking discovery... 
ITALY DON'T HAVE AN ITALIAN GUIDE ABOUT SOUTH KOREA!!!
We have guides for Japan, China, Philippine and others, but there is nothing about South Korea!!
This is a very annoying thing for asian addicted and also for Korea, that is not known in Italy.  It is not good!


Who am I:

I'm a almost-graduated psychology student, I have traveled a lot in my life and I made a lot of cross-cultural and anthropological researches thanks to my professors! I love Asian cultures, and I studied them a lot; This year I want to built a research about the school system in South Korea, and in this occasion I've noticed that Italy haven't an italian guidebook about this beautiful country.



My Purpose:

I want to make the FIRST ITALIAN GUIDE of South Korea in Italian language, and I want to present the beauty of South Korea with some breathtaking clips that will be included in the guidebook through cd or website, available by a password that will be findable in the book!

- The guidebook will be a mixture of indications for tourists , curiosities about events of cultural relevance and narrations of the beauty of cities and people (and their traditions/innovations). Italians are very sensitive to narrations, and for this the guidebook will be not only a tourist guide!

- Clips included in the guidebook will build a real documentary: clips will capture the beauties of towns and surrounding places followed by my personal presentation in italian language; I will partecipate to cultural events (like festivals, traditional weddings and others) and I will record the innovations of this country (I will try to visit Samsung and other big Korean industries); I also will present the most beautiful mountains and seaside of South Korea, and more.



At this stage:
 - I can no longer travel to make a complete and good work.

- I can't afford good translation services to have good comprension of the events I 
will recount.

- I can't rent the equipment for the clips (I want make this work professional).

With a positive outcome for this campaign:

here are the spendings that I will be able to afford:

- Travel around the country to present it in the way that I told.

- Rent the equipment for the clips.

- Pay translators and interpreters for the interviews conducted in Korean and for events.

- Plan post-production: editing, sound mixing and more.

The Team:

The team is not been presented becouse I will choose it directly in Korea, and this to not spending much in the moving (I will be alone on the airplane) and to have Korean view of visual arts! If you want to be a part of the team and if you live in South Korea, send an e-mail to universitystudent60@gmail.com , and we will talk about it! 
It can be a good chance for photographers, film makers and others to be known outside of South Korea!


What YOU Will Get:

Your donation will not be only a donation:

- With a little donation you can help two entire countries! And if you are from South Korea, you can help your business directly (sponsoring it) or indirectly (with a new kind of tourists that are informated on your country)!

- As you can see in perks, I will include you in the list of "THANKS!" in the final clip! Send an e-mail to universitystudent60@gmail.com after donation to have your place!

- As you can see in perks, I can make a photo of you (or, If you are too far away from me, you can send a photo to me) and I will include it in the final gallery called "people" or we can make the photo toghether and include it in the final gallery! Send an e-mail to universitystudent60@gmail.com after got a perk to have your place!

- As you can see in perks, I can make a photo to your restaurant or Hotel or Bar (or more) and include it in the final gallery that will called "places" with the address of the place! Send an e-mail to universitystudent60@gmail.com after donation to have your place!



If I will not reach the entire goal:

If I will not reach the entire goal or if the goal will be not sufficient, I will make single guides about main cities and their districts; I will decide it in the middle of work (in Korea), becouse I cannot know what I will spend to make a good job!

If after the goal will remain extra money I will donate them to an intercultural association where South Korea can be known by other countries! I will decide what association with you, in the group I built for this project!

If I will reach only few dollars in donation: I WILL NEVER GIVE UP! I will build other campaigns (part 2, part 3, part 4) relative to this mission, until I will be able of recount at least one or two main towns! 

TOGHETHER WE CAN TRANSFORM A LITTLE DONATION IN A POWERFUL WORK OF INTERNATIONAL KNOWLWDGE!


How can you follow the project? 

You can follow progress and organization of the mission in the group I built for donors and for who appreciate the project:

RECOUNT SOUTH KOREA TO ITALIANS MAKING A GUIDEBOOK!




Be a Part of It!

Help Italians to discover South Korea and South Korea to be discovered by Italians!

Not everyone can help with donations but if you are interested in this project join the Facebook group and please share the crowdfunding event with your friends and families. 

Not everyone can make a donation, but a community that support the same aim is always a good thing! It can give birth to many good things!


Bitcoins are accepted here!! Even cryptocommunity can partecipate to the project!

Here is the QR code and address:

Address: 3KPzfFFauyWYmW5GkBFUUKiNd24crU3UTD

Spread the word!! Good luck for all your life!

story:
Saint Peter's Church has been ministering on the territory of Russia, in the city of Kursk for the past sixteen years. Our Church has about 200 members. Confessionally speaking we are evangelical Christians. 

The official page of our church you can find in facebook: https://www.facebook.com/speter.kursk and in vk: https://vk.com/st_peter


The majority of our church members are young people, from teenagers to young adults who are actively involved in all of the ministries and outreaches of the church. Our church has a thriving youth ministry, an effective rehab center for alcoholics and drug addicts, a vital ministry to orphans, and 3 worship teams. 


We have weekly church cell-groups, where believers pray together and study the Word of God together. Our church takes an active role in the social life of our city Kursk, holding  free events to help young people to get involved in sports and so that they develop a healthy lifestyle instead of turning to drugs or alcohol. 



We also hold festive Easter concerts every year. For young people we conduct an educational program where we paint the vision of Christian values for marriage and the family. By this, we are able to reach out to people with the gospel of Jesus Christ. The official page of our youth ministry you can see here: https://vk.com/club80922479

Every summer we conduct summer Christian sport camp for teenagers. The official page of our summer camp you can see here: https://vk.com/shl_raduga

Our church also conducts the Bible School for children where kids start to study the Word of God.

We try to support orphans in orphanages. Our young leaders visit orphanages and organize performances for kids there. The official page of our orphanage ministry you can see here:  https://vk.com/club63418050

Evangelizing and spreading the Kingdom of God have always been top priorities for us. Our church organizes missions trips and outreaches to the various towns in our region. Our leaders that go on these trips, establish home groups and train up new leaders in the faith. We also actively partner with churches from other regions of Russia, the Ukraine, Belarus, and Poland to help  organize international conferences.

We gladly accept missionaries from South Africa and India. Every year dear guests from the USA (Houston Worship Centre) join us to hold “Revival Generation” conference. The official page of "Revival Generation Kursk Conference" you can see here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1594467740800293/ 

We consider our mission to be spiritual awakening among people and training up the next generation of Christians.

The Lord is abundantly blessing the development of our church. 3 other churches have been planted by our church. In spite of all this, we have never had our own building to meet in and we have always had to rent different places in the city to meet in. In the past 16 years we have met at 10 different locations. But we have always had a clear vision of our mission of establishing the Kingdom of God. Because of this, 8 years ago God blessed us with the opportunity to obtain an unfinished municipal facility.

For the past 8 years we have not been given permission to do some reconstruction work on the facility to suit it for our church meetings. Now, the Lord has given us all the needed permissions to finally proceed with the reconstruction work on the building.

St. Peter's Church needs to have it's own building and that's why we need to get our building done quickly so we can move in. We gathered enough of our own finances to start the reconstruction process. In April we took a step of faith, trusting in the Holy Spirit, and began reconstruction. 



However, for the completion of our building we need your help.  We want to move into our new building by the end of this year. To do that, we created this campaign. Dear brothers and sisters, we will be genuinely grateful to you, if God impresses on your hearts to help us in building His body in Kursk Russia through us. Every dollar that you sow will work to establish the Kingdom of God, and it will bring forth fruit!

Latest news from our construction site you can find here: https://vk.com/club91582574

story:
Christmas Ranch Short Summary

A rebellious girl is sent to stay on her grandmother’s horse ranch for Christmas. She falls into friendship with her grandmother’s pony and becomes determined to help save the ranch from foreclosure.  

  • Hello, my name is Douglas B. Maddox and I like to make films that entertain, educate and inspire. This is my first time using a crowd-sourcing platform like Indiegogo. I have heard so many success stories. I thought it was time to dig in and launch a program. I would like to tell you about our story and hope that you will come along on this filmmaking journey with me and it will be a success. I began making videos, films and documentaries in 1998. Since then, I have had the privilege of making many stories come to life through video, documentaries and film. I see the power of film making to give a platform to tell great stories. When you tell a great story, people will listen and sometimes a life is changed for the better that story in film. My hope is to tell stories of encouragement and redemption because that is my story and probably your story as well. Please see some of my work on IMDB.com http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3017172/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cr3

  • That brings us to Christmas Ranch. This story is about a rebellious girl that is sent to stay on her grandmother’s horse ranch for Christmas. She falls into friendship with her grandmother’s pony and becomes determined to help save the ranch from foreclosure. This story is about cross generational relationships and their importance in our families and in our lives. Also, It is a tribute to all our grandparents who love and pray for all of us. You are very special and we celebrate you! This film will also enjoy the beautiful horses and backdrop of Maryland horse farms has to offer the world. After all we are the home of the Preakness. Please support this project to tell this story of love and hope. Hope is believing!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $70,000 to produce this film:

  • Christmas Ranch is a ultra low budget film.
  • Independent films can range from $10,000 to $10,000,000. What I am interested in doing is bringing the vision of Christmas Ranch to life through film through a team of wonderful industry professionals that are discounting their costs tremendously for this project. I was looking for a film that could get the message across with as little company moves as possible but still retain the high quality of film standard that we are used to seeing from Hollywood films. Since this is an ultra low budget, much of that will go toward quality acting from Screen Actors Guild like the following actors: Jessica Lange, John Corbett, Sean Astin, Ben Davies and the like. Please give generously so that we can bring in top actors and top crew for this special family film.

The Impact

With your giving and involvement in this film, Christmas Ranch, we will be able to get this film out to DBM Films’ buyers throughout the world, making a difference in people’s lives both here in the United States and throughout the planet. Did you know that the United States is the largest exporter of films in the world. 

  • DBM Films has successfully been distributing films through the world for the last 12 years.
  • One of our recent films, The Bill Collector, starring Danny Trejo was on the shelves at Walmart and with your help we can get Christmas Ranch there as well. See some of our work on IMDB.com http://www.imdb.com/company/co0376314/?ref_=fn_...

Risks & Challenges

There are risks in everyday life as well as putting a film together. It is like aligning planetary bodies. But it is doable! 

  • The creative challenge always excites me and that is why I think this process is so natural for me and our team.
  • Yes it takes a team and I have been working with some of the crew for over 15 years. I really like this crew. They do terrific work and I am blessed to have them!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot give monetarily, we can use your help with catering, extras work, assisting production and getting the word out about the campaign and film. Please reach out to me and let’s see where you may fit in this wonderful world of filmmaking! Let’s make a movie! Hope is Believing!

What I am interested in doing is bringing the vision of Christmas Ranch to life through film through a team of wonderful industry professionals that are discounting their costs tremendously for this project. I was looking for a film that could get the message across with as little company moves as possible but still retain the high quality of film standard that we are used to seeing from Hollywood films. Since this is an ultra low budget, much of that will go toward quality acting from Screen Actors Guild like the following actors: Jessica Lange, John Corbett, Sean Astin, Ben Davies and the like. Please give generously so that we can bring in top actors and top crew for this special family film.    The Impact With your giving and involvement in this film, Christmas Ranch, we will be able to get this film out to DBM Films’ buyers throughout the world, making a difference in people’s lives both here in the United States and throughout the planet. Did you know that the United States is the largest exporter of films in the world.   DBM Films has successfully been distributing films through the world for the last 12 years.  One of our recent films, The Bill Collector, starring Danny Trejo was on
 the shelves at Walmart and with your help we can get Christmas Ranch there as well. See some of our work on IMDB.com 
http://www.imdb.com/company/co0376314/?ref_=fn_...
    Risks & Challenges  There are risks in everyday life as well as putting a film together. It is like aligning planetary bodies. But it is doable!   The creative challenge always excites me and that is why I think this process is so natural for me and our team.  Yes it takes a team and I have been working with some of the crew for 
over 15 years. I really like this crew. They do terrific work 
and I am blessed to have them!    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you cannot give monetarily, we can use your help with catering, extras work, assisting production and getting the word out about the campaign and film. Please reach out to me and let’s see where you may fit in this wonderful world of filmmaking! Let’s make a movie! Hope is Believing!

story:
Short Summary

 Hello my name is Leonel A Severino and I am the founder of Witness Entertainment LLC. I am 25 years old and was born in Salem Massachusetts but moved to the state of New Jersey to be close to New York because of the fact of that they are more actors/actresses to contribute. I always wanted to create films because creating a film is like creating brand new life and life styles.

  This campaign is very important to us because we want to change the world, as far as how people view the world to a better living. How you ask? Well with this short film; “Detectives for Life” shows how two people that were totally strangers to each other in the beginning of their career became practically family. We also want to sell DVD’s of not just this short film but of all the ones that we create. Why you ask again? Well the Witness Entertainment LLC is a company of hope, we want to contribute at least %30 of what this company makes towards Military Men and Women, Cancer, and homeless cost.

  The contributors will help us achieve us helping others. Also will help us show the world how to treat others how we would like to be treated.

What We Need & What You Get

  So for this project we need to raise $600 USD. This is going to help us get the equipment we need such as the fake guns, fake blood, fake drugs, fake badges, and the outfits for each actors. It will also help us feed the actors/extras and pay some expenses.

  For those who help us reach our goals will get unique perks. They are listed on the right side. We here in Witness Entertainment LLC want to show you that we can give back to the world. Just remember anything will help. If we don’t reach our goal you will get a refund as soon as possible.

The Impact

  Our Project is very valuable to our contributor and the world because with a little help we will change the world. We will record every time we go out to feed the homeless, or donate to the Military or cancer Organization. Help us change the world.

Risk & Challenges

  The risk we have can be not enough extras. But with achieving our goals we can provide food and put them on our credits which will boost the chances to get enough extras to make this project come true. I will go out personally talk to each individual and explain to him or her how important it is not just for the company but also for our contributors.

 Other Ways You Can Help

  Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

You can share the word out to your family and friends. You can easily share it on any of your social media just by clicking the Indiegogo share tools. That’s all there is to it.

Thank you, and hope to achieve this with you!

story:
- - [contenu en français ci-dessous] - -


Two Shots of Dust in a Desert )'(

You would be hard-pressed to find a Mexican Martini outside of Austin, Texas. We are going to bring it to the playa for Burning Man 2015 and show you why an entire city is already going crazy over it. Destination: Black Rock City, Nevada. And, as a "thank you" perk for our donors, we have our nearest and dearest (and best kept) playa secret -- The Playa Passport.


What Is a Mexican Martini?

Burning Man has a few bars. You can count them on two hands, but they're there. Actually, I might need a few more hands to count them on. Every bar on the playa has one thing in common -- one unifying trait -- not one of them serves a Mexican Martini.

El Paso started the margarita, and Dallas holds claim to the frozen margarita, but they've both been crying in a corner ever since the Mexican Martini opened shop in Austin. Restaurants and bars can either live or die based on the quality of this singular drink. True fact. So... what is it?

You take tequila, Cointreau, olive juice, lime juice, a splash of orange juice, and some secret sauce, then you give them all a little dance party in a shaker. The shaker is part of the ritual. Once they're all danced out, you pour the mix into a salted martini glass that has olives in it with a lime on the rim. What you do not do is drink it. If you drink it, you're always going to want more of it. Save yourself that pain. It's the best drink on the planet and we're bringing it to Burning Man.

Know Your Terms:

  • The Original: The classic Mexican Martini cocktail, which we've been perfecting for more than a decade. If you don't tell us what kind you want, we'll make you an original.
  • Sweet: Extra Cointreau, often saltless or with sugar.
  • Briny: Extra olive juice and lime juice.
  • Muddy:  This is a playa-only Mexican Martini, as it will have a sprinkling of playa dust mixed into it.


What Is a Playa Passport?

May your passport live to be as dust-beaten as mine has. I love to travel and my favorite burners are also travelers. We collect passport stamps and stories along the way and it's a natural twin-spirit for burners.
My sister Gaea bought us these notebooks in 2007, and we turned them into passports for the playa. Every sticker you get from a camp becomes another passport stamp to mark your journey. It's just large enough (5" x 3.8125") to hold all of your Burning Man tickets.  This year, we are going all out, with the "Playa Passport" stamp on the cover above the )'(, and our own "immigration stamp" on the inside with spaces to: paste/draw/duct tape your photo, write your playa name(s), write your camps and affiliations, and write down the years that you've burned. There's even a line to put your grand playa name -- as we prefer Jim Clark's "Grand Playa" term instead of using "default world".

There is plenty of space to write down when and where you'll be dancing, as well as the names of all your dusty lovelies that you meet out in the desert. It's become the first thing I get ready whenever prepping for Burning Man.

You can secure your playa passport as a "thank you" perk at the $40 donation level -- The Burner -- to be picked up "on playa". For shipping options, check out "The Absentee" donor.

10 are already reserved. That leaves only 290 of these -- which is about three or four theme camps. When they're gone, they're gone. Sorry.


The More You Know

  • Each playa passport is made from 100% post-consumer recycled materials, and is manufactured carbon-neutral with no chlorine processing. These are made in America; no sweatshops. Period. We've worked very closely with the manufacturers on the design. In proper Burning Man style, they're truly a work of art. We wouldn't have it any other way.
  • A portion of the proceeds from the project will be donated to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital via Amazon Smile.
  • Any unopened alcohol from the Mexican Martinis will be donated to DPW during Exodus. They build our city and they scour the dust after everyone's left. We love our DPW crews!
  • All materials used in the Mexican Martinis and Playa Passports will be reusable, compostable, or recyclable; no landfill.


What the Critics Are Saying


"I'm sorry, how did you get this number again?" ~The Economist


"A playa what? Wait, who is this?" ~The Washington Post


"No, this isn't Larry. No. No, you can't talk to him. I'm hanging up, I'm..." ~BRC HQ


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share: Share, share, share. Please get the word out. Help spread the word with the share buttons above. It helps a lot!
  • Playa Bar Time Slots: So much mad thanks to The BuzzInn, who has already given us three time slots to start off with. We need four more time slots, preferably from two different bars. We will ID and bring all the supplies needed. It needs to be open to the public and with day slots available. We've reserved two playa passports for each bar that donates time slots.
  • 1 Spare Ticket: We are one ticket short at the moment. Hopefully that will be taken care of during the OMG Sale. However, anyone who has a spare ticket and can mail it to us, we have two playa passports set aside just for you and one heck of a huge playa hug to give you!


Our Stretch Goals

This is our experimental year for both the Mexican Martini and the Playa Passport. Both have different stretch goals.

Stretch Goals for Playa Passports: For all those who get a Playa Passort, we want your feedback. The first extra funds from the campaign will be going to next year's Playa Passports. Once you've loved them and used them, tell us what you think, and we will bring them back to Burning Man in 2016.

Stretch Goals for Mexican Martinis: This was originally going to be the creation of an entire bar. However, our lead engineer is being put on a plane to Scotland. We are going to miss you Skybreak (and you, too, Ren)! If we reach an extra stretch of $2500 for the Playa Passport stretch goals, then we will save the remaining funds to invest in building the "Two Shots of Dust" bar in 2016.


Fine Art for "The (Wo)Man" Donors

We have ten slots open for "The (Wo)Man" donors. I am leading the project, and in the grand playa I am a world renowned and acclaimed fractal artist who appears on the covers of many books, buildings, and on album art (Daft Punk, not joking). For you, our top donors, I will be mailing you your choice from one of two fine art fractal prints (12in x 18in), in a jet black box frame, to be mailed post-burn. This beautiful fractal landscape will remind you of how you helped in 2015, and it comes with our incredible gratitude for your contribution.

Of course, along with the fine art fractal landscape, you'll also get all the other perks of playa passports, passport stamps, and shaker passes. You are the best!




Note: Art for the project was created by Jaya Prime and Alexandra from München.

Note: The term "cocktail" should be in no way associated with shirtcocking.

++: Bonus items marked with ++ are for entertainment purposes only. The "What the Critics Are Saying" section is entirely fictional.


- - [contenu en français] - -


2 shots de poussières dans le désert

Vous aurez du mal à trouver des Mexican Martini en dehors de Austin au Texas. Nous allons en apporter à la Playa pour Burning-Man 2015 et vous montrer pourquoi une ville entière est déjà dingue de ça. Destination : Black Rock City, Nevada. Et, pour le cadeau de remerciement pour nos contributeurs, nous avons notre secret de la Playa le plus cher (et le mieux gardé) -- Le passeport de la Playa.


Le Mexican Martini, qu'est-ce que c'est ?

Burning-Man a quelques bars. Vous pouvez les compter sur deux mains, mais ils sont là. En fait, je pourrais avoir besoin de quelques mains supplémentaires pour les compter. Chaque bar de la Playa a une chose en commun -- un trait qui les unifie -- aucun d'eux ne servent de Mexican Martini.

El Paso a commencé avec la Margharita, et Dallas détient la Margharita congelée, mais ils se sont mis à pleurer dans un coin quand ils ont vus qu'Austin a ouvert des lieux où les Mexican Martini étaient servis. Les restaurants et les bars peuvent soit vivre soit mourir, selon la qualité de cette boisson singulière. C'est un fait réel. Donc... Qu'est-ce que c'est ?

Vous prenez de la Tequila, du Cointreau, de l'huile d'olive, du jus de citron, un soupçon de jus d'orange et un peu d'assaisonnement secret, et vous les faites tous danser dans un shaker. Le shaker est une partie du rituel. Une fois qu'ils ont tous dansé, vous versez le mélange dans un verre de Martini salé avec des olives à l'intérieur et avec un quart de citron sur le bord du verre. Ne buvez pas cela. Si vous le buvez, vous allez en vouloir toujours plus. Épargnez-vous cette douleur. C'est la meilleure boisson de la planète et nous l'apportons à Burning-Man.

Connaissez vos goûts :

  • L'Original : Le cocktail classique du Mexican Martini qui a été perfectionné depuis plus d'une décennie. Si vous ne nous dites pas le style que vous souhaitez, nous vous ferons un original.
  • Le sucré : Cointreau extra, souvent sans sel et avec du sucre.
  • Le saumâtre : Huile d'olive extra et jus de citron.
  • Le terreux : C'est un Mexican Martini qui n'existe que sur la Playa, car il aura de la poussière du désert saupoudrée dans ce mélange.


Le Passeport de la Playa, qu'est ce que c'est ?

Que votre passeport vive de la poussière comme le mien. J'aime voyager et mes burners préférés sont aussi des voyageurs. Nous collectionnons les timbres des passeports et les histoires durant notre chemin et c'est un esprit jumeau naturel pour les burners.

Gaea, ma sœur, nous a acheté ces carnets en 2007, et nous les avons transformé en passeports pour la Playa. Chaque étiquette que vous avez d'un camp devient un autre timbre sur votre passeport qui marque votre voyage. Et c'est suffisamment large pour contenir tous vos tickets de Burning-Man.

Cette année, nous allons tous dehors, avec le timbre de "passeport de la Playa" sur la couverture au-dessus du )'(, et notre propre "timbre d'immigration" à l'intérieur avec de l'espace pour : copier, dessiner, canaliser vos photos, écrire votre nom de Playa, noter vos camps et affiliations et également les années où vous avez été à Burning-Man. Il y a même une ligne pour mettre votre nom de la Grand Playa -- Nous préférons le terme de Jim Clark "Grand Playa" au lieu d'utiliser le terme "default world".

Il y a plein d'espace pour écrire quand et où vous irez danser et également les noms de vos amours poussiéreux que vous rencontrerez dans le désert. C'est la première chose à laquelle je suis paré lorsque je me prépare pour Burning-Man.

Vous pouvez avoir votre passeport de la Playa "sur la Playa" comme un cadeau de remerciement, un "Merci" au niveau d'une contribution de 40 $ -- regardez la partie sur la droite appelée "le Burner"--. Pour les options d'expédition, regardez la partie sur la droite appelée "The Absentee". Je vous invite à regarder toutes les sections possibles des contributeurs, toujours sur votre droite dans cette page

10 sont déjà reservés. Il en reste seulement 290 -- Quand ils sont partis, ils sont partis. Désolé.


)'( - - Thank You - - )'(

story:
In Short

Sent by the Israelis, a mysterious man pays a visit to the last remaining Holocaust survivor on his last day on earth, trying to persuade him to use cryogenics in order to exist forever.  Why?  The Israelis, he claims, won't let him die since they need him to remind the world of all the atrocities  that took place during WWII. The man, himself cryogenized, believes in eternal youth and fantasy and wants the Holocaust survivor to join him. The survivor is reluctant, and raises the additional question whether Israel would want him knowing he is gay.

This is a story about the juxtaposition of two cultures, one that clings to the past and one that clings to the future. It's a social and political observation of both, told by way of fantasy while raising the question: how far should we go to justify the reason behind our deeds?

Our Story

I have recently returned from a trip to Auschwitz. It is a devastating place. One cannot grasp the magnitude of the Holocaust until one visits that place. It is truly horrifying, and survivors are nothing less than heroes in my mind.

Yet, I resent the cynical use that is being done with the memory of the Holocaust and its survivors. Namely justifying other wrongdoings, using the Holocaust as justification for it. Israel was established on the premise of building a Jewish home so history cannot repeat itself. It is true and just. But Israel is obsessed with the past. From an early age we learn all about WWII and its disaster and how we should never forget. Of course we shouldn’t, but it doesn’t mean that on the way we commit other crimes.

This obsession becomes tremendously clearer when juxtaposed with the US. While Israel is obsessed with the past, the US is obsessed with the future. The first delves into history, the other wants to live forever. The one likes pain, the other beauty. 

It is with a critical lens that I choose to delve into this commentary now. Having spent vast swaths of my life in both countries I have come away with two very different viewpoints:  Israel uses the past, the Holocaust in particular as a reason for everything it does to justify its existence including ruling over other people, while the United States and its pursuit of eternal youth and beauty can’t seem to remember 6 months ago, let alone decades.  I ask, is there no place in between?

I thought what it would be like if I take the two greatest symbols of these themes and introduce them to each other, and watch them make case for their points.

This is this place, somewhere between reality and fantasy. 

That is this film.

The Impact

A film that doesn’t make its audience question their set of beliefs is not a film worth making. It is the meaning of art.

The Team

I am lucky to have two of my colleagues to collaborate with me on this project:

Executive Producer Kristofer Updike (Producer Steam) http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1728071/?ref_=fn_al_...

DP James Adolphus (Tremor, Postmortem, Steam and August) http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1498362/?ref_=fn_al_...

My previous work, referenced here: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1391266/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

Please help us make this happen.  Anything you can contribute we would appreciate greatly.  If you are offering your specific film experience or services for free please email: Kristofer directly at kristoferupdike@yahoo.com.

This film is scheduled to shoot Fall 2015 or Winter 2016 in New York City.

story:
Angle of Approach is a dark comedy about two sisters with a violent past.  They want to escape their daily trials at work by enjoying a relaxing round of golf.  Their day takes a nasty turn when they meet an obnoxious husband and wife on the golf course looking for trouble.
We have all local talent playing in this movie.  We have Briana Looby, Joslyn Wood, Aaron Bushong, Jill Sanchez, and Heather Bullers.  We also have Chris Forza as our Director of Photography.
We need your help to make this movie happen.  Please donate as much as you can to support our project.  We are offering incentives, such as name in the credits, posters, DVD, and an invite to the premiere.
So please support Angle of Approach!!!
